lore: After Zonte became a God, he returned to the tower to prevent its collapse. After dispelling the magic overload, he found this creature next to the Celestial Occultist at point 0. Its magic powers were extraordinary, although insignificant next to Zonte's. After getting rid of the Failed Experiment and expelling the Occultists, he found that it reappeared under certain circumstances. The residual energy from Ainsworth's experiment had permanently linked the creature to the tower's structure.
menagerieDialog: (It has an extremely punchable expression on its face.)
(This creature has such a goofy face that even your normally-stoic personality is no match for the temptation to knock it flat on its slimy ass.)
(It never. Stops. Laughing. Hyuh-huh-huh-huh. ENOUGH.)
(For some reason, you find its undeterrable happiness to be quite obnoxious.)
(It's nibbiling at random bits of dust and debris off the floor. You should really find it some decent food to eat.)
name: Failed Experiment

lore: It is said that the Bards were born of songs and verses, of art and creativity. The truth is that, to a certain extent, this statement is correct.\n\nThe Bard Balladeer's songs are full of love and tenderness. When two people who are attracted to each other listen to this creature's music, they are enraptured by an intense romantic feeling that pushes them to kiss.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Balladeer

lore: Bards are mute creatures, but they can activate the synapses of the brain of the people around them to transmit their music.\n\nIn the festivals of some villages, a Bard Jongleur is released to tell stories to the people. Although some Jongleurs have a great talent for music, the truth is that the joy and fun that comes from listening to them are also the fruit of their power.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Jongleur

lore: Bards are the residual energy left behind when the soul of a literary artist or a musician leaves its body for the afterlife. As with Shades, this does not always happen.\n\nThe Bard Minstrel's harp is more an ornament than an instrument, but when this creature runs its fingers through the "strings", it transmits soft melodies and beautiful words to the minds of the people around it. Anyone nearby will feel the imperative need to declare their love to their romantic interest.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Minstrel

lore: For the soul of a literary artist or a musician to become a Bard, the presence of magic around it is required.\n\nThe verses of the Bard Poet are sad and arouse melancholy in listeners. However, its words suggest the transience of time and the futility of quarrels and conflicts, especially among loved ones. As a result, many estranged mothers, fathers and children reunite and solve their differences.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Poet

lore: Bards long for the sounds of their "voice" to reach as many people as possible. However, the effects of their music and their apparent inability to stop their own mind-affecting traits have led many towns and cities to permanently ban these creatures.\n\nThe songs of the Bard Trovatore ridicule politicians, sometimes with very well-chosen words. Listening to them produces laughter, but also arouses feelings of rebellion against authority.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Trovatore

lore: The wealthy people in the great cities generally have a Bard in their mansions, who they keep in the basement until its presence is required.\n\nThe poems of the Bard Versifier speak of nature, of the singing of birds, green on green, the wind whispering through the leaves of the trees. Its verses push even the busiest people to abandon their chores and take a day off away from the bustle of the city.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)

lore: Only the centaurs with the keenest eyesight can promote to the rank of Ranger. This is largely due to the fact that this species has poor night vision, a big disadvantage when their strategy requires them to gallop at night. Centaur Rangers are able to interpret footprints and use them to estimate the direction taken by the enemy, something that in many cases allows them to lay a perfect ambush, shooting comfortably at their opponents from a safe distance.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Ranger

lore: Centaurs have been enemies with the Elves of the Cutthroat Jungle for centuries, even before the Unification of Rodia.\n\nNaturally, Warriors form the bulk of their armies, and though their training is not as hard as that of the other ranks, they tend to be better prepared for battle, as it is their only focus. Their marches are known to be extremely quiet, but that is because most Centaurs take advantage of their ability to take a nap while galloping.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Warrior

lore: Like Duelists, their fighting style is not as rudimentary as that of the Warrior and requires different skills. When a battle begins, Centaur Wranglers quickly identify the most skilled warriors on the other side and disarm them with precise snaps of their whips. They are in charge of keeping the rhythm of the marches with cracks of their whips, to make sure the sleeping Centaurs keep going in the same direction.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Wrangler

lore: Wernicke the Raider is the most powerful Centaur warrior. Two hundred years ago, when the Elves managed to find a way into his village, he tried to protect his people armed only with a thick branch, but he was killed by the arrows of his enemies. When everything seemed lost, his heart began to beat once again in his chest. He had become Gonfurian's Chosen. Overflowing with new life, and alone, he managed to contain the invaders until the other warriors came to his aid.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Raider

lore: The tests to achieve the rank of Runner are so strenuous that many of the Centaur candidates end up injured, never to gallop again. Centaur Runners can hold their own in battle by using spells and shield slams, but their main purpose is to look for supplies during long trips to feed the large Centaur parties.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Runner

lore: Centaurs are very territorial and go to great lengths to protect their home, a city built on top of a mountain which can only be accessed through a cave behind a waterfall.\n\nCentaur Chasers constantly watch the surroundings and chase away whoever gets closer than they should to the entrance.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!

lore: Elves are devoted protectors of nature that try to spread their ideas and customs to the rest of Rodia, by any means necessary.\n\nClerics are usually the spokespersons of their message, though if they are not treated with respect, as is usually the case, they let their maces do the talking instead. In battle, they prefer being on the front lines and try to make the enemies lower their guard so that another Elf can take advantage and attack them by surprise.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Cleric

lore: Only an Elf beyond the age of 300 can aspire to become a true Monk. Not using weapons is part of their path, as they believe nature must be preserved intact, without a single scratch, and belongings are but a weight for the body. Therefore, their only food is the energy that the forest itself wishes to grant them. Despite their radical views, Monks do not impose their beliefs on others, and they are treated with veneration.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Monk

lore: During the new moon phase, the Elves usually climb into the treetops to gaze at the velvety night sky, speckled with countless stars. There, Elf Mystics sing ancient songs in a solemn voice about, among other similar things, the rustling of leaves when they are swayed by the wind. Besides appeasing the soul of their people, they can channel the energy of the forest into their scepters and use it to blow up their enemies.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Mystic

lore: The Elves inhabit the dark forests in the southern regions of the Rodian Cutthroat Jungle, and they are not exactly kind to visitors. The Centaurs tried to conquer their home thousands of years ago, and there has been little love between the two races since then.\n\nWhen an Elf Barbarian finds someone lurking around its territory, it will charge towards them with a battle cry, then jump while raising its weapons to deliver a powerful blow.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Barbarian

lore: Elves feed on leaves, roots and fruit, never harming other creatures in the process. Therefore, an Elf Huntsman does not hunt animals, but intruders, or as they call them: "Utter fools" or "Insolent creatures who think they don't need an invitation to enter our domains and sully them with their disrespectful customs". Elf Huntsmen are the fastest and most skilled. They jump among the branches and hide in the leafy trees to remain undetected before they fall on their enemies and end their lives.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Huntsman

lore: Elves do not live forever, and the older they get, the more vulnerable to disease they become. However, their longevity is legendary, and some even live beyond a thousand years of age.\n\nElves are also extremely agile and clever, and Elf Rogues are trained to harness the maximum potential of their bodies. They move stealthily in the shadows and determine their enemies' movements while looking for the right moment to strike a mortal blow.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Rogue

lore: The movements of an Abomination's body are controlled by the main head. However, the task of casting spells falls to the secondary head, and sometimes they find it hard to agree on what to do during battle.\n\nFree Ritual Abominations often gather in the Unsullied Meadows to gaze at the stars in silence. During that time, they have access to each other's minds and share their thoughts of peace and serenity.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Ritual Abomination

lore: Abominations are a result of Tartarith's actions in the Torture Chamber. To create them, he overfeeds an individual for weeks, and then implants a second head on their shoulder.\n\nThe Abomination Brute is the only one of its kind that is prone to violence, as well as the only one who is good at it. It lets its enemies get as close as possible by holding back, then grabs them by the arms and rips them off with its brutal strength.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Abomination Brute

lore: Abominations are weak-willed creatures who can be easily manipulated. Their two heads communicate by babbling, usually at the same time, and they can understand what other people are telling them. As most Abominations used to be humans, they are easy prey for Ghouls and Forsaken in the wild.\n\nFlesh Abominations often join small bands of criminals or big crime syndicates that accept them in exchange for protection.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Flesh Abomination

lore: Tartarith created the Abominations to protect the Torture Chamber, but he eventually decided that it would be more fun to set them free and let them sow chaos in Rodia. However, when they do not feel the presence of the God of Punishment, most Abominations disobey his orders.\n\nThe Abomination Volatile despises violence, and it prefers to grab its enemies and throw them far away so that they stop hurting it. Naturally, this has ended many lives.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Abomination Volatile

lore: Abominations keep some parts of their true identity, although they have lost most of their memories. Both heads can access the other's mind to know what they think at all times.\n\nWhen the God of Punishment is in a hurry to create more Abominations, the result is usually a Gore Abomination. This creature has an unusual amount of blood in it, which erupts from its body when it receives damage.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Gore Abomination

lore: Although Abominations seem to lead an extremely painful and unbearable existence, the truth is that they do not feel pain or sadness. These creatures live in a state of perpetual obtundation and calm, and they are rather given to slouching in the shade without doing anything.\n\nWandering Abominations especially prefer to ignore conflicts and devote themselves to contemplating the landscape in silence. Unfortunately, many criminal bands enslave them and force them to work.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Wandering Abomination

lore: The Nixes are an intelligent species that lives in underground cities. At present, they are not at war with any other.\n\nSome Nixes are known to leave no trace after a murder. In the surface lands they are called Nix Creepers. They can sneak into well-protected mansions, bypassing any security in the gardens and corridors without being discovered. The next morning, everything will remain intact except for their target, which will have become a corpse.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.
My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.
This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Creeper

lore: In Nix societies, females occupy higher places in the hierarchy. They hold the moral authority and leadership, and always govern through a council of eight women.\n\nThe Nix Guardian usually works as a personal bodyguard for great merchants or crime bosses, and also does the dirty work when it is necessary. When two Nixes meet because of this, they fight to the death on an equal footing, with their faces uncovered.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.

This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Guardian

lore: In the past, Nixes had a certain animosity toward the humans, and a great antagonism toward the Elves. After several centuries of war, they signed a peace treaty when Lister sent his Priests around the world.\n\nOut of all the surface Nixes, only Imposters still work for their people. Their objective is to find any men of their species who have escaped the underground cities to bring them back and have them suffer their deserved punishment: an unspeakable torture that lasts for a week.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.
My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.
This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Imposter

lore: Only female Nixes are allowed to visit the surface and be in contact with other intelligent species. Indeed, any male Nixes who wish to trade with the humans and dwarves who visit their cities must be accompanied by a woman at all times.\n\nAlthough Nix Informers usually work for large corporations, they sometimes act as government spies who, if necessary, eliminate key figures that could jeopardize their interests.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.
My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.

lore: Some Nixes are integrated into human society. Many work as hired killers due to their renowned agility, stealth, and skill with knives.\n\nWhen someone hires the services of a Nix Scoundrel, it is very clear that the target is going to suffer before dying. These creatures are bloodthirsty murderers who are experts in torture, and experts in leaving gruesome crime scenes. They usually also murder the target's family in front of their eyes.

My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.
This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Scoundrel

lore: Nixes who work as hired killers wear a mask to prevent anyone from recognizing them, but also to indicate their specialty. In their daily life, surface Nixes are treated with a certain forced respect for fear of their abilities.\n\nNix Shadowjumpers are especially dangerous, and their services are the most expensive ones to hire. Through their knowledge of magic, they can use the Path of the Damned to appear behind their target, as long as they have one of their personal items.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.
My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.
This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Shadowjumper

lore: Plague Doctors have a strange fondness for traveling the world, curing any sick creature they find.\n\nWhen a Plague Alchemist finds a wounded person, it does not merely heal their wounds. With a whisper, it asks the patient whether they were caused by another. With just a description, this creature finds the perpetrator and waits for them to become distracted. Then it pours the contents of its test tube into a glass. When drunk, the strange liquid causes the same injuries on the aggressor's body.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Alchemist

lore: Plague Herbalists have a prodigious knowledge about the effects of plants. Indeed, the healers of other species learned many of their secrets from them.\n\nPlague Herbalists detest rulers who use their position to gain wealth and power at the expense of the lives of their subjects. After a great victory, the Herbalist sneaks under the banquet table, where it splashes a special compound, imbued with its own power, that discourages the sovereign, making them lose their will to continue fighting.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Herbalist

lore: Plague Doctors are shy and quiet, and rarely communicate with other creatures. They sometimes make gestures with their hands or move their heads in a certain direction to point out materials and tools they need.\n\nThe Plague Quack hates fake doctors. It travels through towns and cities looking for possible frauds, and when it finds one it simply heals the sick people and disappears before the patients' family members unleash their anger on the imposter.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Quack

lore: When the city of Andolin was quarantined because of a terrible disease, Plague Doctors began to appear mysteriously. In less than a week, they healed the sick and disappeared as quickly as they arrived.\n\nSome wounds or illnesses are too serious for even a Plague Doctor to heal. The Plague Scholar knows when to give up, but before doing so it prepares a potion that emotionally relaxes the sick person and their closest people so that they can calmly accept what is to come.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Scholar

lore: Plague Doctors are believed to come from another dimension. Nothing is known about their reproductive cycle or their customs, and no one has seen them sleep or settle anywhere.\n\nAlthough it has great skill as a doctor, the Plague Soothsayer prefers to prevent damage rather than repair it. Its main targets are criminal gangs, and it devotes itself to investigate them and set traps. When the evildoers finally fall, the Soothsayer gloats as it throws its coin in the air before its terrified victims.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Soothsayer

lore: To diagnose their patients, Plague Doctors observe them closely for a while, explore their bodies, and demand information from the people around them, pointing first to the patient and then to their mouths.\n\nThe Plague Surgeon is an expert in open-body surgery. Sometimes it finds that a disease has been caused by someone else. In such cases, the author of the damage awakens one morning with the same affliction, and no Plague Doctor will watch over them.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Surgeon

lore: In exchange for losing their eyesight, Terra Vulpes can sense their environment through the auras that surround all objects and living things. When they are hungry, they focus this sixth sense in a small area to detect sources of magic they can feed on. These creatures were native to the deep forests of Rodia, but after the events that led to the ascension of an old ruler of Siralim, they can now be found near towns and cities.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Terra Vulpes

lore: The energy unleashed by the activation of ten Nether Orbs at once had some consequences for Rodia's animal kingdom.\n\nThis black-furred, bright-eyed fox left its deep forest habitat to feed on the corpses of magical beasts. Its appearance may inspire mistrust, but it is actually a harmless creature, as long as it is not hungry.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Decaying Vulpes

lore: This creature does not tolerate its own kind, and it lashes its two tails threateningly when it encounters them. It is believed that its coat has magical properties, and some small-time merchants have begun to sell concoctions that they claim contain its essence. However, if any of these traders had actually gotten close enough to this variety of Vulpes, they would most likely have been bitten before they could even think of running away.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Lost Vulpes

lore: Originally from the snowy regions of Rodia, Skyward Vulpes quickly became famous for the cold emanating from their bodies. Indeed, some experienced Magi have begun to hunt and sell them to the wealthiest people in the country as an ostentatious method of food preservation, and to cool their homes during the warm season. They are usually locked up in cages, which are then placed in the pantries of these morally bankrupt individuals.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Skyward Vulpes

lore: This creature appeared recently in Rodia and, though it rarely approaches towns and cities, it did not take long before myths and legends sprang up around it. Although it certainly cannot steal human souls with its eyes, it does enjoy chasing unlucky travelers, who flee in terror when they encounter it.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Spirit Vulpes

lore: Unlike other Vulpes, this creature has not lost its animal instincts and can still be seen stalking rabbits and small birds, although it does not need to feed on them anymore. Since most of Rodia's Vulpes have stopped hunting their old prey, many farmers in the region have asked the authorities to repopulate the area with this particular variety.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Cosmos Vulpes

lore: The activation of ten Nether Orbs at once transformed part of Rodia's fauna, granting it magical powers.\n\nThe Stag Celestial is a good example of this phenomenon: its former predators are now its prey, which has significantly altered its ecosystem. Now, they roam freely around the country, attacking anything even vaguely related to magic.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Celestial

lore: Stag Guardians used to live in closed forests before undergoing their transformation, after which many of them dispersed. They earned their name by keeping threats to their home at bay, from natural disasters to enemy creatures that want to take advantage of the forest's resources. They have been seen cooperating with Moss Golems and Ents to face especially dangerous threats.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Guardian

lore: Overnight, the Stag Idol has become one of the most coveted trophies for Rodia's hunters. Its golden antlers have won it fame, but it is not easy prey by any means. Endowed with magical powers and an extraordinary strength, this creature is capable of overpowering seasoned warriors with a headbutt that sometimes even tears through their organs.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Idol

lore: The Stag Overseer is a monster of the night that terrorizes unfortunate travelers. This creature likes to stand tall in the distance, forming a dark silhouette against the full moon. When someone notices it, it disappears into the shadows, moving silently while hiding from its victims. Until, suddenly, they are lost in the dark, never to be seen again.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Overseer

lore: More than two meters high, and with an even longer space between its antlers, the Stag Royal is the largest of its species. In recent times, they have become quite an annoyance for Rodia's farmers, as they browse freely in their vegetable gardens and, what is worse, they also eat their livestock. Many of these farmers have begun to employ Magi to put an end to this terrible plague.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Royal

lore: When the fog rolls in at night, few villagers are foolhardy enough not to barricade their doors and windows. Its footsteps make no sound; its breathing has long stopped. The only thing you will see when it finds you is a pair of bright eyes floating in the air, waiting just long enough for fear to take hold of you before ending your life.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Spirit

lore: At present, it is known that the powers of the Basilisks work through their voice. If their scream is interrupted before it takes effect, they must start from the beginning.\n\nDue to the ghostly appearance of the Ethereal Basilisk, it was thought for a long time to be a soul, trapped in this world. The truth is that it is as organic as the rest of its kind. Its scales, like the rest of its body, are extremely sensitive to magic, and acquire this color at birth after being exposed to it.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Ethereal Basilisk

lore: It is a common misconception that the power of the Basilisks is contained in their eyeballs. A study carried out in the Refuge of the Magi confirmed that their powers still worked after removing their eyes.\n\nThe Dormant Basilisk has great regenerative abilities: even if they lose their tail or an arm, they grow back in a matter of seconds. Potions that contain hair of this creature are commonly sold on the black market. The most frequent effect after ingesting these products is acute diarrhea.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Dormant Basilisk

lore: Due to their form, Basilisks move awkwardly and at a very low speed. However, these creatures possess an enormous strength, as well as claws that do not break easily despite their fragile appearance, which allows them to easily pierce shields and metal armor.\n\nThe scream of the Lurking Basilisk was thought for a long time to inflict serious injuries. The Magic University of Andolin discovered that their scream actually stops time for fifteen seconds, which allows them to attack all their enemies.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Lurking Basilisk

lore: There are numerous myths about Basilisks. They are said to cause death with a single glance, to have control over snakes, and even to be born from a chicken egg hatched by a toad. Although none of those things are true, their real powers make them dangerous creatures.\n\nThe Crashing Basilisk can use its voice to randomly activate any magic items around it. With enough practice, it can hone its ability to avoid any detrimental effects.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Crashing Basilisk

lore: The mane and scales of the Basilisks make them greatly resilient. If they are attacked from behind, they lean on their claws and deliver a powerful whiplash with the rest of their bodies.\n\nRoaring Basilisks have the most powerful voice of their kind. When they are young and cannot control their power, their voice makes everyone around them faint. It takes these creatures years of practice to avoid knocking out their allies as well as their enemies.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Roaring Basilisk

lore: Basilisks are usually between six and seven feet in length, and feed on all kinds of creatures or carrion. These creatures do not take risks when they are alone, and generally avoid attacking creatures their own size.\n\nOut of all the Basilisks, there is only one that does not scream in battle. Instead, it makes an inhaling sound that, after a few seconds, ends up absorbing all the magic around it.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Stomping Basilisk

lore: The Nether Orbs that helped an old ruler of Siralim attain godhood also granted the Salamanders extraordinary magic abilities.\n\nFire Salamanders like to make their nests in the Great Pandemonium. They can walk on lava without harm, so they generally lay their eggs on islets surrounded by this dangerous substance. If a flying creature tries to approach, the Fire Salamander spits fire at it to knock it down, where it dies to the heat of the magma. Vulcanar quickly became an admirer of these creatures.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Fire Salamander

lore: Most of these creatures inhabit a region of Crux that is usually hit by strong storms, and do not allow anyone to approach their territory. A large group can alter the path of lightning bolts at will and decide where they will hit with incredible accuracy. In addition, the electricity that runs through their body interacts with the magic around them, sometimes allowing them to replicate it effortlessly. The authorities of Rodia strongly recommend keeping a safe distance from these creatures.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Thunder Salamander

lore: Water Salamanders rarely leave the rivers and lakes they inhabit. Their structure remains relatively intact compared to that of the other Salamanders, although they have extraordinary magic abilities that allow them to effortlessly activate the effect of any enchanted item. A famous archaeologist recently used one of these creatures to help her discover the location of an ancient artifact inside an abandoned temple in the Cutthroat Jungle.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Water Salamander

lore: Wind Salamanders can rise in the air and travel great distances without touching the ground. These creatures did not appear with the rest of the Salamanders. They were born from the eggs of other breeds of Salamander due to a mutation. A group of Salamanders that includes one of these creatures is twice as dangerous, as they can greatly boost the abilities of their kind. A few months ago, a team from the University of Natural Science in Vanelin discovered that Wind Salamanders are sterile.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Wind Salamander

lore: Most Ice Salamanders live in the Frostbite Caverns. When they cannot find a hollow space in the ice in which to lay their eggs, they periodically freeze the rock with their powerful breath to help them develop successfully. When these creatures reach maturity, they leave behind a slippery trail of solid ice. Sometimes, many young Ice Salamanders can be seen following an adult one, sliding merrily on the frozen ground.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Ice Salamander

lore: When an old ruler of Siralim ascended to godhood, some of the creatures in Rodia underwent a transformation. This event turned the Salamanders into elemental creatures, able to adapt in an unusual way to all kinds of hostile environments.\n\nThe Earth Salamander digs tunnels quickly to protect itself from the cold and other inclement weather. It likes to hide underground and surprise its enemies with deadly spells.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Earth Salamander

lore: The meat of a Dumpling is delicious, no matter how it is cooked. Only the wealthiest can afford to eat them, and few mercenaries have the skill required to catch them. In addition, they have a sixth sense that warns them of any danger, so traps are often a better option than direct confrontation. The Vegetable Dumpling is even harder to find, and it may even be the rarest creature in the world. Whoever catches one should know that their expertise as a warrior and adventurer is unparalleled.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: Vegetable Dumpling

lore: This is the ultimate Angel, the last defense against the darkness that almost devoured the world thousands of years ago. However, it was not the only one. Erebyss and Surathli joined forces to create an army of them for the purpose of protecting the light. There were hundreds, but it was not enough. The darkness attacked by surprise, too soon, and no God could help her. Everyone arrived too late, save one, who stayed to watch as his plans were fulfilled.
menagerieDialog: (It appears to be calm, but you know a terrifying spectacle awaits its enemies.)
(This creature radiates an aura of violence. Perfect for decimating your foes.)
(You can tell it feels restless. Perhaps it knows a battle is coming.)
(This is perhaps the most serious and focused creature you've ever encountered. It will serve you well in battle.)
(It meets your gaze with a firm, confident, and yet obedient stare. This creature is well-suited for battle.)
name: Aegis Angel

lore: Helmholtz discovered that the gem in the crown of a Paragon is the focus of its aura, and their body loses all color if it is removed. However, the gem itself has no power unless it is placed on their foreheads. After Helmholtz's fight with Sigmund, the Amethyst Paragon asked him for its freedom, and he refused. However, when the Unicorn Firewalker caught him by surprise and ended his life, this creature managed to escape before Milner arrived to revive him with her Undolim Seraph.
menagerieDialog: Your Eminence, please allow me to rest for a bit. It's been a long day.
We must constantly re-evaluate our battle strategies to ensure that our foes can never get the best of us.
Everett is a liar. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Two Paragons make a King Paragon. Two King Paragons make a Gold Paragon. Two Gold Paragons make a Grandpa Paragon.\n\nWait, what?
Something is amiss. I cannot say what is wrong for certain, but I am unable to shake this feeling of dread.
name: Amethyst Paragon

lore: There is a legend in Sithicus about a gigantic Yeti that appeases the most violent snowstorms, though some believe it is just a Winter Aspect, and that the furious gales of snow are actually a product of the Ancient Yeti's will. While it is true that it can channel the cold of the frozen mountains, its only concern nowadays is to eliminate the ruler of Siralim to prevent its home from being destroyed. As a precaution, it has decided to kill any Mage who crosses its path.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns loudly before smacking its lips. Torun would hate this creature.)
(Its fur is meant to help it endure harsh, cold climates. It must be overheating in the confines of this castle.)
(It brings its face close to you and nudges its nose against yours. Ugh.)
(You often wonder if there's a market for fresh Yeti fur.)
(It's chewing on a large piece of fruit. Where did that even come from?)
name: Ancient Yeti

lore: The Apis were turned into loyal beasts by the Sphinx Usurper, able to face danger. In exchange, they lost their power over the earth and the sun. However, adding the strength of the Apis to the battle against the Watchers was not enough to change the fate of the empire. The Apis Warrior, made by the Usurper to protect it, knew that it was fighting for a lost cause and rebelled to free its people. The Apis turned against the Sphinxes, who could not prevent their escape on the last day of Kaito.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns and turns away from you.)
(It seems unnecessarily agitated. Perhaps a few battles will drain its aggression.)
(You can't help but feel as though it knows exactly what you're thinking.)
(Upon your approach, it licks your hand over and over and over again. True love.)
(This creature is easily startled. You attempted to pat its head and it jumped as if it didn't know you were there.)
name: Apis Warrior

lore: This creature's presence ensures the gestation cycle of the other aspects remains active. In addition, it is capable of altering the weather, turning even a light drizzle into hail. It was created thousands of years ago by six powerful Nature Magi when the increased use of magic began to affect the cycle of the seasons. That is why Aspects are destined to confront any spellcasters they come across.
menagerieDialog: (Its eyes are closed, as if meditating.)
(It's making annoying clicking noises by pounding its staff on the ground. It must be agitated.)
(It is meditating. Better to leave it alone while it relaxes.)
(This is perhaps the wisest creature you've ever met. You are fortunate to have such a knowledgeable creature on your side.)
(Its fur is a total mess. You should have Nortah comb it soon.)
name: Aspect of Change

lore: It appears mysteriously in Rodia to witness events of historical significance and to ensure the flow of time is not disrupted. It was created in the past by Milner and Helmholtz after the ravages of the Unification War, when several temporal anomalies manifested in the form of rifts. When one such rift appears, the Aspect of Time instantaneously appears to close it with a wave of its hand.
menagerieDialog: (Its eyes are closed, as if meditating.)
(It's making annoying clicking noises by pounding its staff on the ground. It must be agitated.)
(It is meditating. Better to leave it alone while it relaxes.)
(This is perhaps the wisest creature you've ever met. You are fortunate to have such a knowledgeable creature on your side.)
(Its fur is a total mess. You should have Nortah comb it soon.)
name: Aspect of Time

lore: When the spring came, the humans of the free towns and cities mounted a counterattack. Thanks to their numerical advantage and superior intelligence, humans regained their hegemony with relative ease.\n\nSome Asura are currently trying to rebuild their empire from ashes and dust. Their leader is always known as Lord Zantai, in honor of the first Asura that united several tribes and tried to conquer the lands that were once theirs and raise its people to greatness.
menagerieDialog: Thank you for this opportunity. You won't regret this.
You lack the controlled anger that is necessary to overcome your enemies.
There is no room in this kingdom for weakness. With your permission, I would like to test your other creatures and determine their might.
Show no mercy. Never hesitate before you make a kill, lest your enemies will turn your pity to their advantage.
We're wasting time here. Let's keep moving. There are still plenty of enemies to defeat.
name: Zantai

lore: There is a rare disease in Rodia that only affects humans. It was first discovered in Taylor's time. In its early stages, the disease manifests as painful sores on the skin of the limbs.\n\nThe Addled Leper can sometimes be seen standing still, with its eyes fixed on something. It could be a book, a meadow, or the full moon. For a few moments, these sights bring back memories to its mind, and they remember who they were.
menagerieDialog: (It looks at you groggily with a half-baked grin on its face.)
(This creature will always be picked last for the dodgeball team.)
(It gazes at you in admiration. You can't help but find this creature far more endearing than you should.)
(Surely this creature's affliction must be contagious. You should be wearing a mask.)
(This creature is so ugly that, somehow, it's almost cute.)
name: Addled Leper

lore: This extraordinary creature was seen for the first time in the Refuge of the Magi. Its creator approached it and knelt to admire his success from up close. The Thylacine playfully put its paws on the Mage's chest, but instead they pierced him completely. By the time Zonte and Ainsworth reached the basement, there were no survivors. Only the Thylacine remained. Even for such skilled Magi, it was difficult to expel this creature from the tower.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns and stretches into a downward dog position.)
Hiss... hiss!\n(You do know you're not a cat, right?)
(It's running around in small circles, wiggling its ass for no reason. Yep, it's a hound all right.)
(It smells of dog sweat. You should tell Nortah to give it a bath before you leave.)
(It often scratches itself with one of its hind legs. Nortah should really check it for fleas.)
name: Thylacine

lore: Vulcanar soon regretted creating this creature. Even the Elemental King himself could not control it. In its first minutes of life it pounced on every creature it could find and tore them apart with its jaws on its way to the surface, where it continued the carnage. For several weeks it terrorized the people of Rodia, until, in a stroke of luck for the country, it encountered the Eternal Divinity. After a fierce battle, the Demigod vanquished the beast and left it somewhere no one could find it.
menagerieDialog: (Even for a trained Cerberus, this one is particularly calm and gentle. Sometimes you think it wouldn't attack your enemies if it weren't for your orders.)
(Each of its heads seem to take turns being stubborn. This is one creature that you'll never be able to fully control.)
(All three of its heads are fighting over a giant, meat-covered bone.)
(It's sitting around, pounting for no reason. It hasn't done any physical activity at all - why is it panting so much?)
(It's chasing its own tail, which would be cute if this creature wasn't a massive, three-headed, carnivorous beast.)
name: Bound Cerberus

lore: Despite the rebellion's success and the abolition of slavery, illegal Brownie trafficking still exists. This despicable practice is persecuted by the authorities, but that is not always enough. The Brownie Loner is a hero known among its own people, a veteran warrior who secretly investigates these activities, goes into the lairs of the criminals and defeats them with its bow. In cities such as Nex and Vanelin, it is rewarded for its services, though it always shares the money with the poor.
menagerieDialog: Could we slow down a little, buddy?
I'M GONNA BASH THEIR BRAINS IN!\n\n(Its threats would seem a lot more promising if this creature's voice wasn't so high-pitched.)
I like to think of myself as the leader of our group. Don't worry - you're my second in command!
(Both its weapon and its temper are comically oversized for its body.)
(Its annoying laughter haunts your nightmares.)
name: Brownie Loner

lore: This creature is extremely intelligent, but despite its fierce appearance, it does not have the unquenchable thirst for blood typical of its species. From a ruined temple, the Devourer watched its allies fight each other. It quickly descended and approached them, avoiding energy rays, spells and stomps. It climbed the Mystical Giant's leg and jumped to its throat, making it howl and stop. The Corox waited cautiously. Then, the Devourer turned to the Observer, who wanted to "tell" them something.
menagerieDialog: (Even while it's not moving, its mere presence is terrifying.)
(Let's face it - there's never a time when this creature will be happy.)
(You can't help but notice that your other creatures are absolutely terrified of this one.)
(This creature's appetite is insatiable. You can't remember the last time you didn't see it devouring a giant chunk of raw, bloody meat.)
(It's sniffing at the air in search of prey. Hopefully, it doesn't find any in your castle.)
name: Carnage Devourer

lore: The Carver Chopper is more a curse than a creature. It appears in the dreams of those responsible for the death of many Carvers. At first it will make sporadic appearances, observing its victim quietly from a distance, as if it were just a part of the landscape that doesn't quite fit. With time, however, it will begin to gradually approach its victim until it's close enough and the hunt begins. If it butchers you with its merciless cleaver inside the dream, you will never wake up.
menagerieDialog: I know there are prisoners in the castle dungeons. Let me have some fun with them, eh?
The best way to kill an enemy is to do it nice and slowly. Take a few body parts at a time and bleed them out.
...and so I cut his right leg off and beat him with it! Isn't that hilarious?
If ever one of your people gets sick, come to me. I'll put them out of their misery. You can count on me!
Come on, come on, come on! We've killed very little today.
name: Carver Chopper

lore: And the big day finally arrived. Everything was in place to start the process of duplicating the Nether Orbs. Several rooms linked by endless spells, strange liquids bubbling in cauldrons and test tubes, and hundreds of Magi arranged throughout the Refuge, ready to do their part. Ainsworth was at point 0, surrounded by nine Nether Orbs of great power. She grabbed her staff and began the experiment. But something went wrong. Very wrong. The Nether Orbs rose and a powerful magical current vibrated throughout the tower. A tower whose space had been altered. The ritual disfigured her, stole her sanity and turned her disciples into strange copies of herself.
menagerieDialog: (It's floating comfortably in the air while napping peacefully.)
(This creature always seems to be moving its hands in a peculiar way, as if it's constantly channeling some sort of spell.)
(It's carrying on an elaborate conversation with itself about which realm grows the sweetest fruits.)
(She's humming to herself while conjuring little bits of magic between her fingers. Perhaps this is her form of meditation.)
(She's taking deep drags from a long, wooden pipe and blowing smoke rings at your other creatures.)
name: Celestial Occultist

lore: This Arachnalisk is extremely intelligent, and the only one able to speak. Vertraag had to call in many favors from Yseros so that she would help him create it as a "show of courtesy and respect", though it is doubtful that he actually managed to deceive her. Shortly after its arrival to the Arachnid Nest, the Arachnalisks divided into opposing factions and fought each other, resulting in the deaths of hundreds of them and forcing Regalis herself to stop them and exile the cunning instigator.
menagerieDialog: (These creatures are a real plague... but they can be useful in battle.)
(It's surrounded by a bunch of massive, human-sized cocoons. But why are they moving?)
(It's making a high-pitched screeching noise. You're not quite sure what that means, but it seems to be comfortable enough.)
(It hands you a little doll made out of web silk. Ugh.)
(It begins to raise up into the air as if it were floating, but upon closer inspection, its silken thread is just barely visible.)
name: Creeping Arachnalisk

lore: When the Vengeful Djinn was born, this creature emerged from the cauldron in which the Nether Orb was boiling. Its very presence causes catastrophic events with serious consequences for anyone near the creature. However, the Cursed Slime itself is not evil, and it doesn't cause harm deliberately unless provoked. It decided to escape before the Djinn uprising and now wanders the world, involuntarily causing innumerable misfortunes in its path.
menagerieDialog: (It has an extremely punchable expression on its face.)
(This creature has such a goofy face that even your normally-stoic personality is no match for the temptation to knock it flat on its slimy ass.)
(It never. Stops. Laughing. Hyuh-huh-huh-huh. ENOUGH.)
(For some reason, you find its undeterrable happiness to be quite obnoxious.)
(It's nibbiling at random bits of dust and debris off the floor. You should really find it some decent food to eat.)
name: Cursed Slime

lore: The Deceptive Fiend was one of Vulcanar's pets for a long time. Gifted with intelligence, it hated its master for treating it like a common beast. When the God of Fire exiled the Fiends, it hid among them and escaped the Great Pandemonium. It saw that mortals also treated creatures as slaves, and it decided to devote its life to freeing as many beasts as it could from the yoke of their masters, regardless of whether they were trained animals, pets or faithful companions.
menagerieDialog: (Oh, Gods, it's eating the floor tiles!)
(This creature is completely out of control, headbutting everything in sight.)
(It curls up next to you and purrs like a cat which is an emotionally confusing experience for you, to say the least.)
(You wish it would close its mouth at some point, but it never does. Ever.)
(It seems to have eaten all your other creatures' food. Maybe it's time to put it down.)
name: Deceptive Fiend

lore: Out of the eleven that existed in the beginning, only two of them retained most of their power. As a mere gesture, Yseros contributed to the creation of the world by creating the Barrens.\n\nWhen the War Priests arrived, they began to undo the work of the other Priests. This annoyed Lister, who created the Priest Vizier to persecute these disdainful creatures and destroy them or at least drive them out of the cities. After they finished their work, most of them moved to Ahruna to serve their lord.
menagerieDialog: (It's doing what it does best - standing still.)
(Something about this creature makes you feel... different, somehow. Suddenly, your long-term goals seem irrelevant, and you yearn only to battle.)
(You feel oddly enlightened whenever you're around this creature. Everything just seems to make a bit more sense than usual.)
(It's sleeping peacefully. You're not quite sure how you know that, given its lack of facial features.)
(Its aura of light flickers rapidly, as if to show that it's feeling uneasy right now.)
name: Priest Vizier

lore: Also known as Supreme Leader by the members of the Diabolic Horde, it is believed to be an emissary of Gonfurian, charged with spreading chaos throughout the land. Only the Diabolic Commanders have seen it, which is why it was thought to be a legend for a long time. However, it seems that he now wants to personally oversee his plans for the Horde, since there have been numerous reported sightings of it recently.
menagerieDialog: I'm tired of running around, everything hurts! Can't we rest for a little while?
What are we doing here? Let's get moving!
My hounds crave the flesh of humans. What do you say we go out and start a war to sate their appetites?
(It's busy feeding rotten meat to its pups.)
(It's having a difficult time controlling its beasts. What has them so anxious?)
name: Diabolic Bhuta

lore: When the Djinns rebelled, they did not do it alone. A large number of Magi, completely deranged, created two terrible creatures. The Vengeful Djinn was to be the ultimate Djinn, a being imbued with the power of a Nether Orb that would punish the humans who tried to enslave them. However, they were forced to stop its creation before it was ready. The result was a vile, ghostly entity that materialized the deepest fear of whoever was in front of it, even if it was another Djinn or a creature.
menagerieDialog: Make a wish. The only rule is that you can't wish for more wishes.
The most powerful weapon is deceit. You'd do well to remember that.
I don't trust Everett. I think it's because his haircut is terrible.
Make a wish, then blow out the fire on my head.
Your creatures would be nothing without my support. You're welcome.
name: Vengeful Djinn

lore: Lister once came across a Wolpertinger clutch. Having witnessed the violence of the chicks, he decided to intervene by completely altering the nature of these creatures. Docile Wolpertingers sleep most of the time, and they are peaceful and completely harmless... unless they are bothered. When one feels that it is in danger, its murderous instincts awaken, filling it with rage and making it even more dangerous than the rest of its kind.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up into a little ball with its eyes half-closed. A nap is imminent.)
(You're constantly amazed at how violent this creature is. Even after it has slain its foes, it continues goring them with its horn.)
(It's eating a pile of trash. Hm. To each his own.)
(It bucks at the air anxiously. Perhaps a drugged carrot will settle it down.)
(The creature is growling at you. Unfortunately for it, you can't take it seriously at all since it has a piece of food caught between its teeth.)
name: Docile Wolpertinger

lore: Vulcanar himself created the Citadel as a mobile fortress. After asserting his dominance over the Great Pandemonium, the God decided to get rid of his pet, and he exiled it to a land that would eventually become Rodia. Wherever it went it sowed chaos fueled by its frustration, until one day, out of boredom, it decided to take a little nap that lasted until a recent incident involving Nether Orbs woke it up. With renewed vigor, the Citadel is ready to vent its anger on anyone it encounters.
menagerieDialog: Oh, I'm so tired...\n\n(It breathes out deeply, throwing your hood back and shaking your hair violently. A loose brick almost hits you.)
WRRRRAAAAAAGHHHH...\n\nUgh... Cough. Ahem. Sorry about that. I think a Troll got caught in my teeth.
The maximum number of decorations that can be placed inside me is 50. If you wish to place additional decorations, please remove some first.
I'm a castle within a castle. How strange!
(Its teeth are chattering, which makes far more noise than you would have imagined.)
name: Citadel

lore: The Efreets were born from the fire and lava of the Great Pandemonium through the work of Vulcanar and several Magi. Unlike Djinns, these creatures are not ambitious and never betray their owners, although they are quite mischievous.\n\nThe Flametongue Efreet's control over fire is such that it can alter its properties, so that instead of burning a creature it fills it with vigor and energy.
menagerieDialog: Death to the Djinns!
I have a confession to make. I accidentally set one of the other creatures on fire earlier while you were away.
You can catch just about anything on fire if you set your mind to it, really.
Many people often confuse Efreets with Djinns. The difference between the two is that Efreets are much smarter and more handsome than Djinns.
Fire solves everything. If you need me to take care of someone for you, just say the word.
name: Flametongue Efreet

lore: The Dryad Seductress is a mysterious creature whose existence is linked to an oak in which a poet carved eight romantic verses. This creature sings a tender melody as she approaches those who exploit the resources of nature. Her voice produces a state of obtundation, preventing her targets from moving. When she is in front of her victims, she raises her right hand and tears a part of their soul, then buries it in the ground. From that moment, they entrust their lives to the protection of nature.
menagerieDialog: More and more forests are destroyed each year; your kind should be more careful.
I will show the world what it means to disrespect nature.
I wish you'd build a garden in our kingdom so I can feel a bit more at home.
I sometimes miss the forest. Can we return there for a visit one day?
I believe this kingdom could use a few more trees and plants to liven things up a bit. What do you think?
name: Dryad Seductress

lore: Human activity, especially during wars, has caused serious damage to the world's forests. After the Forest Priests first appeared, some Magi realized that magic could affect nature, and even allow them to use nature in their favor. Thus, the first Nature Magi were born.\n\nAncient Ents are usually harmless, but they can be merciless when their forest is threatened, especially by humans, whom they sometimes impale on the branch of a tree as a warning to others.
menagerieDialog: There is nothing quite like the clean air of a Rodian forest.
I'll make short work of anyone who dares desecrate nature.
This castle smells like a wasteland. I would prefer to leave this place at once.
I feel invigorated in your presence. Thank you for looking after me.
(A little bird is nesting in this creature's branches which is oddly endearing.)
name: Ancient Ent

lore: After the defeat of King Sigmund, the survivors of Omnia fled the city, never to return. Before that, Milner defeated Sigmund's right-hand man, a Mage of great talent, in single combat. Due to his great power and the magic items he carried, the transformation was not complete. Like other Ghouls, the Festering Ghoul has lost his personality. However, it seems that he is able to direct other Ghouls and control their insatiable hunger. The authorities are still trying to find him to destroy him.
menagerieDialog: EAT FLESH!
(You can't help but wonder how this creature came to become so damn ugly.)
(It eyes your other creatures hungrily. Better get it a steak before you're left without a team.)
Must... eat... more... footses...
Want... to eat... more... feet...
name: Festering Ghoul

lore: There are many legends surrounding the world's oceans. They speak of curses, great treasures and unexplored lands. The story of the Fog Spirit goes back to that of William James, a famous pirate who sailed the waters for decades and discovered impossible places. His last journey took him to an island that floated above the northern sea, where he found a magnificent treasure. A cursed treasure. The Fog Spirit appeared when this happened, and it has traveled the world since, breaking minor curses.
menagerieDialog: (Something about this creature's presence is particularly comforting.)
(Spirits are not known for their love of violence, but this one appears to be an exception.)
(While Spirits are typically a joy to be around thanks to their friendly nature, this one is especially ingratiating due to its keen intellect.)
(It's very quick to make friends with your other creatures. Such camaraderie will be useful in battle.)
(It appears to be in a fantastic mood, as usual. You only wish that you could have such a light attitude sometimes.)
name: Fog Spirit
