lore: He was the scourge of the icy mountains near Sithicus long before Misery, Egas and other dark lords even existed. When the blizzards lifted snow and frost from the ground, he fell on his enemies wrapped in a blanket of cold white and blood red. It was believed that Azural had sent him to cover the entire kingdom in ice. However, the Queen of Sithicus foresaw his movements and managed to sabotage his descent by provoking a huge avalanche. Now, he and his castle belong to the Kingdom of Heretics.
menagerieDialog: I grow tired of waiting. Let's seek out a battle!
As death is the winner of every war, it's death that I've become.
Your enemy is constantly waiting for you to let your guard down. Never let it happen.
Who else wishes to taste my steel?
Revenge, redemption... what difference does it make? In the end, violence is my only destiny.\n\n(Whoa. Calm down, edgelord.)
name: Frostbite Wight

lore: When the genocide forced the Gorgons to abandon their home, the Trickster earned Gonfurian's favor for devising a plan to deceive the human generals and escape their lands. The only hope for her kind was to take over the naval fleet, guarded by a fearsome garrison of warriors. She connected her essence to her sisters' and created the illusion of a meteor shower to make them flee in disarray. The plan worked, but her boldness cost her her sight. Now she is the undisputed leader of her people.
menagerieDialog: My eyes are up here, thank you very much. But don't look into them or you'll turn to stone.
(Her snakes violently hiss upon your approach. Stupid snakes.)
Contrary to popular belief, the snakes on my head don't need to be fed.
(All the snakes on her head are sleeping, which makes it look like her hair is made out of a dirty mop.)
(The snakes on its head are vibrating rapidly. Perhaps they sense something is amiss.)
name: Gorgon Trickster

lore: Centuries ago, the Death Magi of the Magic University of Nex developed a complex ritual that modified the structure of a Leper. The result is a creature that can literally absorb corpses through its skin. It can slightly increase its power in this way, provided the corpses are fresh. After a while, the skeletons of the absorbed creatures emerge from its body and fall off.
menagerieDialog: (It looks at you groggily with a half-baked grin on its face.)
(This creature will always be picked last for the dodgeball team.)
(It gazes at you in admiration. You can't help but find this creature far more endearing than you should.)
(Surely this creature's affliction must be contagious. You should be wearing a mask.)
(This creature is so ugly that, somehow, it's almost cute.)
name: Grave Leper

lore: Griffons sometimes establish bonds with other intelligent creatures. In the past, there was a Hunter who found a Griffon chick that had been abandoned by its flock due to the black color of its feathers. The Hunter raised the chick and taught it how to use a bow when it grew up. Together they wandered Rodia, facing innumerable dangers until, one day, the adventurer passed away due to old age. The Griffon Archer still flies over the country, fighting injustice single-mindedly.
menagerieDialog: (It's preening its feathers.)
(It's screeching uncontrollably while digging its claws into the ground.)
(It seems to be quite lonely. Perhaps you should summon a she-Griffon to keep it company.)
(It's pretending to be hungry, but you know full well that it has already eaten more than its fair share of food. Greedy little slob.)
(It shies away from your touch. It clearly doesn't want to be bothered right now.)
name: Griffon Archer

lore: Harpies always need to be cautious when they attack a settlement. In general, they only approach civilization when they want to sow chaos, since everyone tries to kill them. Even so, few Harpies manage to survive for long.\n\nThe Harpy Marauder is a very cunning Harpy Hag that has managed to survive longer than any other. It is considered a calamity by the government of Rodia, as its incursions are rarely thwarted. Naturally, the reward for its head is a small fortune.
menagerieDialog: (It appears content, but you're certain it will have a tantrum the moment you turn your back on it.)
(This creature is trying to pull out your hair to make an effigy. You're not sure whether to be flattered or revolted.)
(She has a terrible attitude, snapping at your other creatures whenever the opportunity presents itself.)
(Harpies are known for their deep hatred of humans. Fortunately for you, its loyalty is held steadfast by your magic.)
(It's flapping its wings and squawking even more obnoxiously than usual. It's probably sick. Good.)
name: Harpy Marauder

lore: During the Apollinaire incident in the Columbia Tower, a famous Mage started an experiment to save his own life. He succeeded in transferring his soul to a book, though it took some time for him to accept his new life. For several centuries he continued his studies in the tower, until the unexpected arrival of the Familiars. Accustomed to his new life, the Hidden Grimoire welcomed Washburn and her kind. He still lives with the Familiars in this tower, which they renamed Cornell in his honor.
menagerieDialog: Read any good books lately?
I shall wreak havoc upon my enemies via a thousand papercuts!
There is a great number of books about battle strategy. A comprehensive review of such tomes would be of great help in your endeavors.
Nothing beats a warm fire, a fresh-cooked meal, and a good book.
(It's taking a nap, which conveniently makes it look like an ordinary book.)
name: Hidden Grimoire

lore: Hunter groups seem to move without any concrete goals. However, on rare occasions they travel Rodia with the purpose of fighting injustice. Such groups are always led by a Hunter who, instead of a shuriken, wields a bow and arrows made of the metal of its old throwing weapon. Some scholars of non-human societies have determined that it symbolizes their decision to abandon their old life. Others say that it is a custom handed down from generation to generation.
menagerieDialog: (The Hunter's wolf seems tired. Its rider is busy grooming it in preparation for the next battle.)
(Both it and its cat are seething with anger. Perhaps it's time to leave here and allow them to drain their aggression on their enemies.)
(It seems depressed. Perhaps it has come to the realization that life is meaningless.)
(It's busy feeding bits of meat to its wolf.)
(This creature and its wolf have an extremely close bond. Their love for one another is easy to see.)
name: Hunter Scout

lore: Spielrein and Baker executed the Sanctus project inside an abandoned warehouse on the outskirts of Siralim. The seven Nether Orbs flashed and sizzled, and the fourteen items rose in the air.\n\nSometimes, the Industrias Sanctus manages to sneak into cities and enters a tavern. This always causes a stampede, because any loafers who are touched by its hammer will work tirelessly until they die of the cold, exhaustion, or sleep deprivation.
menagerieDialog: (You've always found these sort of creatures unnerving.)
(It seems vengeful. The next few battles should be quite interesting.)
(It seems to be excessively confident in itself. Always a good trait to have in a creature.)
(This creature would make an excellent mascot for {CASTLENAME}.)
(It seems to be gripping the objects in its claws a bit tighter than usual. It must feel anxious about something.)
name: Industrias Sanctus

lore: After their uprising in the Refuge of the Magi, the Djinns noticed this creature in the chamber where the Djinn Ghula had been created. They decided to destroy it, but not only was their magic harmless to it, it also made it mutate with each spell thrown at it. The Infested Slime was grateful for the spells and returned the favor by also casting some at the Djinns. It was not long before it grew bored of the fleeing Djinns and decided to leave the tower and see the world.
menagerieDialog: (It has an extremely punchable expression on its face.)
(This creature has such a goofy face that even your normally-stoic personality is no match for the temptation to knock it flat on its slimy ass.)
(It never. Stops. Laughing. Hyuh-huh-huh-huh. ENOUGH.)
(For some reason, you find its undeterrable happiness to be quite obnoxious.)
(It's nibbiling at random bits of dust and debris off the floor. You should really find it some decent food to eat.)
name: Infested Slime

lore: When the Lurking Pit Worm chooses a victim, it does not stop until it is devoured. Unlike the rest of its kind, this creature attacks even the most populated cities. It may choose a traveler on the road, a woodcutter in the forest, a fisherman in the river. It follows the vibrations of their steps to their home. Then, in the darkness of the night, when all movements have stopped, the Lurking Pit Worm slowly emerges from the ground in its prey's bedroom and swallows them whole.
menagerieDialog: (Doesn't it ever stop drooling? Disgusting.)
(It never stops wriggling. Frankly, its mannerisms are a bit disconcerting.)
(One benefit of having this creature around is that you never need to worry about disposing of corpses.)
(It's making a disgusting noise with its mouth, not unlike a dog eating oatmeal.)
(It insists on making disgusting sucking noises with its mouth.)
name: Lurking Pit Worm

lore: When Tartarith became a God after his son's torture, he returned the pain he had caused him three times over. When Taylor exhaled his last breath, the Malignant Spirit emerged from his mouth and escaped the Torture Chamber. Since then, it restlessly travels the world in search of humans and other creatures. Its very presence is terrifying, and it only gets worse once it approaches. It can enter people's thoughts and bring out their fears and worries, not letting them disappear from their minds.
menagerieDialog: (Something about this creature's presence is particularly comforting.)
(Spirits are not known for their love of violence, but this one appears to be an exception.)
(While Spirits are typically a joy to be around thanks to their friendly nature, this one is especially ingratiating due to its keen intellect.)
(It's very quick to make friends with your other creatures. Such camaraderie will be useful in battle.)
(It appears to be in a fantastic mood, as usual. You only wish that you could have such a light attitude sometimes.)
name: Malignant Spirit

lore: Every so often, a genetic mutation triggers a peculiar change in the egg of an Iron Imler. Despite their tough-looking body, Marble Imlers are not as strong as the rest of their species and break easily. Physical tasks are a challenge for them, but they are still treated with respect by their kind and usually work as mediators, acquiring great social skills and often becoming good leaders for their people.
menagerieDialog: (It unleashes a nasty burp into your face and laughs. Immature.)
(It slams its chest so hard you're surprised it didn't collapse its own lungs. It seems very angry.)
I love my Imling friends. I perfectly complement their brains with my brawn.\n\n(That's the most intelligent and self-aware thing you've ever heard an Imler say.)
(It's trying its damndest to swat at a fly in the air, to no avail.)
(This creature is trying to whistle unsuccessfully, perhaps trying to imitate someone it saw in the castle.)
name: Marble Imler

lore: As a calf, its Battlemaster told it that it would not get very far because of the bad reputation of its lineage. Now, it has become a legend for being the only Minotaur capable of defeating the powerful Subaqueous Dragon in single combat. The tip of its spear is made out of one of the beast's fangs and used both as a weapon and as a trophy to boast of its great feat. However, it does not rest in its quest to find another worthy foe in Rodia.
menagerieDialog: I still have my strength, let's go!
We've only been fighting weaklings. Are you afraid of something tougher?
Let none survive. All will perish in our wake!
Humans handle their weapons so awkwardly. They should learn from us Minotaur how to fight correctly.
(It's busy polishing its horns. It would probably be best for you to leave it alone.)
name: Minotaur Lancer

lore: Regalis created this creature to face the Creeping Arachnalisk and teach the God of Time a lesson. She even had him witness the encounter. When Vertraag saw how the creature that would fight his creation really looked like an alien, he knew his words had not hurt Regalis in the least, but rather encouraged her. The battle was over in a heartbeat, as the poison produced by the Mite Paralyzer can stun even an elephant. Then, Regalis turned to Vertraag and congratulated him sarcastically on his dirty trick.
menagerieDialog: (It's rolled into a ball, sleeping lazily.)
(It keeps nibbling at its teammates, who are most certainly growing tired of its shenanigans.)
(It's doing some kind of strange clicking thing with its mandibles. You're horrified, but you can't bring yourself to look away.)
(It's eating a bunch of tiny insects. Surely that's cannibalism, is it not?)
(It's unsuccessfully trying to burrow into the floor.)
name: Mite Paralyzer

lore: When this creature's mace hits the body of its enemies, the opaque sphere on its head absorbs all light around it. For a moment, darkness falls and uncertainty reigns. The Moon Crusader is a warrior of light who travels the world in search of forgotten magic that continues to overflow and could cause disasters. Using the power of its two spheres, it can absorb this energy and contain the magic items that emit it... or simply destroy them with its incredible strength.
menagerieDialog: (It appears to be sleeping, but everyone knows that Crusaders never sleep.)
(It appears to be uncharacteristically restless. It has probably spent too long cooped up in your castle.)
(Though this creature may appear to be simple-minded, you know it has great ambitions. Hopefully they align with your own.)
(Only this creature's unbreakable loyalty toward you prohibits it from wreaking havoc on your entire kingdom.)
(It's busy fidgeting with its maul in a rare display of unease.)
name: Moon Crusader

lore: The Mud Golem is the creature that inspired the legendary Mage Helmholtz to create his artificial Golems. It is believed that it dates back to the creation of the first Spell Gems. It hibernates during the cold season, but it is possible to see it near abandoned temples when the weather is warmer, protecting ancient magic that has long been lost to time.
menagerieDialog: (It's so still that you're not even sure it's still alive.)
(It's... shadowboxing. Weird.)
(This creature has the best of intentions, but it always seems to be clumsily knocking things over.)
(Perhaps someday, you'll be able to take the time to teach it how to talk.)
(Its facial expressions are difficult to read. You can't help but think that it's judging you sometimes.)
name: Mud Golem

lore: During the siege of Omnia, several magic students were assigned to protect the University. Shortly before the Unification forces achieved victory, the Festering Ghoul entered the University followed by a hundred Ghouls. The students soon realized there was nothing they could do. One locked herself in the biological experimentation room, but the doors gave way and she was killed. Her left arm is now a factory of diseases, although until now she had remained in Omnia and her existence was unknown.
menagerieDialog: Give... human... flesh...
Slurp... muscles... from... body...
(It's sitting down, staring straight ahead with drool dripping down its cheek. You really picked a winner with this one.)
(If you look closely enough, you can still see some glimmer of beauty in this creature before it was grossly transformed into... whatever it is now.)
Leave no one alive. A single mercy could be your kingdom's undoing.
name: Forsaken Plaguebearer

lore: After creating the Apocalypses, Vulcanar appeared before Torun and showed him one, stating that no Giant could destroy as many Watchers as his "little girl". That infuriated the God of Anger, who was already furious to begin with, so he challenged Vulcanar to a duel between his final Giant and whatever "PIECE OF !@#$" the Elemental King wanted. This is how the Mystical Giant was born, a 35-foot Giant with skin as hard as steel and the strength of a seventeen-ton killing machine.
menagerieDialog: Humans are weak! Even baby Giants can crush your kind with one hand.
I'll send your enemies flying with a kick to the gut. Bring it on!
If you ever need any help re-arranging your castle, I'm your Giant! Just say the word.
(It's curling two of your other creatures as they all giggle maniacally. It would probably be best for you to leave them to it.)
(It's playing some make-shift drums using its stool and two excessively large tree trunks.)
name: Mystical Giant

lore: Before fighting Sigmund, Helmholtz and Milner started an experiment with their Topaz and Diamond Paragons, using cutting-edge techniques of magical engineering, as well as an opal and an amethyst. The result was two unique Paragons designed specifically to help them defeat the (until recently) most powerful dark lord of all time. When the Unification War ended, the Opal Paragon asked Milner for its freedom and she accepted. Since then it has worked as an advisor to the royal family in Neralim.
menagerieDialog: Your Eminence, please allow me to rest for a bit. It's been a long day.
We must constantly re-evaluate our battle strategies to ensure that our foes can never get the best of us.
Everett is a liar. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Two Paragons make a King Paragon. Two King Paragons make a Gold Paragon. Two Gold Paragons make a Grandpa Paragon.\n\nWait, what?
Something is amiss. I cannot say what is wrong for certain, but I am unable to shake this feeling of dread.
name: Opal Paragon

lore: The Queen was running out of time. While the Phase Warriors invaded Omnia with Vanelin's and Andolin's forces, she appeared at the gates of Sigmund's castle and challenged him to single combat. The Queen lost her life but took half of the dark lord's jaw with her.\n\nDuring the siege of Siralim, a renowned criminal helped the royal guard protect the prince. He was the last one standing and managed to escape Sigmund with the child in his arms. But his shoulder had been pierced by a poisoned arrow.
menagerieDialog: (Queen Moira of Siralim, whose reign took place during the Unification War, was the first one to use the spell that gives life to these creatures.)
(It's dancing and asking you to call it "Dio". You are now questioning all your life choices.)
(It tries to impress you by moving random objects through its body.)
I am yours to command.
(It's fiercely protective of your other creatures. You're glad to have it as a part of your team.)
name: Phase Rogue

lore: To perform any tasks that require fine motor skills, the Pilwiz developed a series of rudimentary instruments that have been improved by humans over the years.\n\nAlthough all Pilwiz handle the harvest, there is one whose work in the field is limited to it. The Pilwiz Harvester is a nomadic creature that compares the results of the crops in the different regions of Rodia to assess what the best products are and advise on subsequent sowings.
menagerieDialog: (No one works the land quite like the Pilwiz, but this one seems to prefer lazing around.)
(It's repeatedly slashing at the air with its scythes.)
(It's trimming some flowers, because what else is a creature with scythes for limbs supposed to do in their free time?)
(Its gaze is lost in the distance, as if yearning to be someplace else.)
(This creature's lifelong dream is to become a gardener. Unfortunately for it, you've decided to enlist it into a lifetime of warfare.)
name: Pilwiz Harvester

lore: Pilwiz that never farm are a rare, but necessary exception for the perfection of the art of cultivation. The Pilwiz Herbalist's knowledge ranges from the genetic engineering of plants through breeding to the study of their medicinal properties. When a Pilwiz becomes seriously ill or unable to move, a bird is sent to the nearest Herbalist's cabin to request its services.
menagerieDialog: (No one works the land quite like the Pilwiz, but this one seems to prefer lazing around.)
(It's repeatedly slashing at the air with its scythes.)
(It's trimming some flowers, because what else is a creature with scythes for limbs supposed to do in their free time?)
(Its gaze is lost in the distance, as if yearning to be someplace else.)
(This creature's lifelong dream is to become a gardener. Unfortunately for it, you've decided to enlist it into a lifetime of warfare.)
name: Pilwiz Herbalist

lore: When Taylor decided to kill his father instead of forgiving him for abandoning him, accidentally turning him into a God, a Pit Wraith fed on what he never was. It automatically became the Tormenter. Tartarith and the creature looked at each other for a moment, but before the God could think of killing it, it unfolded before his eyes. The mere presence of this creature arouses vivid images of a happy future in those who abandoned their loved ones, plunging them into a deep sadness.
menagerieDialog: (Pit Wraiths have the ability to disappear at any time. Hopefully that doesn't ever happen in a critical situation.)
(It's impossible not to be stricken with overwhelming dread while you're around this creature. It emanates a constant aura of terror at all times.)
(Despite their terrifying appearance, you know these creatures are harmless unless provoked.)
(Each of its eyes appear to be focused on something different. How can it keep its mind in order with so much stimulation?)
(You can't help but admit that you still feel a little nervous in this creature's presence.)
name: Pit Wraith Tormenter

lore: Sigmund took advantage of his friendship with a Bone Reaper to experiment on it. Unbeknownst to the creature, he kept casting relatively innocuous curses on it until it transformed into a Cursed Reaper. When it happened it demanded explanations, but Sigmund locked it up and continued casting progressively more powerful spells on it. It finally became a Plague Reaper, bound to him as a slave. This creature brings misfortune wherever it goes, and touching its scythe horribly curses its victim.
menagerieDialog: Oh, hello there! Would you like to know the exact date of your death?
While I can't hold your hand, I will have your back.
(This creature always seems to be focused on something you can't see.)
Don't fear the reaper.\n\n(Sigh. How clichÃ©.)
(Its inability to stop grinning is rather unsettling for you and your creatures.)
name: Plague Reaper

lore: Sigmund used the power of the Nether Orbs to cast his curse on Rodia. He forced a part of Eternity's End to spill into the country through a rift, a huge amount of temporal energy to which the dark lord gave form to terrorize the world. During the process, one of the Orbs was corrupted and transformed into this creature. It is believed that its existence is linked to the curse, that killing it is one of the conditions to end it. Time is distorted around it, moving either slower or faster.
menagerieDialog: (Its baby is crying, but it doesn't seem to care.)
(You can't help but wonder whose baby it's holding. On second thought, you'd rather not know.)
(Its baby begins to cry. It must not like you very much.)
(The baby is screaming for its mother.)
(This is, without a doubt, one of the most disturbing creatures in the world. Personally, you can't imagine ever settling down to have children yourself.)
name: Prophetic Spectre

lore: Humans quickly began to use magic in their battles. Although it was rudimentary, the violence they unleashed knew no limits. It was enough to tear the fabric of reality. While Gods, humans, and other creatures faced the Watchers, the universe was shattered. Only the Amaranths noticed. They gathered around the rifts and looked at the sky. They waited for weeks until the night turned to day. The Radiant Amaranth descended, wrapped in a power older than the universe. A power sacrificed to save it.
menagerieDialog: (You can't seem to catch its attention at all...)
(Such a mysterious creature. You suspect you'll never fully understand them.)
(It seems to be highly observant of its surroundings.)
(It's spinning around on its side. Pretty cool, really.)
(Its inability to blink unsettles you. Its lonely eye constantly scans up and down, left and right - as if it's always searching for something.)
name: Radiant Amaranth

lore: Crux the Eternal City was the cradle of the study of magic in the world. When the Watcher War came to an end, the Ravens made the decision to lock the Watcher Sentinel within its walls to make sure it did not cause any problems. Since then, there always was a Raven guarding its prison... until an old ruler of Siralim invaded the city and damaged the walls that contained the Sentinel, who managed to escape. The current Guardian's mission is to find it, alive, and return it to Crux.
menagerieDialog: I'd be more useful in a laboratory. Perhaps you should allow me to stay back home with Castor?
Careful research and preparation are the precursors to victory.
Make sure all your Spell Gems are fully charged before we leave. To be attacked with dull gems is to be caught with one's pants down around one's ankles.
Legends speak of a hidden relic that does not belong to any of the gods. I wonder if there's any substance to this rumor.
I can't help but feel a deep sense of foreboding. Perhaps I need to take some time away from this adventure.
name: Raven Guardian

lore: Although the Revenants have always been at war with each other, there is a sacred code that applies to all of them, and a council that punishes the infidels. When a group of Revenants decided to live in peace in Ahruna with humans and other creatures of the surface, Dagon emerged from the depths to punish them. With a simple glance of this creature, their bodies began to experience drastic changes. They grew legs, their scales became skin, and they were completely transformed into humans.
menagerieDialog: It's a common misconception that all Revenants like to fight. I, for one, would prefer to lead a quiet life and dedicate myself to collecting minerals.
What's wrong? You look like a fish out of water.\n\nHA!
(Revenants hate when you call them "fish people". Never make that mistake.)
I am not a fish. I am NOT. A FISH.\n\n(This is the most sensitive fish you've ever met.)
(It smells like dead fish. Probably because that's exactly what it is.)
name: Revenant Dagon

lore: Banshees are not intelligent beings, they are guided by their instinct. They barely need to eat, and they constantly wander as if they had no purpose. When a catastrophe is about to occur, dozens of Banshees gather around, creating a chorus of spectral voices.\n\nThe Tormented Banshee is welcomed in some towns and cities, as it feeds on nightmares, especially those of children.
menagerieDialog: (It remains motionless despite your approach, donning an aura of inscrutable mystery.)
(The emotional instability of this creature is truly a sight to behold. If it's not screaming at inanimate objects, it's crying in a corner.)
(Why is this creature always crying? It's almost as if it refuses to ever be happy.)
Let my cries chill the living.
(She's crying, as usual. Perhaps someday you'll find a way to cheer her up.)
name: Tormented Banshee

lore: Five years after the construction of the Torture Chamber, Taylor became interested in Nether Orbs. He was the first to study them, and he soon received a visit from Vertraag, who said he was fascinated by his prowess both as a Mage and a murderer and offered him the opportunity to become a God. In his arrogance, he accepted, then organized a tournament to celebrate the occasion. The winner, a veteran warrior from Sithicus, was led to Taylor's chambers, where he turned him into the Sentry Guard.
menagerieDialog: Huff...\n\n(Why does it look so tired?)
(It's continuously slamming its shield into the ground. How obnoxious.)
(Its breathing is slow and hoarse, and it doesn't seem to be looking at anything in particular. Creepy.)
(It's attempting to sweep the floor with its shield. Thanks!)
(It's scraping a gauntleted finger over its shield to make a horrible screeching noise.)
name: Sentry Guard

lore: Precious minerals are a Gargantuan's favorite food, although they usually eat all kinds of ordinary rocks. These creatures will fight for any cause if promised a nice helping of quartz. The Watcher War ravaged many human towns and cities, but also some settlements of other intelligent creatures that lived in the mountains. Torun did not take this into account and the result was the Gruesome Gargantuan. Magic acts unpredictably around it, and manifests spontaneously to damage its enemies.
menagerieDialog: IDIOT... FOOL... STUPID...\n\n(The Gargantuan continues to throw lazy, half-baked insults at you.)
NEED TO STOMP SOMETHING, AND FAST. PATIENCE LOW.
NEW HOBBY. WANT TO EAT YOUR SPELL GEMS NOW.
ME ABOUT TO HAVE MAJOR TEMPER TANTRUM. NOT KNOW WHY.
HUNGRY? FOOD FOR YOU.\n\n(It hands you a small pile of stones. Thanks?)
name: Gruesome Gargantuan

lore: The malleable structure of Shapeshifters allows them to take on the appearance and physiological functioning of other species. These creatures must first learn certain principles about transformation and taxonomy.\n\nAn Apprentice has not mastered these principles yet, and its transformations are incomplete or unsuitable, sometimes even spontaneous. Their abilities are affected by the lunar phases, especially by the full moon, which causes involuntary transformations while they sleep.
menagerieDialog: I'm a big fan of the cuisine around here. My compliments to your chef.
(It transforms into a cat right before your very eyes.)
I'd prefer that you keep your kingdom small. I'm not good with large crowds.
(It transforms into a perfect copy of you. You never realized just how imperfect you look.)
We Shapeshifters invented the concept of Fusion. You're welcome.
name: Shapeshifter Novice

lore: Due to unknown circumstances, some groups of Hunters become evil and travel Rodia while committing misdeeds. At the head of such groups there is always a Silent Hunter, an individual that carries no religious item, which leads scholars of non-human societies to believe they do not profess any faith. They are extremely cruel and bloodthirsty, and often plunder small villages and towns at night, stealing everything they can carry and murdering the inhabitants in cold blood.
menagerieDialog: (The Hunter's wolf seems tired. Its rider is busy grooming it in preparation for the next battle.)
(Both it and its cat are seething with anger. Perhaps it's time to leave here and allow them to drain their aggression on their enemies.)
(It seems depressed. Perhaps it has come to the realization that life is meaningless.)
(It's busy feeding bits of meat to its wolf.)
(This creature and its wolf have an extremely close bond. Their love for one another is easy to see.)
name: Silent Hunter

lore: The Siren Lifetaker was once a Coercer who, after decades of living in this world, decided to get serious. It only acts at night and it moves stealthily, avoiding being seen by crowds. It is observant and cautious, and only begins to sing when it knows it has the advantage over its victims. Its song, perfected for years, is much more effective than that of the other Sirens. When its audience approaches, it glides gracefully and lets the edge of its scythe slice each neck.
menagerieDialog: (Singing, as usual.)
(Judging by the spiteful looks it gives to your citizens, it's very clear that this creature dislikes humans.)
(It always seems eager to teach your other creatures new things.)
Dude... bubbles...
(It's making an extremely ugly face at you. You take that as a hint that it doesn't want to be bothered right now.)
name: Siren Lifetaker

lore: William James was a famous pirate captain on the other side of the ocean; but after being afflicted with a curse, he left for distant lands with all his fleet, searching for the Mercury Cross, a legendary item able to put an end to it. Now, he and his crew are trying to amass a large enough fortune to rebuild the ships they lost and sail anew. His favorite technique is to use his grappling hook to pull his opponents closer and shoot them, kicking the lifeless body when it is close enough.
menagerieDialog: I'm glad we stopped to rest. I need to clean my guns.
(Why does it always feel the need to point its gun toward your kneecaps? Doesn't it know proper gun etiquette?)
While your kingdom's knowledge of magic is admirable, its technology leaves much to be desired.
(It's spinning a gun around on its finger in an attempt to impress you.)
(It's shouting "YEE-HAW" while shooting its gun into the air. No worries, little Skeleton, we'll pay to repair the damage once you're finished.)
name: Skeleton Buccaneer

lore: The Slurping Bat used to be just a bogeyman to scare children into good behavior. Now it is a whirlwind of hate and violence towards authority, because one those children became a powerful Mage who, after years of research, succeeded in giving shape to this nightmare to get revenge on her abusive parents.
menagerieDialog: (It gently nuzzles you, which is quite discomforting considering it's a Bat.)
(It tries to nip at anyone who gets too close, including you. So moody!)
(Everett claims this creature can read, which cements your opinion that he is extremely weird.)
(It moves just a little too fast for your liking. It's unsettling.)
(It's fiddling with a piece of lint it stole from your pocket earlier.)
name: Slurping Bat

lore: The Smoke Devil emerged from the ashes after a war lost in time and is unable to think. Since then it has traveled the world in silence with a lifeless gaze, leaving behind a mysterious cloud of dust. Wherever it goes there is anger, a fight, an argument, or maybe even a war, as if its very presence was the embodiment of Chaos. Although it carries a sword, it never gets into trouble and will only use it to defend itself.
menagerieDialog: You're the big boss here, right? You should share some of them resources with me, neh?
I prefer blades over magic. What's the fun in casting a spell when there's no blood to show in the aftermath of your effort?
The devil's in the details, neh?\n\n(Well, that was random.)
I have an idea! You should raise your kingdom's taxes. That way, you can steal from everyone with impunity.
I absolutely, positively did not steal this bag of coins from anyone.
name: Smoke Devil

lore: She appeared at the top of the Cornell Tower after the events that led to the activation of 10 Nether Orbs at once. Having foreseen the future of Rodia, the Familiars performed an ancient ritual to channel some of the energy released during this event into the skeleton of Washburn, the greatest Familiar who ever lived, as well as into her soul, contained inside a powerful Nether Orb. She is now more powerful than ever, and immortal. Her vote in the Council is worth the same as any other, but her opinion is always decisive.
menagerieDialog: I'd rather work at the castle library than risk my life fighting beyond these steadfast walls.
There is a lot of wasted space in this castle. Perhaps you should set up a library where we can research new spells.
Did you know that an Eft can live for up to 20 days without water?
(Its eyes scan its surroundings with innocent curiosity.)
(Despite the fact that it can speak your language, this creature insists on hooting repeatedly to feign ignorance to whatever you tell it to do.)
name: Spectral Familiar

lore: The Sphinxes awakened the Mummies and used them to conquer the Kaito Empire. This creature, along with the Swarm Mummy, burst into the throne room and tore off the head of Ateppicmon, proclaiming itself the new Pharaoh. Humans were forced into slavery by the Sphinxes, living in misery until the Watchers arrived. When these creatures attacked the Empire, the humans did not help the Sphinxes, instead fleeing far from the wastelands and leaving their home to be consumed and fall into oblivion.
menagerieDialog: There are many books I'd like to read. Can we visit the kingdom library later on?
Let us take our leave and fight for glory!
Things are not always as they seem. My advice to you is to question everything.
This menagerie is not a worthy living space for someone of my caliber. Do better.
These constant battles make for a difficult life. I am unsure about how long I can continue on this way.
name: Sphinx Usurper

lore: It can be said that Taylor was the first human to create a creature, as Clutchers were the first species not to be engendered by the Gods. The Static Clutcher was his first great success, an obedient being who followed him everywhere and inspired fear in his subjects. He used it to punish those who did not follow his orders to the letter. This creature would grab its victims' faces and emit a painful discharge that burned their bodies and sometimes even killed them.
menagerieDialog: (It's giving you a thumbs-up. It must enjoy killing other creatures.)
(It's raising its middle finger and displaying it to you and all your creatures. While this may seem childish, you admit to yourself that you'd do the same thing if your body was a giant hand.)
(It's impatiently tapping the floor with its fingertips.)
(It's gently stroking one of your other creatures with a single finger. Creepy.)
(It skitters away, walking on its fingers to make a disconcerting clattering sound.)
name: Static Clutcher

lore: At some point in history, a small number of Gargoyles became self-aware. According to Marette, the ones with the most intricate patterns of action may have developed a personality based on said patterns. The Stonehorn Gargoyle has led this small group for centuries, watching over Undolim at night from the top of the cathedral. When the city was invaded by an old ruler of Siralim, the Stonehorn Gargoyle was defeated and had no choice but to flee.
menagerieDialog: Is everything alright, my liege?
You drool in your sleep.
It is imperative that we always have a backup plan in case our original strategy doesn't work out.
(It's not moving at all. Not one bit, in fact. It's still as stone.)
(This creature could easily be mistaken for a statue.)
name: Stonehorn Gargoyle

lore: This creature is as old as the world and its origin is a mystery. It rules over the sea-dwelling Dragons that never come to the surface, although there is an ancient orb capable of summoning it and its armies if the cause is worthy of its presence. Some historians fear that eventually rulers of Siralim, who often interact with Nether Orbs, will corrupt the one that would summon this terrible creature, and add it to Siralim's hosts.
menagerieDialog: I'll guard your treasure for you while you're away.
Your insignificantly short-lived existence must depress you. We Dragons live for thousands of years while humans live and die in the blink of an eye.
The air here is stagnant. You could at least add a window or two to allow a fresh breeze in here to freshen things up, you know.
Tell Nortah to polish my scales. It has been far too long since they've received the attention they deserve.
I hope to set off on an adventure of my own one day.\n\n(Yep, not going to happen.)
name: Subaqueous Dragon

lore: A priest learned from the Sphinxes more than any other. Along with one of them, he developed a curse that he incautiously shared with others. Soon his betrayal was discovered. He was mummified alive and hit with his own curse. Then the Sphinxes made their move. They knew that humans were spying on them and showed them just enough magic to create the mummies, which they awoke to sow chaos. The Swarm Mummy brought terrible hardship to Kaito and served the Sphinxes in their conquest of the Empire.
menagerieDialog: Mmph, mmmmph!\n\n(Ah, the trials and tribulations of being wrapped up in bandages!)
Bggggggggg...\n\n(It stomps the floor, which is a far more comical sight than this creature likely realizes.)
(You can't help but wonder what would happen if you removed its bandages.)
(Its bandages smell like sweat and mold. It might be nice to exchange them for clean ones, but what happens if the creature is made out of nothing but its wrappings?)
(Its bandages are stained with blood and filth. No amount of bathing can ever help this creature.)
name: Swarm Mummy

lore: When a Phoenix has been reborn forty-two times, it becomes a Transcended Phoenix. This creature never gets old or sick, but it cannot regenerate, so steel and magic can end its life. Females gain the ability to lay an unlimited number of eggs, although their offspring is always of the father's subspecies. The number of Phoenixes was considerably reduced in the Unification War. To repopulate the species, Helmholtz and Milner searched for two Transcended Phoenixes, a male and a female.
menagerieDialog: (It's preening its feathers, plucking out the ones that are damaged from battle.)
(It screeches and spreads its wings, showering you in a coat of dusty ash.)
(It's closely studying its environment, as if trying to note where every single object in your castle is located.)

(You are confident that a Phoenix's so-called resurrection is merely a parlor trick. Whenever it "revives", it seems to have no recollection of its past life. Someone is probably just replacing this creature with a new one when it dies.)
(It gently pecks at your hand. Perhaps it's hungry. But what do Phoenixes even eat?)
name: Transcended Phoenix

lore: Its harmless name has a certain irony. Although it is true that the Youngster is not very old, it is the most dangerous warrior of the mountain tribes. It became famous thanks to a series of rumors. As they say, it has assaulted caravans on its own, defeated a Thylacine and even confronted an Immortal King. On the other hand, nobody has really seen the Youngster, so it is not known whether it is just an unfounded legend or if there actually is a young and powerful Troll capable of such feats.
menagerieDialog: Human kings are weak. You should let us Trolls lead you instead!
Let's go burn some villages down!
You rely on magic far too much. Brute strength is always the way to go!
(You're constantly amazed at just how badly this creature smells.)
(This creature stinks, but you really can't blame Nortah. Who would want to clean a Troll?)
name: Troll Youngster

lore: Eventually, Zonte and his teacher Ainsworth realized that something was wrong in the Refuge of the Magi. Many of their friends were behaving strangely and had become sullen and hostile. Others had disappeared with several Djinns, never to return. Zonte and Ainsworth finally decided to give life in secret to the Unchained, a loyal Djinn. It told the others a story of suffering at the hands of the Magi so they would leave the Refuge of the Magi, but its words had an unexpected result, and the insurrection began at that very moment.
menagerieDialog: Make a wish. The only rule is that you can't wish for more wishes.
The most powerful weapon is deceit. You'd do well to remember that.
I don't trust Everett. I think it's because his haircut is terrible.
Make a wish, then blow out the fire on my head.
Your creatures would be nothing without my support. You're welcome.
name: Unchained Djinn

lore: There was once a human empress who decreed a genocide against all civilized, non-human creatures in her kingdom on another continent. Many of her people collaborated for fear of reprisals, either from their neighbors or from the armed forces. The humans' numerical superiority forced many of such creatures into exile, until finally none remained in the kingdom, other than Elves. At present, the Shade she produced is the most powerful of all, and still roams the world insatiably searching for non-human creatures to annihilate.
menagerieDialog: (It appears calm, but you should never lower your guard around a creature known for its trickery.)
(You could swear you saw this tricky little guy spying on you while you were in the privvy earlier.)
(It reaches behind your ear and, with a sly wink, produces a coin.)
(It disappears from your sight before sneaking up from behind and tickling you. Tee hee, stop that!)
(It's methodically approaching each of your creatures and shouting "BOO!" in their faces. You should probably release this creature from your service.)
name: Wandering Shade

lore: During the Siege of Caedo, King Misery announced that one citizen would be killed every minute unless Undolim withdrew its forces. Taking advantage of the fact that most of the knights were on the walls, a very angry Crystal Smith headbutted one and stole his weapon. A riot had begun. The Smiths quickly ascended the castle with him at the helm, until they reached the throne room. There, the Smith fought in single combat against King Misery and ended his life, which earned him Gonfurian's favor.
menagerieDialog: I'm far more skilled in forging weapons than fighting creatures.
The final step to forging a mighty blade is to let it taste a bit of blood. Let's go!
Never leave home without ensuring that all your Artifacts are fully upgraded.
A creature without an artifact is like a human without pants. It just doesn't make any sense.
I grow tired of this incessant fighting. I'd rather spend my time doing what I love: forging weapons and armor.
name: War Crafter

lore: The people of Rodia exterminated Waspid hives without control, so the authorities banned such activities under penalty of imprisonment.\n\nWaspid Hiveleaders have the decisive voice in the Waspid armies, both when attacking and when defending the hive. They help coordinate the actions of the other Waspids with their buzzes, movements and pheromones, turning them into a single warrior that dances a deadly dance.
menagerieDialog: (It's lazing around, buzzing its wings every so often to let your other creatures know it's still alive.)
(It buzzes around impatiently as if to wonder what's taking you so long to finish your business here.)
(It buzzes around your head which causes you to freeze in place until it gets bored and leaves you alone.)
(In truth, the Waspid race serves no purpose to the greater good of Rodia. They are an angry, mean, and selfish race that live only for themselves. And to sting people.)
(It's rapidly buzzing its wings to try to shake off the dirt and debris it picked up in the last realm you visited.)
name: Waspid Hiveleader

lore: The war against the Watchers did not begin until the Watcher Sentinel crossed the portal to this world. The wait was over. It stood in front of a huge temple crowded with people and unceremoniously fired countless rays through its eyes. The temple fell to the ground, burying hundreds of people beneath it, and that was only the beginning. The Sentinel is a relentless watchman, but what was it watching over? Why did it leave its home dimension? The truth was not revealed until the Ophans arrived.
menagerieDialog: (These days, no one is particularly afraid of these creatures, but in the past they nearly destroyed the world.)
(Its single eye is completely bloodshot. It's either angry or hungover, neither of which are preferable.)
(It blinks at you bashfully. It must respect you quite a lot.)
(It's doing pushups, which is probably quite important for a creature with only one limb.)
(It's flipping its eye back and forth. Perhaps this is its way of showing you that it's nervous.)
name: Watcher Sentinel

lore: When Taylor had been ruling for ten years, he began to care less about carrying out his more than controversial activities in secret. In a display of arrogance and indifference, he ordered the construction of a huge underground complex on the outskirts of the city, which he called the Torture Chamber. He created the Whiptail Clutcher to monitor the complex, as well as to inflict pain. This creature digs its thick nails into the necks of its victims, then lashes them with its tail repeatedly.
menagerieDialog: (It's giving you a thumbs-up. It must enjoy killing other creatures.)
(It's raising its middle finger and displaying it to you and all your creatures. While this may seem childish, you admit to yourself that you'd do the same thing if your body was a giant hand.)
(It's impatiently tapping the floor with its fingertips.)
(It's gently stroking one of your other creatures with a single finger. Creepy.)
(It skitters away, walking on its fingers to make a disconcerting clattering sound.)
name: Whiptail Clutcher

lore: When Sigmund cast his curse, this creature appeared in the country. It is believed that its existence is linked to the curse, that destroying it is one of the conditions to end it. It can tear through time with its knife and create temporal rifts with which to move to other eras. The dark lord is said to have disappeared through a rift when he was about to be defeated by Helmholtz and Milner. Another theory is that Sigmund became this creature, and all these events were orchestrated by Vertraag.
menagerieDialog: (Its baby is crying, but it doesn't seem to care.)
(You can't help but wonder whose baby it's holding. On second thought, you'd rather not know.)
(Its baby begins to cry. It must not like you very much.)
(The baby is screaming for its mother.)
(This is, without a doubt, one of the most disturbing creatures in the world. Personally, you can't imagine ever settling down to have children yourself.)
name: Woeful Spectre

lore: The Wyvern Toxicfang is such a rare specimen that for a long time it was considered a legend. It rarely moves during the day, and it never attacks prey directly. Instead, it deposits the poison it produces in strategic places in the forest, waiting for a creature to step on it or lick it by mistake. Animals such as badgers or owls are instantly paralyzed and die within a few seconds. The existence of this creature became known after a Flamehook Pilwiz started a great fire in Andolin.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up with its head between its wings.)
(Upon your approach, it roars so loudly your eardrums start to ring. It must like you.)
(It's squirming around on the floor in a failed effort to scratch its own back. It must be difficult to have such short and restrained limbs.)
(After it notices you, it unleashes a roar of approval.)
(It's stretching out its wings, unwittingly knocking the neighboring creatures off their stools.)
name: Wyvern Toxicfang

lore: Fools (as a trade) are common in the courts of monarchs. Bard Fools, however, are quite rare. There was once a jester in Gangrel of great wit and daring. His sharp and cunning tongue was unparalleled in court, but he became seriously ill and was on the verge of death. The queen did not want to lose him, and had some Magi find a way to save his life. And they did so, in their own way. This creature makes people laugh like nobody else, but it also brings out their flaws and their darkest secrets.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Fool

lore: Tartarith sometimes gets distracted while creating Abominations, and the subjects end up dying or becoming creatures like the Bile Abomination. The digestive system of this creature is a time bomb that never stops creating an extremely corrosive substance in its stomach. Eventually, it exceeds the capacity of its body and escapes through the mouth, seriously damaging anyone it comes into contact with.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Bile Abomination

lore: Its weapons may lack range, but its height and great dexterity give it an advantage over its enemies. Centaurs currently seek to expand their domains, and Duelists are part of their army's melee forces. They can sleep while galloping, which is a big advantage when traveling long distances, allowing them to catch the enemy by surprise when a battle is coming.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Duelist

lore: A famous archaeologist recently found the mittens of a violent warrior from a thousand years ago in the depths of the Cutthroat Jungle. To do so, she ordered her Water Salamander to activate the powers of the artifact. The soul of the warrior, trapped in the mittens, manifested and took over the creature's body. The Salamander soon turned on its owner and ended her life. It then left the ruined temple, looking for more adversaries to defeat.
menagerieDialog: (Your magical items grow warmer in its presence.)
(It just bit off its own tail. It'll grow back though, right?)
(It blinks immediately after you do. Every. Single. Time.)
(This creature is licking everything in sight. Even the floor, which is home to some unsavory presents after such a long journey.)
(Its severed tail is laying next to it. Fear not - it will grow back soon enough.)
name: Chaos Salamander

lore: Broca the Drifter is a legendary warrior who left his village centuries ago to lead a solitary life. He is the oldest Elf currently alive and as he himself affirmed, the most bored with life in the forest. In his time, he was at once the most skillful Huntsman and Rogue, and over time he developed his own style. One of his exploits as The Drifter was to find the entrance to the town of the Centaurs, although he did not participate in the attack as he disagreed with the orders to annihilate them.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Drifter

lore: When an old ruler of Siralim unleashed the power of ten Nether Orbs at once, part of their magic was absorbed by this creature. It walks slowly, delicately moving its two tails, but it has a relentless gaze. Its mere presence can permanently unhinge the weak of spirit, turning them into pyromaniacs who seek in the flames a light similar to its own.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Incandescent Vulpes

lore: Egas the Necromancer was a particularly important person during the Unification War. He convinced the rulers of the small kingdoms in the West to serve his purpose. He was a great Death Mage who, after conducting numerous experiments, found the key to creating life from death. Before his defeat at the hands of the legendary Mage Helmholtz, he used his own spell on himself to remain in this world and kept working to achieve his goal of one day ruling over Rodia.
menagerieDialog: I'll sleep when I'm dead.\n\nWhich happens to be right now. Good night!
You are far too merciful on your subjects. Punishment breeds obedience, and you'd do well to learn that fact.
Knowledge is power, and I have a lot.
The ancient evil survives.
We must seek out the Necronomicon. With it, my true power will be realized.
name: Lich Necromancer

lore: On a sunny spring day, Helmholtz and Milner were scouring the Unsullied Meadows in search of a Nether Orb. At some point, the Hurricane and the Storm Lord that were their respective companions began to compete, discharging water and electricity in all directions. Their energy eventually condensed, and the Nether Orb they were seeking started a reaction that fused the two Storms into the Malignant. This Storm rains harder, contains more electricity, and curses more frequently than any other.
menagerieDialog: (It's sleeping lazily, and its snores sound like little blasts of thunder. It's oddly endearing.)
(Lightning is brimming from its mouth. It must be eager to fight.)
(It offers to shake your hand. You comply, and it shocks you. The fact that you didn't see that coming speaks volumes.)
I am the sky. I am the rain. I am the thunder.\n\n(Wow. That's deep.)
(It's gently zapping your other creatures, none of whom seem to appreciate the gesture.)
name: Malignant Storm

lore: Finding the Torture Chamber was easy for the seven Rodian adventurers, but traversing its corridors turned out to be harder. Together they had to defeat not only Tartarith's Doomguards, but also the worst criminals in the country who had been sent there.\n\nEven in the most difficult battles, the Sadomasochist prefers to cause endless superficial wounds to make its enemies suffer instead of killing them.
menagerieDialog: (It's casually whittling away at its arm with a knife.)
(It keeps scraping its katars together. In other words, it's making the most annoying noise in the world.)
(It never seems to stop hurting itself. Fortunately, your kingdom's healers are some of the best in all of Rodia.)
(This creature takes a sickening amount of pleasure in being wounded.)
(This creature never eats or sleeps. How it survives is a mystery to even your most astute scholars.)
name: Sadomasochist

lore: The Corox Apocalypse is a 35-foot long legendary creature, capable of piercing the hardest skin and doing all those things gargantuan monsters with a redundantly terrifying appearance usually do. The clash of titans between it and the Mystical Giant was reducing the city to rubble while the Maluh Ophan and the Watcher Sentinel fought their own battle. Punches, bites and headbutts turned buildings to dust while the Ophan tried to fix the world. Until, finally, the Carnage Devourer appeared.
menagerieDialog: (Is it really sleeping at a time like this?)
(It's rearing its heads around in circles. At this rate, it's going to break something.)
(You were always terrified of these creatures as a child, and with good reason. Each head sways around unpredictably, and you constantly struggle to understand its intentions.)
(Its many heads often get into arguments with each other. It must be tough being an Apocalypse.)
(All of its heads are swaying around in little circles. You should probably have Nortah check it out and make sure it's not sick.)
name: Corox Apocalypse

lore: The Eternal Divinity is the only being to whom other Demigods will bow to, even if reluctantly. This is partly because it was the last work of the Gods, the youngest brother as well as the epitome of perfection among its kind. It knows everything that has been and many of the things that will be. Its abilities are beyond mortal ken, and to defeat it is a pipe dream for everyone but a few.
menagerieDialog: I will not waste my breath speaking with the likes of you.
Unleash me! Let us destroy our foes together as one.
There is much to be learned from this world. Do not take a single moment for granted.
(You feel fortunate to have power over such a mighty creature. With a Demigod by your side, you just might rule the world someday.)
I grow restless. Let us take our leave at once.
name: Eternal Divinity

lore: Although the war seemed lost for the Watchers, nothing could stop the Watcher Sentinel until the Maluh Ophan confronted it. Their battle devastated an entire city, but in the end the Ophan was victorious. The Sentinel begged for mercy with its eyes, but Maluh is a merciless creature, and it prepared a spell to give it the coup de grace. It was then that the Vortex Observer sent its allies to stand between the two, and it let the legendary Ophan know the truth.
menagerieDialog: (It appears to be deep in its own thoughts.)
(You're amazed at how much aggressive emotion a single eye can convey. It's time to take this creature out for a few battles.)
(It's staring directly at you. You can't but feel judged.)
(You can't help but find this creature's tiny little mouth endearing, even if it's mostly hidden by an enormous, bloodshot eyeball.)
(It closes its eye in an obvious attempt to make you think it's sleeping. You decide to leave it alone for now.)
name: Maluh Ophan

lore: All Rift Dancers hate Magi, but Apollinaire especially so. In ancient times, this creature attacked a tower inhabited by Magi and annihilated them all, leaving a terrifying trail of blood and entrails in its ascent. It has been seen touching other Rift Dancers, making them disappear with a peaceful sigh, as if it allowed them to return to their own world.
menagerieDialog: (For a Rift Dancer, it's not very active.)
(It keeps trying, without any success at all, to get you to dance with it.)
(It's looking at you expectantly. Unfortunately, you're not sure what it desires.)
(This creature really needs to exercise some moderation. It plays games just a little too often for your liking.)
(It's fluttering around the menagerie, pacing back and forth repeatedly.)
name: Apollinaire

lore: And the kingdoms that opposed peace fell into oblivion, their kings condemned to relive their mistakes for eternity in the Kingdom of Heretics, their cities wastelands and ruins, their Seraphs, extinct.\n\nNex Seraph is the most powerful of its species, and, at present, it represents the last hope for Rodia. It was the first of them all and stayed with Surathli in the Azure Dream until its presence was required in the country. Its mission is to avoid a new slaughter, but perhaps it is too late.
menagerieDialog: Long past are the days when we brandished our swords for a real cause... Have you even tried speaking with your enemy before resorting to violence?
Trust no one. Even the gods are known for their paper-thin allegiances.
When a kingdom falls, its Seraph is destroyed as well. Perhaps humans should think twice before blindly heading to war with each other.
I am proud to serve under the {CASTLENAME} banner. Thank you for having me.
I find it difficult to trust humans. Do not let me down.
name: Nex Seraph

lore: When the battle between Misery and the ruler of Siralim came to an end, this creature emerged from the throne room in the ruins of Caedo's castle, where they had fought their duel. This creature is visible even in the deepest darkness. The earth trembles constantly around it even when it is not moving. If it hits the ground with its hands, it can cause large-scale earthquakes that shake buildings miles away from where it is.
menagerieDialog: (It seems to be infested with all manner of parasites. It's so care-free that it doesn't even groom itself!)
(This creature has propped itself up by its arms and is repeatedly slamming its torso into the ground in an attempt to start an earthquake. Real mature.)
(Despite its ultra-punchable face, this creature seems to be especially intelligent for a Tremor.)
(It's gazing upward at a nest of birds that have apparently decided to call its forehead home.)
(It's stomping down with its fists, one at a time. Annoying.)
name: Gorlum Tremor

lore: There was once a Nix who envied mankind. Their civilization prospered, while Nixes still lived in small settlements that did not. This rage led her to Gonfurian, and she asked him to eliminate the humans. The God of War laughed out loud, but he offered her a solution in exchange for passing a trial. The Nix accepted and had her own village fight a human town. They lost. Then, Gonfurian appeared before her and gave his favor to a mortal for the first time in history... plus another "small" gift.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.
My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.
This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Backstabber

lore: The first known appearance of the Plague Expert dates to the quarantine of Andolin, but no one really knows for how long it had been traveling the world before that. While its people cured the sick, the Expert wrote strange symbols in its book that no one recognized. The presence of this creature is now a beacon of hope, and it lifts the spirits of the people wherever it goes. Moreover, it is believed that its book contains the supreme knowledge of medicine, and many long to learn its secrets.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Expert

lore: Manticores have an insatiable appetite for human flesh. Even after a feast, these creatures go in search of new prey to feed on.\n\nThe Martyaxwar is a unique creature. Its long fangs can pierce metal and crush rock. It can also cast spells through its jaws that momentarily fracture space, allowing it to bite its victim from a safe distance.
menagerieDialog: (These creatures were created to destroy humans; you should be careful while it's in the castle.)
(You've noticed the way it looks at you. Its homicidal instincts are barely contained by your bond.)
(It seems to be sizing up your other creatures, as if it's competing to see which is the strongest.)
(You'll never quite get used to this creature's tail, knowing that at any moment it could sink it deep into your heart and kill you in the blink of an eye.)
(It seems to grow restless any time you approach it. Perhaps you should try a different method of interacting with it.)
name: Martyaxwar

lore: Occasionally, the embryo of a Boulder Imler that is exposed to magic is not severely affected by it. The result is a cocky, mischievous Imling of greater physical strength who likes to dig with Imlers, using its powerful horn to remove dirt and break rocks. Despite its arrogant attitude, it often encourages a Marble Imler to help it with easy physical tasks so that it does not feel different from its kind.
menagerieDialog: (It seems to have scribbled something on the floor. Upon closer insepction, you realize it says, 'I'm sleepy, let me rest.')
(It draws something on a scroll and hands it to you. It's a picture of a creature being slammed to death by an Imler. That's most definitely the first sign of a serial killer in the making.)
(This particular creature is extremely introverted, which is a rarity for Imlings.)
(It's busy drawing a picture on a scroll. Upon further inspection, you realize it's a lewd picture of Hebron's mother.)
(The Imling is holding up its middle finger and waving it in front of your other creatures. Grow up, Imling.)
name: Rock Imling

lore: Although Basilisks are much larger than humans, they have learned not to pick a fight with them. Still, showing fear in front of these creatures often means becoming their prey.\n\nAccording to a legend, the Spitting Basilisk is a rare specimen that, in addition to emitting a powerful scream, releases a substance that causes death on contact with the skin. This, like many other legends, is false. Its saliva, in fact, has powerful healing and analgesic properties.
menagerieDialog: (It's crouched down, staring blankly into nothingness.)
(It's busy eating a fish. Any time someone comes too close to it, it growls protectively.)
(It's sniffing in deep gulps of air, perhaps in search of food.)
(It burps up a boot. You don't even want to know who it once belonged to.)
(It bows its head and turns away. It must be shy.)
name: Spitting Basilisk

lore: This creature appears with a snap, curving space around it. The Stag Abstract does not walk, it is simply in one place and then instantly in another. Its attacks are devastating, as predicting its movements is virtually impossible. There is a rumor that this creature's antlers allow travel between worlds, but it is more likely that whoever confronts it will only get a one-way ticket to the afterlife.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Abstract

lore: The leader of the Spark plant was the project manager, a Mage who overestimated her achievements and gave the go-ahead to the results without performing the relevant safety checks, falsifying a series of reports. On the day of the explosion, she was supervising the work of the operators. When the machine failed, and everything blew up, she became the Toxic Smog. Since then, her only concern has been to annihilate every Smog, as she would not have been in the plant if not for their incompetence.
menagerieDialog: (It's spinning in place while mumbling its name over and over again.)
(It's emitting so much smoke that your creatures are doubled over in fits of coughing.)
(You can only hope that your other creatures doesn't have asthma.)
(It makes a whistling sound upon your approach, much like a tea kettle. Strange.)
(It's blowing large puffs of smoke into the air. That can't possibly be healthy for you and your creatures.)
name: Toxic Smog

lore: Born of primeval magic, the Unicorn Firewalker is literally the worst nightmare of any Magi who disregard the arcane principles for their own benefit. When it began to haunt the dreams of one of such Magi, the legendary Helmholtz, he summoned it in Rodia in an attempt to defeat it and escape the nightmares, but instead it began to physically hunt down all of those who corrupt the ancient art of magic... starting with him.
menagerieDialog: (The Unicorn is projecting an image of the stables into your mind. It must be tired.)
(Upon your approach, the Unicorn projects an image of battle into your mind. It seems to never grow tired of fighting.)
(It's incredibly sure of itself, though not arrogant in the slightest. Such confidence is inspiring.)

(It nuzzles your hand lovingly. You reach out to pet it, but it recoils shyly. It nuzzles your hand once more, so you attempt to pet it yet again and it backs away for a second time. To hell with it, then.)
(It's nervously tapping at the ground with one if its hooves. Perhaps Nortah is making it nervous.)
name: Unicorn Firewalker

lore: At the end of the Unification War, only Andolin and Vanelin had forces remaining. Although the Queen of Siralim added her Phase Warriors to that, it was not enough to invade the city of Omnia. The only option left was to seek the help of the Desert Priest in Ahruna, but before Helmholtz and Milner could depart, the Duelist appeared with three hundred Valkyries behind her. This creature is the best Valkyrie warrior, a queen of queens who leads her people to give their lives for justice.
menagerieDialog: (She spends most of her free time relaxing. Is she really a Valkyrie?)
She's waving her weapon around and striking various battle poses. She must be eager to fight.
(It's completely absorbed in sharpening its weapon and polishing its armor.)
(She is extremely protective of your other creatures. If only your entire team had such camaraderie...)
(She's parading back and forth around the menagerie. You really wish she'd stand still for a moment.)
name: Valkyrie Duelist

lore: Baker tried all possible means to bring Spielrein back to life, but she failed. Broken with pain and guilt, she joined the Sin cult for two years, but her sadness and need for revenge consumed her. One day, she bypassed Ainsworth's security and stole another Nether Orb. Back in Siralim, she stabbed herself with a shard from the Magnificus's knife that had been left inside Spielrein, letting her blood bathe the Nether Orb. It was consumed, and out of its ashes and her blood emerged the Dolor Sin.
menagerieDialog: (You should keep a close eye on this creature. You never know what it's capable of doing.)
(Although Sins are terrifying creatures to behold, you can't help but find the little trinkets they tend to hold in their claws to be a bit endearing.)
(Unsurprisingly, nothing ever seems to go your way when this creature is nearby.)
(Keeping this creature around is surely bad luck. Fortunately, it's powerful enough to offset any misfortune it might cause for you and your creatures.)
(This creature looks like the final boss of just about every adventure you've ever heard about.)
name: Dolor Sin

lore: Every Vortex is powered by pure magic and needs to consume at least one Spell Gem every three days to keep its structure intact.\n\nSulfuric Vortices are made up of a corrosive magical substance that produces first-degree burns in just a moment of contact with the skin. This property gets stronger the smaller they are, and they can easily pierce their enemies' bodies at high speed when they are at their smallest size.
menagerieDialog: (It whirls around in circles, emitting a powerful light.)
(It whirs around the menagerie, annoying your other creatures who are trying to rest.)
(This creature's presence is particularly welcome in the stuffy confines of these castle walls.)
(It's starting to lose its luster - it might be time to feed it another Spell Gem.)
(This creature is surprisingly small when it's not wreaking havoc with its winds.)
name: Sulfuric Vortex

lore: The legend of the Imp Incarnate says that this creature will unite all the Imps and lead them to glory. This is actually more a joke than a legend, or so some believed. When an old ruler of Siralim declared war on the rest of Rodia, a bright-eyed Imp appeared near some of the towns and cities that had been invaded and could no longer defend themselves. Along with a horde of Imps, this little joke has already plundered several human settlements and does not seem to be stopping soon.
menagerieDialog: Got any more of them feel-goods?
We go visit Torun and spit on altar! Go now!
We go to war... without crab helmets? No, no. Stupid. Very stupid.
(It's wearing a crab on its head while eating a bunch of mushrooms, many of which are sure to be poisonous.)
Step one, take feelgood of choice. Step two, mash in hands. Step three, eat. Step four, enjoy!
name: Imp Incarnate

lore: Iconus is a magical creature created by the Auditors, whose sole purpose in life is to carry out their plans. The inside of its body mainly consists of gears and metal tubes, through which flows a liquid brimming with magic that must be replaced every so often. Its skills in battle make it a precise and practically infallible killing machine, capable of adapting to all kinds of situations as long as it does not act alone. That is why, when the Auditors entrust it with a mission, it is always accompanied by five other creatures, usually war-trained Carnages and Fiends.
menagerieDialog: (If you listen closely, you can hear the gears grinding away inside its body.)
(Its eye is slightly indented toward the top, just barely giving you the sensation that it's in an irritable mood.)
(Its sword appears to be almost as sentient as the creature who wields it.)
(If you could be any superhero in the world, you'd be an Iconus. Yeah, definitely.)
(Its eye never closes. Doesn't it get dry after a while?)
name: Iconus

lore: Ottum begin their lives as tiny parasites that burrow into the skulls of their prey and feast on the brain matter found within. After they've consumed enough food, they go into hiding for 6 years during which they grow into the unstoppable killing machines we've grown to know and love.
menagerieDialog: (This creature's demeanor is disconcerting. It barely moves aside from the occasional twitch of its body, and its eyes blink rapidly when you approach it.)
(Its blades are dripping with blood. Uh oh.)
(It's casually levitating off the ground while enjoying the company of your other creatures.)
(Its eyes are always so full of murderous intent. Relax!)
(It makes horrible smacking sounds with its mouth while it eats.)
name: Ottum

lore: The Auditors are a group of unknown individuals who have been safeguarding the stability of the world for centuries. Their existence is considered a myth, and rumors suggest that their members have found the key to eternal life. The organization's network of contacts is broad enough to have executors in every continent, and though they usually are not formal members of the organization, they are also granted the gift of eternal life on rare occasions. When the Auditors decide to recruit an asset, and he or she refuses to appear before them, The Lost takes action. This creature appears during the night to subdue and gag the "interested party" with its extraordinary strength. The Lost was exiled centuries ago by its own kind, whose only habitat is on an island lost in the depths of the Golden Sea.
menagerieDialog: (This creature gets its name from the fact that it was an unknown species until very recently. You're fortunate to have one in your possession.)
(This creature never attempts to communicate with you. Despite the countless battles you've shared together, you're still complete strangers to one another.)
(It only moves while your back is facing it. Disturbing.)
(It loves to whip its hair back and forth.)
(You should really consider renaming this creature to "The Found" at some point.)
name: The Lost

lore: Many mistake Tisya for a Goddess, although in truth she is closely linked to them. Surathli and Erebyss created her shortly after the world's first cities were established, so that mortals could have an absolutely impartial and objective opinion to settle their conflicts. Her word is indisputable in every kingdom, but with the passage of centuries she began to ask for increasingly higher prices for her services, until, at present, hearing her verdict is a privilege very few can afford.
menagerieDialog: (She's sound asleep. Perhaps you should give your creatures a bit more rest from now on.)
I would like to partake in a battle at the arena. Care to indulge my wishes?
Someday, perhaps I will show you my castle.\n\nYou could use some inspiration for your decorations, after all...
Dilly dally, shilly shally. Let's go!\n\n(Who the !@#$ says that?)
I'd prefer to be left alone for now. I feel troubled, but I do not know the cause.
name: Tisya
