lore: Walken was King Taylor's personal executioner thousands of years ago. Shortly before the violent end to his reign, Walken became seriously ill and was on the verge of death. However, Taylor appreciated his work and decided that he would not allow a mere illness to rob him of his services: not even death could be an excuse to quit his job. When Taylor's father, Tartarith, became a God and murdered him, Walken was released and began to roam the world with no purpose... until the Auditors recruited him as the executor of their plans. Specifically, those that include the words "tie loose ends" and always end with a head rolling on the ground.
menagerieDialog: (He's holding his scythe tightly, as if he were a child protecting his doll from make-believe monsters.)
(This creature has the ugliest feet you've ever had the displeasure to lay eyes on.)
(Its scythe makes a whooshing sound when cutting through the air.)
(He tries to make a show of hefting his scythe onto his shoulders, but ends up leaving a bloody gash in his arm instead.)
(The edge of its scythe seems to absorb the blood of its foes. Perhaps this is how it feeds.)
name: Walken

lore: Mumu is just one of the many infants that were cruelly murdered by an overzealous Nightveil Spectre who sought to make a game out of knifeplay. Now, Mumu wanders the lands as a compressed, corrupt version of what its existence would have been had it not been killed, snatching children from their homes and gobbling them up in a single bite.
menagerieDialog: (Every time this creature notices you, it spins its head around repeatedly. You're fairly certain that it does this on purpose to try to impress you.)
(It's attempting to disgust your other creatures by turning its head to unnatural angles.)
(It's playing a game involving cards and dice with your other creatures.)

(Mumu is often mentioned in popular culture as a tale to scare children who misbehave. You never would have thought such a creature actually exists, much less that it would be yours to command one day.)
(Its eyes glow eerily any time you're around. It either likes you, or wants to possess your soul. You're not sure which.)
name: Mumu

lore: The Ugat are elementals constructed by Torun's raw anger. Although they're not quite so indignant that they talk in all capital letters and spout obscenities at even the most noble of adventurers, their quick temper is out-ranked only by their creator. This makes the Ugat a terrifying foe to behold, especially when encountered in hordes.
menagerieDialog: (This creature is quite the rascal. Keep it well-fed if you don't want to get on its bad side.)
What are you looking at, nisbet?
Your castle stinks, and so do you.
You're uglier than a cock, a roach, a roach's cock, and a cockroach all combined.
Your creatures are all stupid and ugly. Except for me!
name: Ugat

lore: Yllor, together with Alakadan, used to keep watch over the gates of the Refuge of the Magi. After the incident that gave birth to the Occultists, Zonte met with them and offered them freedom, encouraging them to travel the world. The two creatures looked at each other with a mixture of amazement and fear, but they finally accepted the offer, in exchange for being able to return to their job during the winter and "take advantage of the thermal field that surrounds the tower". Yllor and Alakadan were training in Vanelin with the legendary Red Hat order when an old ruler of Siralim appeared and took over the kingdom. Yllor is very temperamental and much naiver than his partner, often starting tavern brawls when they visit a city.
menagerieDialog: There are so many stereotypes about muscular, humanoid horses. It's revolting.
(It's flexing its muscles, just as all pony boys do. That doesn't make it any less weird.)
You should host a tournament sometime soon so we can see which of your creatures is the strongest.
One's perspective is limited by the brevity of one's existence.
I'm starving! I could eat a horse right now.
name: Yllor

lore: Though it once served as Zonte's personal familiar, the all-too-curious god granted Elqor's request for the freedom to explore the world on its own. The mental bond between Zonte and Elqor still remains, however, and the two often hold trivial conversations and share their discoveries with each other just like the good old days. Some time ago, the Auditors contacted it and it had an audience with one of their members. Due to its incredible potential, it was offered a position as executor, but Elqor politely declined the offer and went back the way it had come.
menagerieDialog: You still have much to learn. We all do. I look forward to expanding my knowledge by your side.
You must strive to learn something new from each battle you fight. Only then will your kingdom prosper.
(It's busy practicing its spells. It would probably be best to leave it alone.)
Many of your creatures are so mentally inept that they can't even understand your language. They're in dire need of tutoring.
I'd appreciate it if I could have some peace and quiet. Living here amongst your creatures is no way for me to relax and recover from the long journeys we've been on.
name: Elqor

lore: Dikya is an enthusiastic, inquisitive creature that devotes its life to scientific research. However, it refuses to document its discoveries and only shares them in exchange for any type of information that is not yet part of its vast knowledge. Like some of the Gods, it can see what is happening anywhere without being physically present, a skill that has made it the most renowned informant in history. For this reason, Dikya is constantly being persecuted and has been kidnapped countless times since it mysteriously appeared thousands of years ago. However, these kidnappings usually do not last more than a few days, as it is one of the greatest assets of the Auditors.
menagerieDialog: I am tired and hungry. Leave me alone while I rest.
Though I dislike fighting, it's a great way to blow off some steam every now and again.
(Upon your approach, it rolls its only eye at you. Arrogant little buggar.)
In the midst of the blood and carnage, there is sometimes also a... a beauty. A beauty that could break your heart.
If you could know the exact time of your death, would you choose to know?
name: Dikya

lore: Before Azural forged his current weapon, the mighty Wintermaul, he wielded shields in each hand: one called Rhylthar and the other known as Kalasag, otherwise known as the Brother Shields. Many years ago, Rhylthar was stolen by a lieutenant of one of the first rulers of Siralim to use it as a catalyst for a powerful spell. In response, Azural cast an enchantment on Kalasag, breathing life into it and entrusting it with exacting vengeance on the king's man of old and recover what was his. However, the lieutenant never went back home, and Kalasag still seeks to fulfill its purpose to this day.
menagerieDialog: (You are fortunate to have such a rare creature in your possession.)

(You envision yourself wielding this creature as a shield and Laglor as a scepter as you march into battle. Then, you remember that you're a bit of a coward and are thankful that you have creatures to do all the dirty work for you.)
(It barely ever leaves your side, as if its sole purpose in life is to protect you.)
(It's incredibly cold to the touch. Perhaps you should lick it...)
(You're surprised at the large amount of emotion this creature is displaying. It's a shield, after all. It seems to be perturbed about something.)
name: Kalasag

lore: Aja Birku, otherwise known by Rodian scholars as The Puzzle Box, is one of the few creatures that still perplexes even the most devoted of artificers. According to legend, Aja Birku is the key to visiting parallel dimensions, as it mysteriously appeared during the Watcher War. Seven centuries ago, Helmholtz, a prestigious Mage, succeeded in extracting its core, a crystalline stone he called the Crystal Eye. However, before he could uncover its secrets, the city of Nex was besieged by Omnia's forces. The attack failed, but what was their real goal? That night, the Crystal Eye was lost forever.
menagerieDialog: (An aura of beautiful mystery envelopes this creature.)
(It's rolling around on the ground like an animated die.)
(This creature is particularly coveted by the magi in Nex. Surely there must be more to it than meets the eye.)
(It's making all kinds of high-tech beeping sounds. Maybe it's about to explode, killing everyone and everything you've ever known and loved.)
(The various engravings on its body glow softly.)
name: Aja Birku

lore: Laglor was the result of one of the most ambitious projects that were carried out in the Refuge of the Magi. Zonte's master, Ainsworth, participated in the research when she was a mere apprentice. It all started with an immensely powerful Nether Orb and the idea of creating a weapon that would allow several Magi to channel huge amounts of magic to cast the same spell together and even mix different ones. However, the calculations were erroneous, as Ainsworth described in her doctoral dissertation on the creation of magical objects using Nether Orbs as catalysts. Instead of creating the perfect weapon, the staff came alive and did not take too well to the Magi casting several spells on it. After disintegrating four members of the research team, Laglor left the tower and began its mysterious pilgrimage around the world.
menagerieDialog: (You struggle to figure out how this creature is even alive. How does it eat? Does it ever sleep?)
(You often wonder if this creature would serve you better as a weapon than a creature.)
(The Nether Orb in the center of its body shimmers every so often. It's beautiful.)
(Unsurprisingly, it's completely silent. Were you expecting it to talk with the mouth it doesn't have?)
(It's spinning around on the floor. This creature would be useful in a drinking game.)
name: Laglor

lore: King Misery was defeated and killed 723 years ago in the throne room of his own kingdom, but his thirst for vengeance allowed his spirit to remain in this world. Caedo, his kingdom, became part of Gonfurian's realm, and from there he planned his return for centuries. Emlai, the last Caedo Seraph, seeks retribution for its king, who was crucified as a heretic for the second time so many years ago by none other than the ruler of Siralim. Emlai's thirst for vengeance will not be quenched until Siralim, and all the people who contributed to its king's untimely demise, are wiped from the face of Rodia.
menagerieDialog: Someday, everything you know and love will be turned to ashes.
Together, we will fight until the break of dawn.
(It tries to talk to you, but its helmet muffles whatever it's trying to say.)
It is far more honorable to be raised to a throne than to be born to one.\n\n(Well, that hurt.)
I cannot stand to laze around and do nothing in this menagerie all day. Let's get a move on!
name: Emlai

lore: Alakadan is the eternal companion of Yllor, and both of them have guarded the gates to the Refuge of the Magi side by side since its construction. When the city of Vanelin was besieged in a conflict, they fought together with the Red Hat order against the army of Siralim. The kingdom of Vanelin fell in the end, but Alakadan and Yllor managed to escape and return to Zonte, only to discover that their home had also been taken over by the ruler of Siralim. When Yllor learned of this, Alakadan had to paralyze him with the poison of his sting to prevent him from attacking without first assessing his possibilities. After convincing him that his plan, or lack thereof, was suicide, they agreed to split up to ask for help in liberating the different kingdoms and realms from the tyranny of the invaders.
menagerieDialog: I prefer to spend my time in a much warmer climate. This castle doesn't hold in the heat very well.
Arrogance is confidence.
(It's breaking apart a piece of cheese with its pincers. You should leave it alone and allow it to eat.)
Blood is the seal of devotion.
(While this creature is normally quite talkative, it doesn't seem to want to be bothered right now. It's turned away from you, clicking its pincers together methodically.)
name: Alakadan

lore: This creature is a manifestation of Vulcanar's sense of humor, poured into his Pandemonium Tokens in the form of a floating fortress that spits fire and blazing rocks. Although harmless to most civilians, it can wreak havoc when summoned in the middle of nature, even when it simply opens its mouth to insult whoever summoned it. Specifically, Vulcanar thought it would be hilarious if an adventurer made it appear in the middle of the Cutthroat Jungle to set the trees on fire and make Torun mad.
menagerieDialog: Oh, I'm so tired...\n\n(It breathes out deeply, throwing your hood back and shaking your hair violently. A loose brick almost hits you.)
WRRRRAAAAAAGHHHH...\n\nUgh... Cough. Ahem. Sorry about that. I think a Troll got caught in my teeth.
The maximum number of decorations that can be placed inside me is 50. If you wish to place additional decorations, please remove some first.
I'm a castle within a castle. How strange!
(Its teeth are chattering, which makes far more noise than you would have imagined.)
name: Pandemonium Queen

lore: The Goddess of Light detests war and its terrible effects. Throughout history she has tried to stop numerous conflicts that threatened the world. At present, she regrets having helped a ruler of Siralim rise against Rodia and the Gods themselves. Surathli understands that it was her greed for Emblems and that of the other Gods that gave this person so much power. When the Gods gathered, Surathli declared that from then on, they would only accept the Emblems that had fallen in their own realms.
menagerieDialog: This world may never know true peace.
Peace is not as far-fetched as many people would have you believe. Someday, we will enter an everlasting era of harmony.
Never give in to greed. I have seen countless kings and queens fall to its corruption.
Blessings to you, child of light. I hope this day finds you well.
May the light bless you on this wonderful day, young {PLAYERNAME}.
name: Surathli

lore: The God of Wind is the most devoted protector of nature. Like many other Gods, he can see what is happening anywhere without being physically present, but Aeolian enjoys traveling and rarely stays in the same place for long. He often flies over the Unsullied Meadows, sometimes in the company of Dragons, with one eye always on the grass and trees that extend into his realm as far as the eye can see.
menagerieDialog: Courage, honor, and strength of heart. These are the three virtues you must cultivate to become a better ruler.\n\n(You still want to know what he's holding.)
There is no feeling greater than soaring through the skies. It is a shame you humans are confined to land.
I will protect your kingdom from the skies. You can count on me.
Torun may have an ugly personality, but his realm is one of beauty.
The winters in this part of the world are spectacularly harsh. Have you ever considered relocating your kingdom to a warmer climate?
name: Aeolian

lore: Blizzards and frosts inspire fear and respect throughout the world. In the dawn of civilization, humans began to worship a God who did not exist. They implored him to placate the snowstorms and the cold, but their words were not heard. However, after the Watcher War, magic was unleashed for the first time on a scale that had never been seen before. And so, Azural opened his eyes on top of a frozen mountain. He never helps with the cold, but he enjoys watching travelers face its adversities.
menagerieDialog: No, I'm fine, really...\n\n(He's melting. You'd think a god wouldn't run into problems like that, but here we are.)
Do you want to build a snowman? Come on, let's go and play!\n\nAhem, err - yes, what I meant to say was that I am eager to take leave and explore new realms.
(You can't look at Azural without remembering the time you got your tongue stuck to his altar.)
Great ambitions are never realized in the comfort of one's own castle.
Very few creatures can survive a single blow from my Wintermaul.
name: Azural

lore: Vertraag and Erebyss had lived together in Arcadia for centuries. Faced with the threat of the God of Darkness, Vertraag convinced him to attack Erebyss first, saying she was the weakest. He lied. The armies of Angels and demons devastated Arcadia in a battle that claimed thousands of lives, until Erebyss realized there was only one way to defeat her foe. She let him pierce her skull with his sword, then used her full power to absorb the God's darkness, which spread through Erebyss and her realm. Vertraag appeared before a different Erebyss. She looked drained. "Why did you not help me?" she asked. "There can be no light without darkness," he replied.
menagerieDialog: Would you care to hear a story? It's about the time a young child lost her parents to the hands of a murderer.\n\nOh, you've heard that one already? Sorry.
We should travel to the Path of the Damned next. How crazy would it be for me to talk to the real Erebyss?
Happiness is but a fleeting emotion not worth pursuing.
I hate drama. I'm so above it all.
I am glad to see that your kingdom is thriving. Right now, {CASTLENAME} is the most prosperous I've ever seen it.
name: Erebyss

lore: The oceans hide many mysteries. In them lie innumerable treasures, lost islands full of unimaginable riches, and terrible curses. They gave rise to incredible stories and legends. People, especially pirates, believed in the sea as a deity. In some way, their faith and the magic hidden in the depths of the waters gave life to Friden. The God of the Sea enjoys stories about the courage of adventurers, and often communicates with them to encourage them, give them advice and acknowledge their feats.
menagerieDialog: A drink, a drink, a drink! My kingdom for a drink.\n\nWell, your kingdom for a drink.
(The moment Friden notices your presence, he produces a bottle with a skull drawn on the front and chugs it down in an odd attempt to impress you. You're not impressed, though.)
We shall drink and drink and drink until the break of dawn!
Someday, I wish to create an entirely new realm that is inhabited by nothing but Alementals. That's my dream.
The oceans are rife with new discoveries to be made. What do you say we sail the seas together in search of new lands to conquer?
name: Friden

lore: The God of War delights in the conflicts that constantly plague the world. He always acknowledges warlike feats, and far from being satisfied with congratulating the great warriors of history, he grants them immortality and the power to fight for eternity as his Chosen. Sometimes, he lets himself be found by certain warriors in hopes of being challenged to a duel. However, until the arrival of the current ruler of Siralim, no one had managed to defeat him.
menagerieDialog: Let's face each other in single, hand-to-hand combat. What do you say?
When in doubt, steel is the answer! Now let us go to war!
In the end, all the kingdoms of Rodia will belong to me.
You have my axe.
Perhaps one day we'll be able to fight each other. I've yet to be defeated in combat.
name: Gonfurian

lore: Vertraag often jokes with the Goddess of Illusion that Lister is her masterpiece. The God of Fortune can detect violence at any range. However, when these types of events take place far away from his realm, they have to be very serious for him to notice them at all. Unfortunately, when this happens, his favorite activity is interrupted. There is no doubt that Yseros did an excellent job, as Lister not only yearns for peace, but needs it to sleep peacefully.
menagerieDialog: Oi, wot the bloody Donwald Duck d'ya think you're doin', mate?
Oi'm gettin' toired of oll this waitin' abaaht. Let's get outta here, eh?
Oi wanna talk about me, oi wanna talk about oi, wanna talk about numbaah one, oh moi me moi.
Oi'm gettin' toired ah sittin' araand. Let's git a move aahn.
Oi'm really gettin' toired o' oll these people 'round 'ere. Wot say we take leave, eh?
name: Lister

lore: Meraxis's realm is an inhospitable place full of secrets that only the bravest adventurers dare to enter. However, the God of Bliss is peaceful and good-natured, and has a good relationship with the other Gods. Or, at least, as good as it can be with the likes of Torun and Tartarith. His innocence and carelessness have led him to remain on the sidelines during most of the conflicts that have endangered the world. However, he decided to take sides with the other Gods against the threat of an old ruler of Siralim.
menagerieDialog: Peace be upon you, little one!
Peace and love, little {PLAYERNAME}.
My army of Aspects will keep a close eye on your kingdom and keep out any unwanted intruders.
Peace be with you, little one!
There's much more to life than fighting. Remember to practice balance in all things.
name: Meraxis

lore: Since the beginning of time, the Goddess of Poison, also known as the Spider Queen, has maintained a certain rivalry with Vertraag that no mortal would describe as friendly. On one occasion, Regalis presented the God of Time with a huge statue of himself, but the inside was hollow and contained millions of spider eggs. When someone is caught in the webs of the Arachnid Nest, Regalis considers them her property, and she keeps certain individuals she likes as her slaves.
menagerieDialog: Oh, you've finally come to take me out to dinner, have you?\n\nNo? Okay, then...
My loins ache for companionship. Perhaps you have a creature in mind that would be a good match for me?\n\n(Ugh.)
You're so smart, {PLAYERNAME}.\n\nOh, I'm a sapiosexual, by the way...
I wish to produce new offspring soon...
I prefer the solitude of the Arachnid Nest to the hustle and bustle of {CASTLENAME}.
name: Regalis

lore: When Taylor's father arrived in the city, he was immediately arrested and taken to the Torture Chamber. His son had fun with him for hours, peeling off his skin, burning his face, pouring saltwater over him. Tartarith died in great pain and guilt. Then, the Nether Orbs that Taylor had set as per Vertraag's advice unleashed its power over his father. Tartarith breathed once more, but he was completely insane. Turned into a merciless God, he approached his son and said: I WILL NOT BE KILLED. NOW I KILL.
menagerieDialog: WHAT YOU LOOKING AT.
KILL. CUTE. THINGS.
CHOP THEM IN THE BRAIN FOR A QUICK AND NOT-FUN DEATH.
NOSE KEEPS RUNNING. NEED TISSUE. FAST.
ALL KILL AND NO PLAY MAKES TARTARITH A DULL BOY.
name: Tartarith

lore: The God of Fire is the biggest prankster of the Gods. Torun hates his attitude, and they have developed a certain rivalry over the years, though Vulcanar has never taken it too seriously. When Vulcanar created the Pandemonium Tokens, he included the possibility of summoning Torun just to annoy him. Throughout history, many creatures have tried to overthrow the Elemental King. However, they never succeed, and its inhabitants now understand that he is the one and only ruler of the underworld.
menagerieDialog: (Vulcanar attempts to give you a fist bump, which you promptly ignore.)
(Vulcanar flexes his magma-formed muscles. No one seems to be particularly impressed.)
No one stands a chance against the two of us, trust me!
What do you say we get out of here and do something exciting for a change? Let's kill some things!
I hate to sound impatient, but don't we have somewhere to go? I can only sit around for so long before I get bored, you know.
name: Vulcanar

lore: The Goddess of Illusion is wise and powerful, always watching over the world. Like some other Gods, she wants humans and creatures to live in harmony. When the world is in danger, Yseros is always the first to notice, and she sometimes mobilizes the rest of the Gods to help protect it. Yseros gathered the Gods to act against the tyranny of an old ruler of Siralim. She suggested Milner as their heroine, but, as usual, Vertraag got his own way and the then ruler of Nex was chosen instead.
menagerieDialog: You have great power and a knack for perseverance. Use these tools wisely.
There are many great treasures to be unearthed in my realm. Perhaps you should try your luck there soon.
Like sands through an hourglass, so are the days of our lives.
Never underestimate your surroundings. You can oftentimes turn the tide of battle by exploiting the environment to your advantage.
There are many gods in this world that you still haven't met. Perhaps someday, when the time is right, we will seek them out together.
name: Yseros

lore: No one really knows what his goals are, but the God of Time seems to have been involved in most historical events of great importance. What is he always thinking about? What are his plans? Did he, as Yseros suspects, know that an old ruler of Siralim would betray them? None of these questions can be answered, but it seems like Vertraag's plans always change the world in some way. The real question is: does Vertraag want the same kind of world as the other Gods? As the mortals? One day, we may find out.
menagerieDialog: We live in dark times, but the worst is yet to come.
Time is but a man made prison used to control humanity.
Many ponder the meaning of life, but does it need to have one?
Life, if well-lived, is plenty long enough.
Not even I know what lays beyond death.
name: Vertraag

lore: WHAT THE !@#$ ARE YOU LOOKING AT? WERE YOU EXPECTING SOME KIND OF EPIC STORY IN THESE LINES? ABOUT HOW A HIGHER POWER CARVED ME INTO A ROCK? NO, YOU PIECE OF !@#$. THAT'S BULL!@#$. I AM ETERNAL, AS OLD AS THE !@#$ING UNIVERSE, AND I DON'T LIKE YOUR PIG FACE. COME ON, WHY DON'T YOU GO DO SOMETHING USEFUL INSTEAD OF READING MILES OF TEXT? I DON'T KNOW WHAT THE IDIOTS WHO WROTE THIS WERE THINKING. IT !@#$ES ME OFF THAT HUMANS ARE SO USELESS. ANYWAY. GO !@#$ YOURSELF.
menagerieDialog: YOU COULDN'T !@#$ INTO YOUR OWN HANDS IF THEY WERE SEWN TO YOUR ASS.
ONE, TWO, BUCKLE MY SHOE. THREE, FOUR, !@#$ YOU, NERD.
I HOPE A SHARK TRIES TO SUCK YOUR !@#$.
EAT HEMP AND !@#$ ROPE, !@#$FACE.
I LOATHE THE DAY YOU FIRST SET YOUR DIRTY PEASANT HANDS UPON MY ALTAR AND DECIDED TO CURSE ME WITH YOUR PRESENCE FOR THE REST OF YOUR SHORT-BUT-NOT-SHORT-ENOUGH LIFE.
name: Torun

lore: From outside, Zonte saw the Refuge of the Magi trapped in columns of blue fire that rose beyond the sky. He soon understood what had happened. The tower was collapsing, and only he could stop the process. Inside, he saw the other Magi, his friends and colleagues, turned into eerie copies of his master. He hurried to point 0 and found her completely disfigured and catatonic. He had to remove the nine Nether Orbs to save the tower, and each one would consume seven years of his life. Looking like an old man but still feeling young, he teleported to Siralim, built on top of a gigantic Nether Orb, to become a God and stop the impending disaster. But he had miscalculated, for he needed a tenth Orb. It was then that Vertraag suddenly appeared and handed it to him.
menagerieDialog: Remain ever-vigilant, {PLAYERNAME}. You never know who will stab you in the back later on.
You must practice moderation in all things. That is the key to a fulfilling life.
We must not dwell on past mistakes. All we can do is look forward to the future.
You must strive to be a lifelong learner. Otherwise, what is the purpose of being alive?
Legends speak of a Spell Gem called Colorwave that draws immense power from each of the five elements.
name: Zonte

lore: Because of their inexpressiveness, it may seem like Grenales do not understand what the people around them are saying; but in truth they are great listeners. They especially enjoy stories of battles and adventures, but when a Grenale hears something particularly unpleasant, it often gets upset and explodes, coating everyone around it in beer. Owners of these creatures usually apologize claiming that Grenales cannot control their explosions, but this is absolutely not true.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Grenale

lore: When Siralim began its conquest of Rodia, its ruler transformed some people into fearsome creatures to help conquer the country.\n\nThe Lagergoyle likes to perch on a tavern's counter and watch the customers. If it believes they are not drunk enough after some time, it starts moving around the tables and lets them drink from its body. These creatures are banned from most cities for this reason.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Lagergoyle

lore: After ascending to godhood, the ruler of Siralim's ambition and arrogance were completely unleashed. As punishment for drinking too much, Siralim's tavernkeeper was transformed into a terrible creature.\n\nThe people of Rodia find it hard to describe the personality of Alementals, mainly because they were recently created. The Scotchpion is a dangerous beast that is fortunately never found in the wild. Its aggressive nature drives it to break everything in half, and its stinger can inflict serious injuries and a state of instant inebriation.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Scotchpion

lore:
Aware of the damage the Blue Bloods could cause to the world, the Auditors decided to exterminate them for the greater good.

Many rumors about the properties of the Alementals have appeared in the short time since their creation. Most people believe a touch is enough for them to spread their inebriation, while others think they are an inexhaustible supply of beer. Because of this, there have been attempts to kidnap these creatures, some of which have been successful.

Spirits is a calm and quiet creature, but it does not tolerate excesses. When it sees someone getting too drunk, it has no qualms about entering their body until they pass out.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Spirits

lore:
Shortly after their organization was founded, the Auditors observed a phenomenon that seemed to occur all over the world, and that often manifested in the royal families of Rodia's kingdoms.

Due to the dangerous ability of Alementals to get people drunk, Ilberd advised the ruler of Nex to forbid the owners of these creatures from setting them free.

Although its body is made of beer, the Venus Ryetrap is terrified of fire, as it is aware of the damage it can cause to the forests. It remains motionless at night, and some believe it is stalking prey, but it simply has its eyes fixed on a torch.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Ryetrap

lore: Vermowls do not seem to realize they are not ordinary owls, and often cannot supress their instinct to go hunt in the woods. As with Woodkas, owners of these creatures must periodically check them for any food they may have swallowed and remove it from inside their bodies. Predictably, Vermowls are more active at night, and can even break windows if they are not allowed to go outside for a while, unsupervised. Some mercenaries have already noticed this and tried to hunt them down. However, these creatures are aware of their ability to get other living beings drunk, so they always manage to slip away, leaving behind a group of people babbling incoherently on the floor, unable to move.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Vermowl

lore: Even if it belonged to a Blue Blood, a soul corrupted from within could still be absorbed by a Black Nether Orb.\n\nVulperries are usually affectionate and often jump up and down trying to climb on top of their owner, who for this reason always ends up smelling of beer. When a Vulperry gets angry, it arches its back and begins to bubble frantically.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Vulperry

lore: That phenomenon was called Blue Blood, and the people in whom it manifested were able to develop magical powers at an extraordinary speed. It often goes unnoticed, as most people do not practice magic, but the consequences can be disastrous when that power falls into the wrong hands.\n\nDespite its terrifying appearance, Whiskull is a playful creature that has fun standing behind drunk people in the taverns to scare them when they turn around.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Whiskull

lore: When Furness was defeated, the magic that flowed through his veins prevented his soul from being absorbed by the Nether Orb that Ilberd had handed over to the ruler of Nex. His body returned to normal, but something about him had changed. After settling in the castle of the Nex's capital, he discovered that he could give life to beer.\n\nWinegel moves slowly and solemnly, looking down at the creatures it encounters without realizing that its mere existence is absurd.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Winegel

lore: When the wind swings the branches of a Woodka, hundreds of droplets are released from its body, carrying with them the characteristic aroma of ale. Despite being a tree made of beer, this creature is always hungry. However, the food remains floating inside its body after swallowing it, which means it is never digested and can even rot, making the Woodka sick.
menagerieDialog: (To no one's surprise, this creature reeks of alcohol.)
(At the sight of you, it unleashes a series of violent hiccups. Gross though it may seem, they actually smell pretty good.)
(Alemental trafficking is perhaps one of Rodia's darkest problems.)
(Now here's a creature who knows how to party!)
(It's urinating into empty mugs and passing them out to your other creatures. Everyone will be drunk in no time at all!)
name: Woodka

lore: After Apollinaire raided the Columbia Tower, most of the Grimoires escaped from their bookshelves and spread across the continent. Those who remained hid everything they could in the basements to prevent looters from taking it.\n\nDespite the fact that the Pyro Grimoire's spells have changed over the years, they have always posed a fire risk. If a person without the necessary training uses it, their body will burst into flames.
menagerieDialog: Read any good books lately?
I shall wreak havoc upon my enemies via a thousand papercuts!
There is a great number of books about battle strategy. A comprehensive review of such tomes would be of great help in your endeavors.
Nothing beats a warm fire, a fresh-cooked meal, and a good book.
(It's taking a nap, which conveniently makes it look like an ordinary book.)
name: Pyro Grimoire

lore: Two hundred years ago, an Imling scientist tried to prove that it is possible to resurrect the dead even after a few minutes have passed. With great care and skill, she reconstructed the body of an Imler and managed to make it move, but she soon understood that her creation was completely mindless. Far from giving up, she decided that her machine, at least, would follow her orders. After establishing a mental link with the core of the system that allowed the Imler to move, she presented it to the public. Her work was poorly received, and she was exiled. The Imlings finally accepted her contribution years later, though she died of old age shortly after that. At present, some scientists of this species specialize in creating these beings and are known as Treat Imlings.
menagerieDialog: (It seems to have scribbled something on the floor. Upon closer insepction, you realize it says, 'I'm sleepy, let me rest.')
(It draws something on a scroll and hands it to you. It's a picture of a creature being slammed to death by an Imler. That's most definitely the first sign of a serial killer in the making.)
(This particular creature is extremely introverted, which is a rarity for Imlings.)
(It's busy drawing a picture on a scroll. Upon further inspection, you realize it's a lewd picture of Hebron's mother.)
(The Imling is holding up its middle finger and waving it in front of your other creatures. Grow up, Imling.)
name: Treat Imling

lore: It is common knowledge nowadays that resurrecting a dead person becomes impossible after a certain amount of time has passed. Many throughout history have tried to challenge death, however, even in recent times. One of the byproducts of this stubborn obsession to overcome a universal law is the Trick Imler, a lifeless creature animated only by magical impulses that run through an artificial nervous system. They were considered abominations at first, but in time the Imlings accepted them as cheap labor. As these creatures are mindless, they are capable of casting spells even with their bodies destroyed.
menagerieDialog: (It unleashes a nasty burp into your face and laughs. Immature.)
(It slams its chest so hard you're surprised it didn't collapse its own lungs. It seems very angry.)
I love my Imling friends. I perfectly complement their brains with my brawn.\n\n(That's the most intelligent and self-aware thing you've ever heard an Imler say.)
(It's trying its damndest to swat at a fly in the air, to no avail.)
(This creature is trying to whistle unsuccessfully, perhaps trying to imitate someone it saw in the castle.)
name: Trick Imler

lore: Spooky Shades are born from the death of spies. Their instincts drive them to hide their identity by masking their appearance, which works as well as can be expected from a Shade. However, since these creatures can briefly put images of anything they've seen into the mind of another, many spies that work for sovereigns or crime syndicates continue doing so after death.
menagerieDialog: (It appears calm, but you should never lower your guard around a creature known for its trickery.)
(You could swear you saw this tricky little guy spying on you while you were in the privvy earlier.)
(It reaches behind your ear and, with a sly wink, produces a coin.)
(It disappears from your sight before sneaking up from behind and tickling you. Tee hee, stop that!)
(It's methodically approaching each of your creatures and shouting "BOO!" in their faces. You should probably release this creature from your service.)
name: Spooky Shade

lore:
When nightborne mist shrouds the moon's palest eye
In colder days with no warmth from the sky
Travel not late my friend, and not alone
The horseman walks, to rend your flesh from bone!
No head he needs, nor eyes to see your fear
By wicked laughter you will know he's near
One axe blow will be the last thing you see
Before he departs, laughing cruelly'
- Seasonal folk song by Undolim's famous songstress Nieve Frost
menagerieDialog: I grow tired of waiting. Let's seek out a battle!
As death is the winner of every war, it's death that I've become.
Your enemy is constantly waiting for you to let your guard down. Never let it happen.
Who else wishes to taste my steel?
Revenge, redemption... what difference does it make? In the end, violence is my only destiny.\n\n(Whoa. Calm down, edgelord.)
name: Headless Wight

lore: The life expectancy of an Abomination is usually under ten years due to their poor state of health, which they do not notice because Tartarith removed their ability to feel pain. On one occasion, a Bile Abomination vomited on another that was still in progress. One would think the God of Torture would have left it to die slowly, but he was feeling creative that day, so he fixed the damage. Using pieces of cloth from here and there, Tartarith covered the corroded skin of the creature, sewing them to its flesh with very clumsy technique. However, the hands of a God had touched the rags and unknowingly imbued his creation with extraordinary resilience.
menagerieDialog: Uhhh? No talk. No chat.
(It shoos you away. Begone, pest!)
(It turns away from you. Apparently, it's not in the mood to talk to you right now.)
Stop. Talking. STOP TALKING!
Leave. Me. Be. NO CHAT!
name: Cloth Abomination

lore: At present, some Constructs serve as labor for the heavier jobs such as construction or mining. When the war against an old ruler of Siralim came to an end, they became important assets in the reconstruction of the country.\n\nWhen a Silverbone Construct meets an enemy, the eyes on its armor's skulls shine with a ghostly blue flame. An eerie voice then emanates from within, whispering continuously, until it suddenly explodes into a bloodcurdling scream. This feature was added for frightening enemies, but in the end, it mainly served as an alarm during attacks, and to scare civilians so they got to safety more quickly.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Silverbone Construct

lore: The temple of Surathli in the city of Nex already has several of these creatures, which act as sacristans while giving the Goddess's house a more ceremonious appearance. Undoubtedly, however, its most significant contribution is guarding the borders of cities and towns, as they are very efficient in the detection and hunting of Harpies. Recently, the ruler of Nex asked the Council of Sovereigns to increase the production of these Constructs specifically for this purpose.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Skywatch Construct

lore: An important agricultural company run by a human woman started to use Treewall Constructs as a labor force. After dismissing hundreds of workers and agitating the competition, especially the Pilwiz, social unrest began to grow right during the recent war. In the absence of the then ruler of Nex, who was in Siralim to defeat the tyrant who threatened to conquer Rodia, Ilberd had no choice but to make drastic decisions during these events. Specifically, he decreed that the number of Constructs on each company's workforce can never exceed 3%.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Treewall Construct

lore: Several activists for the defense of animals, forests and rivers have demanded that the authorities of Nex use Constructs to help conserve nature and to replant the kingdom with trees, given the massive logging that has taken place due to the current war. The proposal has already reached the throne and has been debated by the council, so now only the approval of the ruler is needed to begin the massive production of Willow Constructs that will later be sent out of the cities to serve this purpose.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Willow Construct

lore: Constructs need sunlight in order to move. They have batteries inside them that gather this energy, but this is not an efficient way of recharging them during the rainy seasons or in places where the sky is often cloudy. In response to this, several alternatives have been devised: buying pre-charged batteries, recharging the batteries with spells, and the Astro Construct. This creature is constantly receiving energy, not only from the sun, but also from the stars and the moon, thanks to its much more powerful light receptors. Because this cutting-edge technology requires the use of one Nether Orb for every one hundred receptors, its price is simply astronomical.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Astro Construct

lore: The average battery life of a Construct has been estimated to be 1000 days, which is when the battery has lost too much charge and the creature stops moving permanently. The batteries cannot be replaced, so the construct must be discarded, although the material of which its body is made can be reused.\n\nThe Bloodmail Construct was created with the main purpose of preventing civilians and soldiers from bleeding to death. At a touch of its armor, the blood is partially returned to the circulatory system, giving the doctors more options to save their life.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Bloodmail Construct

lore: A few wealthy citizens have already acquired one or more of these creatures to dispense with the services of butlers, as they require no salary.\n\nThe Heavenshield Construct can open its armor and let a creature close to its size inside. In this way, these creatures have managed to save thousands of civilians and wounded soldiers during Siralim's attacks by moving them to a safe place. Ilberd has not ruled out having different sizes of these Constructs built in the near future.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Heavenshield Construct

lore: The MK project was inevitably delayed by the overwhelming victories of Siralim's army and its advance through the country. Its architects had to move from kingdom to kingdom to continue the project until they finally ended up in Nex.\n\nThe Magma Construct's body always has a very high temperature, so it can quickly heat a whole room. This is why the Council of Rodia is planning to set up large buildings like temples or factories with several of these creatures, so people can take refuge during the harshest winter nights.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Magma Construct

lore: The Constructs helped the army of Nex to protect civilians in the streets of the capital and to guard its walls. When the war was about to end, they became available for general purchase in the kingdom.\n\nThe Nightveil Construct is equipped with a speech synthesizer that activates in certain conditions. Moreover, it can store voice messages in its memory, which makes it a particularly useful nighttime messenger, due also to its ability to go unnoticed in the dark.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Nightveil Construct

lore: When an old ruler of Siralim began the conquest of Rodia, Ilberd advised the King of Nex to propose to the Council of Sovereigns the construction of automatons designed to defend the country. The project was named MK.\n\nThe Redsteel Construct can easily detach parts of its body and forge weapons of acceptable quality in a matter of seconds. This allows civilians and soldiers to arm themselves quickly if they have lost their weapon or do not have one. It can restore the missing parts of its body simply by getting close to red-hot steel.
menagerieDialog: (You're still unsure about how to communicate with this creature. While it obeys your every command, you're unable to understand what it says to you.)
(Though it lacks the ability to personify its emotions, you have a feeling it's ready and raring to fight.)
(Nothing breeds subservience quite like being programmed by humans.)
(You can sense the raw power and lust for battle emmanating from this creature.)
(With a bit of time and effort, you might be able to program this creature to automate chores around the castle.)
name: Redsteel Construct

lore: The Stag Guide is one of the rarest specimens of its kind, and capturing one is almost impossible due to its ability to travel through time. Their horns were believed to be the source of this power, but a scientist from Neralim recently proved the rumors wrong. Despite this discovery, these creatures are still being hunted by countless mercenaries, so they have become timider and less aggressive.
menagerieDialog: (You have a feeling that, if it could, it would spend the whole day grazing.)
(Upon your approach, it snorts indignantly and tosses its head as if frustrated by something.)
(This creature's wisdom is unmatched by other species. If only you could communicate with it...)
(It's prancing and dancing around, putting on a little show for your other creatures.)
(This creature is always the last one to join in a battle. Perhaps it would be better suited to living out the rest of its days in your castle.)
name: Stag Guide

lore: Many artists dedicate their lives to performing for the general public during festivities. This forces them to keep traveling throughout the year, but they return to their place of origin for the winter festival that commemorates the victory against the Watchers. There they sing and dance with their relatives and childhood friends, strengthening the bonds that unite them. When these artists die during this period, a Bard Caroller is sometimes created. This creature's music brings out existing emotions and positive thoughts, and it can even make two people who hate each other hug.
menagerieDialog: (A spell that allows telepathic communication was discovered in the Refuge of the Magi centuries ago after countless experiments were done on these creatures.)
(This creature has a peculiar habit of stimulating the minds of everyone around it. Right now, it's projecting some aggressive metal music into your brain.)
(Despite having no discernable facial features, you always find it easy to read this creature's mood.)
(It's playing a gentle song for your other creatures who are listening with rapt attention.)
(You can't help but wonder what it looks like without a robe on.)
name: Bard Caroller

lore: These creatures only live in the high mountains where freezing winds blow without pause. However, they travel to snow-covered towns and cities during the winter and slide around the ground, leaving a trail of ice that Brownies and children from many species use as a skating rink. They do not usually cause problems, so adults let their children play with them, but they get restless if they are forced to remain in a warm location, producing hail and cursing while moving around in a frenzy.
menagerieDialog: (It's sleeping lazily, and its snores sound like little blasts of thunder. It's oddly endearing.)
(Lightning is brimming from its mouth. It must be eager to fight.)
(It offers to shake your hand. You comply, and it shocks you. The fact that you didn't see that coming speaks volumes.)
I am the sky. I am the rain. I am the thunder.\n\n(Wow. That's deep.)
(It's gently zapping your other creatures, none of whom seem to appreciate the gesture.)
name: Blizzard

lore: During the winter festivities, many people around the world decorate a fir so that it resembles an Evergreen Ent. These creatures live in snowy places and never stray too far from home. If they see a stranger attacking an animal, they sink their roots in the snow and extend them to deliver a surprise blow to the aggressor.
menagerieDialog: There is nothing quite like the clean air of a Rodian forest.
I'll make short work of anyone who dares desecrate nature.
This castle smells like a wasteland. I would prefer to leave this place at once.
I feel invigorated in your presence. Thank you for looking after me.
(A little bird is nesting in this creature's branches which is oddly endearing.)
name: Evergreen Ent

lore: Holiday Spirits have no color or shine for most of the year and can be mistaken for a suspicious-looking bush. During the winter festivities, however, they regain their vitality and quickly travel to the nearest town or village, no matter how densely populated. There they fly among the crowd, wearing a permanent smile. Rodians greatly enjoy the display when many of these creatures gather.
menagerieDialog: (Something about this creature's presence is particularly comforting.)
(Spirits are not known for their love of violence, but this one appears to be an exception.)
(While Spirits are typically a joy to be around thanks to their friendly nature, this one is especially ingratiating due to its keen intellect.)
(It's very quick to make friends with your other creatures. Such camaraderie will be useful in battle.)
(It appears to be in a fantastic mood, as usual. You only wish that you could have such a light attitude sometimes.)
name: Holiday Spirit

lore: Two hundred years ago, the dean of the Magic University of Neralim received a gift from one of her colleagues for Purple Victory Day. When she opened it, she was greeted by two dreadful rows of fangs and devoured in a single bite before she could react. The next morning her colleague was provisionally appointed as dean; a position she managed to keep for ten years, which at the time was the longest possible term of deanship, established to prevent such practices.
menagerieDialog: (It looks like a harmless chest, but you know better.)
(Honestly, it's not as clever as it thinks it is. The giant eyes, enormous tongue, and spiked teeth give away its attempts at secrecy.)
(It has so many teeth that you struggle to count them all. There are at least 12.)
HWAH HAH HAH HAH HAH! HWAAAAAAAAH! HA HA HA! SURPRIIIIIISE!\n\n(The novelty of this creature wore off incredibly fast.)
(You wonder what sort of consciousness is behind its vibrant gaze.)
name: Gift Mimic

lore: Most Elves spend their lives among their own, but not all of them prefer life in the forest. Some become mercenaries, bandits or just ordinary citizens in human settlements. Jingle Elves, however, did not decide to abandon their people but were exiled by them. The rest of the Elves consider these creatures abominations, mistakes of nature. Any plants around them, even the largest trees, wither and die as if the Jingle Elves were involuntarily absorbing their energy, and their presence even seems to disrupt the rituals of the Elf Mystics. Despite everything, Jingle Elves overcome adversity and prosper in society outside the Cutthroat Jungle, often acting as minstrels for the great sovereigns of the different kingdoms of the world.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Jingle Elf

lore: It was a winter morning when the Watcher Sentinel finally bit the dust thousands of years ago. The bloody war had ended, and that day became part of the world's history, to be celebrated every year. The Gods had gathered in the battlefield, and Vulcanar raised his finger to the sky and fired a spell to create a colorful lightshow that thrilled the survivors. Torun, enraged, decided to create a Giant that would travel to towns and cities delivering gifts on that day "without expecting anything in return", because, although mortals were insignificant creatures, he wouldn't let them favor his archrival over him.
menagerieDialog: Humans are weak! Even baby Giants can crush your kind with one hand.
I'll send your enemies flying with a kick to the gut. Bring it on!
If you ever need any help re-arranging your castle, I'm your Giant! Just say the word.
(It's curling two of your other creatures as they all giggle maniacally. It would probably be best for you to leave them to it.)
(It's playing some make-shift drums using its stool and two excessively large tree trunks.)
name: Jolly Old Giant

lore: Puddings spend most of the year hibernating in remote places. This kind of Dumpling awakens for eleven days in the winter and voraciously feeds on any organic matter it finds, so it is one of the few members of this species that is more predator than prey. Unlike other Dumplings, Puddings have an unpleasant taste no matter how they are cooked. However, a chef of great skill can use them to prepare a dessert that has no equal.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: Pudding

lore: Troll Kings usually die a few years after they reach that position. However, some of them rule until they become too old, at which point they decide to abdicate for their own safety... or rather, they are advised to do so. Without exception, next to these Kings there has always been a Trollboar, a rare specimen of the species who, despite what its appearance may suggest, is much more intelligent than the other Trolls and pulls the King's strings from the shadows.
menagerieDialog: Human kings are weak. You should let us Trolls lead you instead!
Let's go burn some villages down!
You rely on magic far too much. Brute strength is always the way to go!
(You're constantly amazed at just how badly this creature smells.)
(This creature stinks, but you really can't blame Nortah. Who would want to clean a Troll?)
name: Trollboar

lore: Ascendant Revenants never use melee weapons in battle. They are great engineers who learned to use gunpowder in a continent far from Rodia, as well as a real pain in the neck for the authorities. Although, luckily, they are few in number, these creatures cause so much damage that those who live to tell the tale always describe it as "unfair." Their enemies either explode or are cut down by the Revenant's companions while trying to tear the devices from their bodies. After the war ends, Rodia's council will make it a top priority to find a way to reduce the damage these contraptions cause in battle.
menagerieDialog: It's a common misconception that all Revenants like to fight. I, for one, would prefer to lead a quiet life and dedicate myself to collecting minerals.
What's wrong? You look like a fish out of water.\n\nHA!
(Revenants hate when you call them "fish people". Never make that mistake.)
I am not a fish. I am NOT. A FISH.\n\n(This is the most sensitive fish you've ever met.)
(It smells like dead fish. Probably because that's exactly what it is.)
name: Ascendant Revenant

lore: This creature's name is cruelly ironic. When the claws of a Fortune Dragon pierce an enemy's flesh, they transmit an infectious disease that is lethal if left untreated for twenty-four hours. Dragon Queens usually have them attack any outsiders who break the laws of the Unsullied Meadows, leaving them alive. This is meant to serve as a warning due to the extreme pain the victims suffer during the course of the disease.
menagerieDialog: I'll guard your treasure for you while you're away.
Your insignificantly short-lived existence must depress you. We Dragons live for thousands of years while humans live and die in the blink of an eye.
The air here is stagnant. You could at least add a window or two to allow a fresh breeze in here to freshen things up, you know.
Tell Nortah to polish my scales. It has been far too long since they've received the attention they deserve.
I hope to set off on an adventure of my own one day.\n\n(Yep, not going to happen.)
name: Fortune Dragon

lore: Like the rest of the Amaranths, this creature only responds with violence when it is in danger. By concentrating, it can summon fire from anywhere in the world and use it against whoever is trying to harm it. Milner and Helmholtz, two legendary Magi who managed to overcome death, have noticed how the Amaranths have become more restless with the passage of centuries, and sightings of them have increased. However, they have not yet found an explanation for this mystery.
menagerieDialog: (You can't seem to catch its attention at all...)
(Such a mysterious creature. You suspect you'll never fully understand them.)
(It seems to be highly observant of its surroundings.)
(It's spinning around on its side. Pretty cool, really.)
(Its inability to blink unsettles you. Its lonely eye constantly scans up and down, left and right - as if it's always searching for something.)
name: Solar Amaranth

lore: When two Wolpertingers of different subspecies mate, half of the litter resembles the mother and the other half resembles the father. The Vernal Wolpertinger is the only one of its kind that carries its litter while hunting. On its own it has no magical power whatsoever, but when the whole family is together its skin emits a powerful multi-colored glow and becomes as tough as heavy armor.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up into a little ball with its eyes half-closed. A nap is imminent.)
(You're constantly amazed at how violent this creature is. Even after it has slain its foes, it continues goring them with its horn.)
(It's eating a pile of trash. Hm. To each his own.)
(It bucks at the air anxiously. Perhaps a drugged carrot will settle it down.)
(The creature is growling at you. Unfortunately for it, you can't take it seriously at all since it has a piece of food caught between its teeth.)
name: Vernal Wolpertinger

lore: There are numerous stories about lucky items and animals, and enough proof to know most of them are just stories. However, the Squash is an exception to the rule. Like most Dumplings, these creatures are very elusive. However, those who obtain one are undoubtedly blessed with good luck. It is as if the universe conspired so that everything that happens around this creature ends well for those nearby, which has led to terrible stories about the consequences of eating a Squash, as well as explanations from more skeptical people who think the Squash simply affects the world around it with some sort of magic.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: Squash

lore: The Apis Adolescent owes its name to its lack of horns. However, it is similar in size to the other Apis, which begin to grow horns immediately after birth. In the past, it was able to channel the power of other Apis to increase their power over the weather and the soil's fertility, helping them change whatever they wished. At present, these creatures can turn certain spells into an energy blast that deals massive damage to whoever cast them.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns and turns away from you.)
(It seems unnecessarily agitated. Perhaps a few battles will drain its aggression.)
(You can't help but feel as though it knows exactly what you're thinking.)
(Upon your approach, it licks your hand over and over and over again. True love.)
(This creature is easily startled. You attempted to pat its head and it jumped as if it didn't know you were there.)
name: Apis Adolescent

lore: These creatures approach human cities during the festivities with a single purpose: to spoil everyone's joy. They are especially creative when it comes to carrying out their perverse plans, deceiving everyone with clever disguises. Fed up with their misdeeds, a powerful businessman from Siralim whose wedding had been ruined by one of these Devils traveled to the Refuge of the Magi and offered an exorbitant sum of money in exchange for a solution to the problem. After some calculations, thirty-seven Magi from the Refuge traveled to Siralim to visit the great Orb that lies beneath the city. There they carried out a complex ritual that lasted for a week but was finally successful. The appearance of all Bunny Devils became so ridiculous that it would be hard for them to deceive anyone ever again.
menagerieDialog: You're the big boss here, right? You should share some of them resources with me, neh?
I prefer blades over magic. What's the fun in casting a spell when there's no blood to show in the aftermath of your effort?
The devil's in the details, neh?\n\n(Well, that was random.)
I have an idea! You should raise your kingdom's taxes. That way, you can steal from everyone with impunity.
I absolutely, positively did not steal this bag of coins from anyone.
name: Bunny Devil

lore: These creatures owe their name to their uncanny resemblance to a chocolate bar. Their history goes back to the Unification War, when Milner and Helmholtz were preparing for the final battle. Many tests were needed before they managed to create the unique Paragons they used against Sigmund. The Chocolate Paragon was their last failed experiment before the Opal Paragon was created, and the only one to survive the procedures of two of the greatest Magi in history.
menagerieDialog: Your Eminence, please allow me to rest for a bit. It's been a long day.
We must constantly re-evaluate our battle strategies to ensure that our foes can never get the best of us.
Everett is a liar. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Two Paragons make a King Paragon. Two King Paragons make a Gold Paragon. Two Gold Paragons make a Grandpa Paragon.\n\nWait, what?
Something is amiss. I cannot say what is wrong for certain, but I am unable to shake this feeling of dread.
name: Chocolate Paragon

lore: When Calkins taught the Dryads to carry a sprout of their oaks so they could travel greater distances, there were some that moved away from the forests and jungles in search of the radiant sun. Those that reached the coasts kept their purpose, but the strong heat gradually changed them as generations passed, until they became Dryad Sunbathers. These creatures' whispers force whoever hears them to obey their commands, although they don't affect those with a strong will.
menagerieDialog: More and more forests are destroyed each year; your kind should be more careful.
I will show the world what it means to disrespect nature.
I wish you'd build a garden in our kingdom so I can feel a bit more at home.
I sometimes miss the forest. Can we return there for a visit one day?
I believe this kingdom could use a few more trees and plants to liven things up a bit. What do you think?
name: Dryad Sunbather

lore: The Festival Smog is a creature originally designed for festive purposes. It was developed in an illegal laboratory and it usually fetches a high price in the black market. The Mage who directed the project was expelled from the Magic University of Siralim years ago for performing illegal tests on intelligent subjects, and she was locked in a regular prison with anti-magic protection. However, she managed to escape thanks to her contacts and started a new life. The authorities are currently trying to track down her fraudulent activities without much success.
menagerieDialog: (It's spinning in place while mumbling its name over and over again.)
(It's emitting so much smoke that your creatures are doubled over in fits of coughing.)
(You can only hope that your other creatures doesn't have asthma.)
(It makes a whistling sound upon your approach, much like a tea kettle. Strange.)
(It's blowing large puffs of smoke into the air. That can't possibly be healthy for you and your creatures.)
name: Festival Smog

lore: This creature can withstand extremely low temperatures and constantly generates cold when it opens its jaws. Its breath is not cold enough to freeze a person, but being around one can be unbearable without the right clothes and even lead to hypothermia. However, as this is a Mimic subspecies, that person would likely end up in its stomach (or whatever it has in its place) long before it could die from the cold.
menagerieDialog: (It looks like a harmless chest, but you know better.)
(Honestly, it's not as clever as it thinks it is. The giant eyes, enormous tongue, and spiked teeth give away its attempts at secrecy.)
(It has so many teeth that you struggle to count them all. There are at least 12.)
HWAH HAH HAH HAH HAH! HWAAAAAAAAH! HA HA HA! SURPRIIIIIISE!\n\n(The novelty of this creature wore off incredibly fast.)
(You wonder what sort of consciousness is behind its vibrant gaze.)
name: Killer Cooler

lore: This variety of Dumpling has drastic effects on the central nervous system when eaten raw. One bite is enough to double a human's heart rate and leave them unable to sleep for three days, at which time the effects begin to subside. Due to its effects, it is now being studied in Rodia for its medical applications. On the other hand, if it is correctly cooked, the impact and duration of its effects can be reduced to the point of being harmless.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: Melon

lore: It was thousands of years ago when Omelettes first encountered humans. Specifically, they were integrated into the society of Kaito, where they let humans paint them during their rituals of birth and death. When that civilization came to an end, the Omelettes dispersed throughout the world and tried to befriend humans from other places. Many of these Dumplings had to pay a great price before they became more than food for the humans, but they are now considered sacred creatures in Rodia and other regions of the world.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: Omelette

lore: After the Watcher War, some of the refugees from Kaito started a new life in the Unsullied Meadows. Since the Dragons were too busy dealing with the Watchers, Aeolian was the first to notice their presence... and the first to ask them to abandon his realm. But he also knew of Kaito's plight, and seeing how respectful those people had been gave him an idea: he would let them stay for a generation before making a choice. When the time was up, Aeolian found that the humans had not only survived while preserving nature, but also improved the state of his realm wherever they had settled. Those refugees became the first humans to live in the Unsullied Meadows. In a gesture of gratitude and praise, Aeolian created the Ovoid Vortex to protect them, inspired by the Omelettes that lived with the refugees.
menagerieDialog: (It whirls around in circles, emitting a powerful light.)
(It whirs around the menagerie, annoying your other creatures who are trying to rest.)
(This creature's presence is particularly welcome in the stuffy confines of these castle walls.)
(It's starting to lose its luster - it might be time to feed it another Spell Gem.)
(This creature is surprisingly small when it's not wreaking havoc with its winds.)
name: Ovoid Vortex

lore: Watchers have been undergoing changes for the last few centuries, as if their structure were becoming unstable for an unknown reason. These are mostly isolated cases, but examples like the Inflatable Watcher make it very obvious. Scientists around the world are trying to solve this enigma, while a certain secret organization has made the origin of this anomaly its main goal.
menagerieDialog: (These days, no one is particularly afraid of these creatures, but in the past they nearly destroyed the world.)
(Its single eye is completely bloodshot. It's either angry or hungover, neither of which are preferable.)
(It blinks at you bashfully. It must respect you quite a lot.)
(It's doing pushups, which is probably quite important for a creature with only one limb.)
(It's flipping its eye back and forth. Perhaps this is its way of showing you that it's nervous.)
name: Inflatable Watcher

lore: There are stories in the towns around the forests of Undolim about a creature that feeds on naughty children. Long ago, a rebellious little girl decided to put an end to that old wives' tale by entering the forest with her friends. At nightfall, she led them down a path among the trees, waited for them to get lost and hid herself. She would end the stories, yes, but why not give them a good scare first? Her friends, frightened, began to call her in increasingly loud voices. When they were just about to panic, the girl dropped from a tree and roared as if she were a ferocious beast. Her friends turned around, but their reaction was not what she expected. They looked pale and were paralyzed by fear, looking in the girl's direction but not at her. Her heart sank as she slowly turned around and met the ghostly eyes of the Tanukrook.
menagerieDialog: (It seems to dislike being around other creatures...)
(Its jaws are wide open, as if it were roaring, but there's no sound. Or perhaps it's at a frequency you can't hear.)
(This creature's keen sense of smell could be vital in warning you of potential danger.)
