lore: This is the largest Dumpling by far, an unusual specimen that cannot be found easily. It lives in small palaces that have mysteriously been built in impossible places, such as cold, rugged mountains without any flora or fauna, hidden from view from almost every angle. These buildings are the birthplace of all Dumplings, so they are riddled with these endearing creatures. Some are of the opinion that this story is nothing more than a fairytale, while others desperately search for the King Dumpling's home so they can capture all possible Dumplings and earn a fortune. If threatened, King Dumpling becomes a formidable foe that all Dumplings obey without question.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: King Dumpling

lore: This creature has often been attributed miraculous properties, for many reasons. Around this creature, trees bloom, crops manage to grow despite the droughts, and grass sprouts where it should not. Finding one is an extraordinary feat, and keeping one close is extremely difficult, as it can easily escape by becoming imperceptible to the senses of living beings.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns, making a cute, squeaking sound in the process.)
(How can something so cute exist in a world like this?)
(It's constantly trying to convince your other creatures to play with it.)
(It blushes and giggles every time you come near it.)
(It seems lonely. Perhaps you should buy it a cat to play with.)
name: Nugget

lore: This creature's roots are not entirely visible unless magic is used. They stretch out a great distance beyond what the eye can see, and cling to the creature's allies. In this way, it receives nourishment when they act, gaining power for a limited time. However, this creature is extremely hard to breed and needs proper care to even survive longer than a few days, so many biologists already consider this species extinct.
menagerieDialog: Can't we stay here and rest for a while? I need at least eight hours of sleep in order to grow big and strong!
Let me at 'em! I'll choke them out and devour their flesh!\n\n...just as soon as I grow a bit more, that is.
I find it both odd and frustrating that I turn back into a sapling at the end of every battle.
(It's sound asleep, cooing softly. Who would've thought that plants could coo?)
(It closes its eyes and mouth upon your approach in a failed attempt to look like a harmless root vegetable.)
name: Herbling

lore: The energy contained within Mimics is not always stable, and sometimes it reaches a critical point and escapes outwards, turning them into a Pandora. It was named by a prestigious, but very old and almost senile, scientist who witnessed this transformation while studying Mimics. According to him, the evils of the world had attracted the darkness of this creature, and it would trigger the end of days.
menagerieDialog: (It looks like a harmless chest, but you know better.)
(Honestly, it's not as clever as it thinks it is. The giant eyes, enormous tongue, and spiked teeth give away its attempts at secrecy.)
(It has so many teeth that you struggle to count them all. There are at least 12.)
HWAH HAH HAH HAH HAH! HWAAAAAAAAH! HA HA HA! SURPRIIIIIISE!\n\n(The novelty of this creature wore off incredibly fast.)
(You wonder what sort of consciousness is behind its vibrant gaze.)
name: Pandora

lore: This creature looks like an Apocalypse, but it is not one of them. It was artificially created by the Auditors and ordered to stop any outsiders who enter Ubi Concordia. The cry of the so-called Zzyia Apocalypse chills anyone who hears it to the bone, as it was programmed to do. During the development of this creature, the Auditors researched which sounds activated the parts of the brain that produce fear, until they found one capable of terrorizing hundreds of different species.
menagerieDialog: (Is it really sleeping at a time like this?)
(It's rearing its heads around in circles. At this rate, it's going to break something.)
(You were always terrified of these creatures as a child, and with good reason. Each head sways around unpredictably, and you constantly struggle to understand its intentions.)
(Its many heads often get into arguments with each other. It must be tough being an Apocalypse.)
(All of its heads are swaying around in little circles. You should probably have Nortah check it out and make sure it's not sick.)
name: Zzyia Apocalypse

lore: This devilish pest enjoys torturing its victims with its own hands, generally ripping them open to eat their guts while they are still alive. It considers the bloodstains on its body lucky charms and never cleans them up, even if it is its own blood. That is why the scent of a Feral Carver is so characteristic, to the point of serving as a warning to many adventurers when they are near one of their lairs.
menagerieDialog: I know there are prisoners in the castle dungeons. Let me have some fun with them, eh?
The best way to kill an enemy is to do it nice and slowly. Take a few body parts at a time and bleed them out.
...and so I cut his right leg off and beat him with it! Isn't that hilarious?
If ever one of your people gets sick, come to me. I'll put them out of their misery. You can count on me!
Come on, come on, come on! We've killed very little today.
name: Feral Carver

lore: The bite of the Sabertooth Manticore is as good as that of the Martyaxwar, but its fangs are so durable that they can also block sharp weapons as if they were a shield. Sooner or later, the fangs suffer visible damage or even break off. Luckily for this creature, it can shed them once a month, and they only take four days to regrow, as strong as they were before.
menagerieDialog: (These creatures were created to destroy humans; you should be careful while it's in the castle.)
(You've noticed the way it looks at you. Its homicidal instincts are barely contained by your bond.)
(It seems to be sizing up your other creatures, as if it's competing to see which is the strongest.)
(You'll never quite get used to this creature's tail, knowing that at any moment it could sink it deep into your heart and kill you in the blink of an eye.)
(It seems to grow restless any time you approach it. Perhaps you should try a different method of interacting with it.)
name: Sabertooth Manticore

lore: This creature continuously expels fire, and can produce flames of up to fifteen feet in length. If surrounded, it spins rapidly and blasts fire at full power to drive its enemies away. It prefers to wander through dry places where vegetation is scarce. Although this is fortunate for Rodia's forests and crops, Incendiary Smogs attack merchant caravans even when they are at a disadvantage, generally causing substantial losses before being subdued if not detected early.
menagerieDialog: (It's spinning in place while mumbling its name over and over again.)
(It's emitting so much smoke that your creatures are doubled over in fits of coughing.)
(You can only hope that your other creatures doesn't have asthma.)
(It makes a whistling sound upon your approach, much like a tea kettle. Strange.)
(It's blowing large puffs of smoke into the air. That can't possibly be healthy for you and your creatures.)
name: Incendiary Smog

lore: The Chaos Troll is always on the front lines, and before entering battle it consumes a drug that inhibits pain and causes an uncontrollable state of anger. Its body paint is not merely decorative, it is also used to warn other Trolls of its presence, as it is likely to attack them as well after all enemies are gone.
menagerieDialog: Human kings are weak. You should let us Trolls lead you instead!
Let's go burn some villages down!
You rely on magic far too much. Brute strength is always the way to go!
(You're constantly amazed at just how badly this creature smells.)
(This creature stinks, but you really can't blame Nortah. Who would want to clean a Troll?)
name: Chaos Troll

lore: While this creature is not really a giant, it is programmed to speak like one of them. Like other robots created by the Auditors, it has the order to exterminate any outsider who manages to enter Ubi Concordia. In addition to its extraordinary strength, the War Giant possesses a plasma cannon with devastating firepower. The more it charges its shot, the further the explosion will reach, and the stronger it will be.
menagerieDialog: Humans are weak! Even baby Giants can crush your kind with one hand.
I'll send your enemies flying with a kick to the gut. Bring it on!
If you ever need any help re-arranging your castle, I'm your Giant! Just say the word.
(It's curling two of your other creatures as they all giggle maniacally. It would probably be best for you to leave them to it.)
(It's playing some make-shift drums using its stool and two excessively large tree trunks.)
name: War Giant

lore: This creature is not really a Masochist, but an automaton at the service of the Auditors. If intruders were to sneak into the city of Ubi Concordia, the Masochist Freak would run its attack program to end their lives. This creature's plasma katars can pierce flesh and bone with ease, but their energy is limited. When the energy is exhausted, it can put its arms into an organic body and absorb its entrails until it is completely empty. Inside the Masochist Freak, a chemical process will take place that transforms these organs into fuel.
menagerieDialog: (It's casually whittling away at its arm with a knife.)
(It keeps scraping its katars together. In other words, it's making the most annoying noise in the world.)
(It never seems to stop hurting itself. Fortunately, your kingdom's healers are some of the best in all of Rodia.)
(This creature takes a sickening amount of pleasure in being wounded.)
(This creature never eats or sleeps. How it survives is a mystery to even your most astute scholars.)
name: Masochist Freak

lore: There is a common misconception in Rodia that the Phobos Banshee feeds on the fear of other creatures. This rumor was initially spread by a doctor in Neralim after she realized how scared people were of the creature. When the doctor's colleagues found out what she was doing, they started to imitate her, and in a few years people went from running away from this Banshee to getting close to her, feeling more relaxed thanks to the placebo effect.
menagerieDialog: (It remains motionless despite your approach, donning an aura of inscrutable mystery.)
(The emotional instability of this creature is truly a sight to behold. If it's not screaming at inanimate objects, it's crying in a corner.)
(Why is this creature always crying? It's almost as if it refuses to ever be happy.)
Let my cries chill the living.
(She's crying, as usual. Perhaps someday you'll find a way to cheer her up.)
name: Phobos Banshee

lore: Some Nixes are banished from their towns and cities for serious crimes. Many look for underground caves to settle alone or with others of their kind who have also been exiled. Others seek their fortune by working for the less important or newer crime syndicates. Their methods are usually less orthodox than those of the other Nixes, and their goals are much more varied. When they carry out a mission, their success rate is clearly lower and they often make a mess.
menagerieDialog: Leave me alone. I must rest before we venture forth into a new Realm.
You should strive to be more efficient. There's no need to stop back at your castle between every single realm.
I hear you've got a problem that needs solved.
My blade is ready. Let's assassinate some kings.
This castle is so loud and overwhelming. I can't wait to get out of here.
name: Nix Exile

lore: Marine Pit Worms are deep sea creatures who were brought to the mainland by Revenant raiding parties. In their natural habitat, they feed on all kinds of creatures, including, of course, the Revenants themselves. Their diet on the surface is largely the same, and they act like voracious predators to anything that is not a cat. For unknown reasons, the mere presence of these small felines provokes an intense feeling of dread in Marine Pit Worms, driving them to speed away as quickly as they can.
menagerieDialog: (Doesn't it ever stop drooling? Disgusting.)
(It never stops wriggling. Frankly, its mannerisms are a bit disconcerting.)
(One benefit of having this creature around is that you never need to worry about disposing of corpses.)
(It's making a disgusting noise with its mouth, not unlike a dog eating oatmeal.)
(It insists on making disgusting sucking noises with its mouth.)
name: Marine Pit Worm

lore: This creature is not really a Reaper, but an automaton created to eliminate anyone who enters the city of Ubi Concordia without the Auditors' permission. It handles its scythe formidably, and it does not need to hold it at all to strike with it. Trying to snatch its weapon away is a mistake, as the scythe can deliver a powerful electric shock if it is being held by anyone other than its owner.
menagerieDialog: Oh, hello there! Would you like to know the exact date of your death?
While I can't hold your hand, I will have your back.
(This creature always seems to be focused on something you can't see.)
Don't fear the reaper.\n\n(Sigh. How clichÃ©.)
(Its inability to stop grinning is rather unsettling for you and your creatures.)
name: Tech Reaper

lore: Some warriors of Surathli protect her designs too vehemently. Many go astray and commit atrocities in the name of Light. A few of these warriors, consumed by rage at not having accomplished their goals, remain in this world even after losing their lives. They are known as Holy Wights, bloodthirsty creatures who are unable to distinguish between good and evil.
menagerieDialog: I grow tired of waiting. Let's seek out a battle!
As death is the winner of every war, it's death that I've become.
Your enemy is constantly waiting for you to let your guard down. Never let it happen.
Who else wishes to taste my steel?
Revenge, redemption... what difference does it make? In the end, violence is my only destiny.\n\n(Whoa. Calm down, edgelord.)
name: Holy Wight

lore: Egas the Necromancer once corrupted some Aspects with his power so they would fight in his army during the Unification War. However, once Egas was defeated, they dispersed. They live in places where the land is sterile and the seasons never seem to alter the climate or the ecosystem much. Some travelers fear these creatures and run away from their terrifying appearance, but they are not aggressive creatures.
menagerieDialog: (Its eyes are closed, as if meditating.)
(It's making annoying clicking noises by pounding its staff on the ground. It must be agitated.)
(It is meditating. Better to leave it alone while it relaxes.)
(This is perhaps the wisest creature you've ever met. You are fortunate to have such a knowledgeable creature on your side.)
(Its fur is a total mess. You should have Nortah comb it soon.)
name: Aspect of Decay

lore: This creature owes its name to its sinister appearance that has scared many travelers. However, people who live near caves or very dense forests where sunlight barely shines through the canopy know there is no reason to be afraid of them. In such places, it is common to have heard stories in which someone who was missing returns several days later thanks to an Evil Spirit's help.
menagerieDialog: (Something about this creature's presence is particularly comforting.)
(Spirits are not known for their love of violence, but this one appears to be an exception.)
(While Spirits are typically a joy to be around thanks to their friendly nature, this one is especially ingratiating due to its keen intellect.)
(It's very quick to make friends with your other creatures. Such camaraderie will be useful in battle.)
(It appears to be in a fantastic mood, as usual. You only wish that you could have such a light attitude sometimes.)
name: Evil Spirit

lore: The Deep Clutcher catches its enemies by using its tentacles, which can be more effective than the usual fingers of these creatures. Even if some creatures can easily slip away from these tentacles, they will start to move more slowly due to the paralyzing poison they secrete.
menagerieDialog: (It's giving you a thumbs-up. It must enjoy killing other creatures.)
(It's raising its middle finger and displaying it to you and all your creatures. While this may seem childish, you admit to yourself that you'd do the same thing if your body was a giant hand.)
(It's impatiently tapping the floor with its fingertips.)
(It's gently stroking one of your other creatures with a single finger. Creepy.)
(It skitters away, walking on its fingers to make a disconcerting clattering sound.)
name: Deep Clutcher

lore: When these Plague Doctors find a badly injured person in risk of bleeding out, they perform a blood transfusion. Indeed, humans and other intelligent species learned this technique from them, as well as the fact that not all blood types are compatible. If a Plague Phlebotomist's patient was injured unjustly by another creature, it will sneak into their room while they are sleeping and draw all the blood they can without ending the creature's life.
menagerieDialog: Bend over, grab your ankles, and cough!
(It points at you, then mimes a drinking motion. Unsure about how to respond, you pretend to be distracted by another one of your creatures.)
(It hands you a vial full of purple liquid. You shake your head as if to reject its offer, and it glances downward with a sad look on its face.)
(It picks its nose, but it's not really gross because its nose is a mask. Pretty neat.)
(It was busy mixing a potion before you startled it and caused it to drop its vials on the ground.)
name: Plague Phlebotomist

lore: The Malice Harpy is a master of camouflage and concealment, and the one who most often manages to sneak into towns and cities. Its tricks never seem to end, from playing with the night shadows to sneaking in undetected, or even hiding under carriages or among the merchandise, or wearing a hooded robe to walk through the main gates during the day taking advantage of the crowd. For this and other reasons, guards often check the caravans who want to enter, and look carefully at the face of anyone who tries to conceal their identity.
menagerieDialog: (It appears content, but you're certain it will have a tantrum the moment you turn your back on it.)
(This creature is trying to pull out your hair to make an effigy. You're not sure whether to be flattered or revolted.)
(She has a terrible attitude, snapping at your other creatures whenever the opportunity presents itself.)
(Harpies are known for their deep hatred of humans. Fortunately for you, its loyalty is held steadfast by your magic.)
(It's flapping its wings and squawking even more obnoxiously than usual. It's probably sick. Good.)
name: Malice Harpy

lore: This creature's left hand allows it to absorb water from any organism, although the process is not instantaneous. Some crime syndicates use this creature as a form of torture, having it dry out their enemies limb from limb. To the delight of many, a spell was developed centuries ago that can reverse the damage done by this terrifying ability.
menagerieDialog: EAT FLESH!
(You can't help but wonder how this creature came to become so damn ugly.)
(It eyes your other creatures hungrily. Better get it a steak before you're left without a team.)
Must... eat... more... footses...
Want... to eat... more... feet...
name: Ghoul Ringleader

lore: Beams of electricity traverse the Thunderwound Angel's body continously. Touching this creature is dangerous, since they can produce discharges powerful enough to burn a small animal to a crisp. In battle, they summon a spear made of electricity that pierces through swords, shields, and armor, unless they were properly enchanted to resist it.
menagerieDialog: (It appears to be calm, but you know a terrifying spectacle awaits its enemies.)
(This creature radiates an aura of violence. Perfect for decimating your foes.)
(You can tell it feels restless. Perhaps it knows a battle is coming.)
(This is perhaps the most serious and focused creature you've ever encountered. It will serve you well in battle.)
(It meets your gaze with a firm, confident, and yet obedient stare. This creature is well-suited for battle.)
name: Thunderwound Angel

lore: This creature is not really a Demigod, although it is programmed to speak like them. To protect Ubi Concordia, a utopic city the Auditors built near the North Pole, thousands of robots were built with the sole purpose of exterminating anyone who managed to overcome the magical barrier Dragan and other Magi had erected around the city. To date, these robots have never had to execute their only order, but copies of them have slipped through the Itherian Realms, making it possible to see these creatures elsewhere.
menagerieDialog: I will not waste my breath speaking with the likes of you.
Unleash me! Let us destroy our foes together as one.
There is much to be learned from this world. Do not take a single moment for granted.
(You feel fortunate to have power over such a mighty creature. With a Demigod by your side, you just might rule the world someday.)
I grow restless. Let us take our leave at once.
name: Supreme Administrator

lore: When a Griffon reaches a certain age, it usually retires to live a calmer life. However, some never tire of battle and continue fighting until their last breath. Most of these Griffons are scarred and have lost limbs, but that does not stop them from taking flight and waging as much war as they did in their youth.
menagerieDialog: (It's preening its feathers.)
(It's screeching uncontrollably while digging its claws into the ground.)
(It seems to be quite lonely. Perhaps you should summon a she-Griffon to keep it company.)
(It's pretending to be hungry, but you know full well that it has already eaten more than its fair share of food. Greedy little slob.)
(It shies away from your touch. It clearly doesn't want to be bothered right now.)
name: Griffon Veteran

lore: This creature is the brightest of the Paragons, and the most ornate. This is because it is greatly skilled at working all kinds of minerals, including the one that is part of its body. However, it does not like working with small objects, and is dedicated exclusively to directing or working on large constructions, many of which have gone down in history for their size and beauty.
menagerieDialog: Your Eminence, please allow me to rest for a bit. It's been a long day.
We must constantly re-evaluate our battle strategies to ensure that our foes can never get the best of us.
Everett is a liar. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Two Paragons make a King Paragon. Two King Paragons make a Gold Paragon. Two Gold Paragons make a Grandpa Paragon.\n\nWait, what?
Something is amiss. I cannot say what is wrong for certain, but I am unable to shake this feeling of dread.
name: Bismuth Paragon

lore: This creature is not really a Phoenix, but an automaton programmed by the Auditors to eliminate any outsider who manages to break through the barrier surrounding the city of Ubi Concordia. Its flight is as deft as that of other Phoenixes, but its call is metallic, high-pitched, and extremely unpleasant. The energy released by its wings and tail damages both organic tissue and stone or metal, and it can exhale bursts of it through its jaws when it enters combat.
menagerieDialog: (It's preening its feathers, plucking out the ones that are damaged from battle.)
(It screeches and spreads its wings, showering you in a coat of dusty ash.)
(It's closely studying its environment, as if trying to note where every single object in your castle is located.)

(You are confident that a Phoenix's so-called resurrection is merely a parlor trick. Whenever it "revives", it seems to have no recollection of its past life. Someone is probably just replacing this creature with a new one when it dies.)
(It gently pecks at your hand. Perhaps it's hungry. But what do Phoenixes even eat?)
name: Divine Phoenix

lore: Crowds of these creatures can be seen in the spring and summer, when the forests are lush. At the top of the trees, Nax Rift Dancers perform a frantic dance that seems to unleash a storm of leaves. Nearby animals often observe their movements carefully, without showing any fear beyond the initial surprise, probably due to the sudden noise.
menagerieDialog: (For a Rift Dancer, it's not very active.)
(It keeps trying, without any success at all, to get you to dance with it.)
(It's looking at you expectantly. Unfortunately, you're not sure what it desires.)
(This creature really needs to exercise some moderation. It plays games just a little too often for your liking.)
(It's fluttering around the menagerie, pacing back and forth repeatedly.)
name: Nax Rift Dancer

lore: Kaito was razed to the ground by the Watchers thousands of years before the Seraphs existed. Gonfurian claimed the ruins of that kingdom, and they became part of his realm. When the Unification War came to an end, many Seraphs of the newly founded Rodia had lost their wings and ability to reproduce due to the fall of the kingdoms they served, or rather, those they were forced to serve. However, a group of these homeless Seraphs came to Surathli and asked for mercy. The Goddess pondered for a moment and decided to give them back their ability to spawn new Seraphs, uniting them all into one single lineage. These Seraphs all took different paths, but they always used their new blade to carry out the designs of the forces of good. Some of them began to protect the ruins of Kaito from looters. Given the great cultural value of those ruins, archeologists and historians began calling these creatures "Keepers of Knowledge", or even "Kaito Seraphs", as they are commonly known today.
menagerieDialog: Long past are the days when we brandished our swords for a real cause... Have you even tried speaking with your enemy before resorting to violence?
Trust no one. Even the gods are known for their paper-thin allegiances.
When a kingdom falls, its Seraph is destroyed as well. Perhaps humans should think twice before blindly heading to war with each other.
I am proud to serve under the {CASTLENAME} banner. Thank you for having me.
I find it difficult to trust humans. Do not let me down.
name: Kaito Seraph

lore: The mace of a Valkyrie Priestess glows with powerful light as it strikes her enemies. It can also create luminous spheres, useful in dark caves or in the dead of night. During the final battle of the Unification War, they used this ability to confuse Sigmund's troops and get their attention.
menagerieDialog: (She spends most of her free time relaxing. Is she really a Valkyrie?)
She's waving her weapon around and striking various battle poses. She must be eager to fight.
(It's completely absorbed in sharpening its weapon and polishing its armor.)
(She is extremely protective of your other creatures. If only your entire team had such camaraderie...)
(She's parading back and forth around the menagerie. You really wish she'd stand still for a moment.)
name: Valkyrie Priestess

lore: This creature sleeps at night and goes hunting when the sunlight begins to appear on the horizon. It usually inhabits cold places and migrates when the warm season arrives, if the temperature is not low enough for snow, as they sleep and nest in rocky crags covered with snow to hide from predators, only sticking their heads out.
menagerieDialog: (It gently nuzzles you, which is quite discomforting considering it's a Bat.)
(It tries to nip at anyone who gets too close, including you. So moody!)
(Everett claims this creature can read, which cements your opinion that he is extremely weird.)
(It moves just a little too fast for your liking. It's unsettling.)
(It's fiddling with a piece of lint it stole from your pocket earlier.)
name: Angel Bat

lore: Some Imps come to live in towns and cities inhabited by humans and other intelligent species. There, a few find their way through the teachings of Surathli. The most fanatical among them are the Imp Bishops, whose purpose is spreading the word of Light. As expected, their people welcome them with open arms, arms that hold sacks of rotten fruit to throw at high speeds towards their faces.
menagerieDialog: Got any more of them feel-goods?
We go visit Torun and spit on altar! Go now!
We go to war... without crab helmets? No, no. Stupid. Very stupid.
(It's wearing a crab on its head while eating a bunch of mushrooms, many of which are sure to be poisonous.)
Step one, take feelgood of choice. Step two, mash in hands. Step three, eat. Step four, enjoy!
name: Imp Bishop

lore: Some Arachnalisks are capable of producing a very hard web, as sharp as a knife or a sword. They are known as Razorweb Arachnalisks, and instead of attacking their enemies with their claws or fangs, they do so with their own special webs, although they cannot weave them in large quantities. These weapons can be thrown as if they were spears, as well as serving as a melee weapon.
menagerieDialog: (These creatures are a real plague... but they can be useful in battle.)
(It's surrounded by a bunch of massive, human-sized cocoons. But why are they moving?)
(It's making a high-pitched screeching noise. You're not quite sure what that means, but it seems to be comfortable enough.)
(It hands you a little doll made out of web silk. Ugh.)
(It begins to raise up into the air as if it were floating, but upon closer inspection, its silken thread is just barely visible.)
name: Razorweb Arachnalisk

lore: The Centaur Khan carries the banner of its people. When a battle begins, it sets it up like a spear and charges its enemies, striking powerful blows with the stone-carved skull at the end of it. Sometimes, the wood that supports it ends up breaking, but that does not prevent it from fighting with what is left of the banner, or its fists, kicks, and shield.
menagerieDialog: Free me at once.
Let's go on a raid! I want to see a village burn down before nightfall!
We should adopt a more tactical strategy. Blindly rushing into battle is a sure way to lead to failure.
Let us leave here and conquer new lands together!
I am under a great deal of stress. A few battles should help me relax.
name: Centaur Khan

lore: Elf Monks are not the only ones who make the decision to fight without weapons. Some Elves learn to use their entire bodies as weapons and become Elf Brawlers. Every few months they organize a traditional tournament in which only these Elves fight in single combat to win the Belt of Purple Leaves. Of course, there is no betting on these matches, as the practice is banned in Elf lands.
menagerieDialog: The sound of elves singing at night is a spectacle worth witnessing.
No one shall trespass through our lands without consequences.
Elves fight best in the thick of a dense forest. Perhaps you should adjust our strategy accordingly.
Everyone tends to underestimate the Elves. We have proved that to be a mistake time and time again.
(It's cracking its knuckles nervously. You find it strange that it adopted a habit that is generally associated with humans.)
name: Elf Brawler

lore: The Aspen Ent is always accompanied by the unmistakable sound of the birds nesting in its head. Although it respects the cycle of life, it does not allow predators to feed on its guests. Many animals fear it for this reason, although this creature never goes beyond scaring them.
menagerieDialog: There is nothing quite like the clean air of a Rodian forest.
I'll make short work of anyone who dares desecrate nature.
This castle smells like a wasteland. I would prefer to leave this place at once.
I feel invigorated in your presence. Thank you for looking after me.
(A little bird is nesting in this creature's branches which is oddly endearing.)
name: Aspen Ent

lore: The Volcanic Gargantuan is one the world's greatest potential natural disasters, for obvious reasons. When Torun took the liberty of giving life to several volcanoes, Surathli and Azural gave him a good scolding. Vertraag also went to the Cutthroat Jungle, if only to enjoy the show. After a long discussion, Torun reluctantly made it so that these creatures would only be able to eject very hot rocks, which is still highly dangerous. Luckily, the creatures can only be found in volcanic areas.
menagerieDialog: IDIOT... FOOL... STUPID...\n\n(The Gargantuan continues to throw lazy, half-baked insults at you.)
NEED TO STOMP SOMETHING, AND FAST. PATIENCE LOW.
NEW HOBBY. WANT TO EAT YOUR SPELL GEMS NOW.
ME ABOUT TO HAVE MAJOR TEMPER TANTRUM. NOT KNOW WHY.
HUNGRY? FOOD FOR YOU.\n\n(It hands you a small pile of stones. Thanks?)
name: Volcanic Gargantuan

lore: The forested mountains of Neralim were the scene of vicious battles during the Watcher War, thousands of years before it became a kingdom. When it was all over, some of those mountains seemed to decide it was time to get up and leave.\n\nSummers in Neralim can be harsh due to the extreme heat and infrequent rains. When the vegetation starts to suffer, the Hanyac Tremor carries water from the rivers to help the forests of the kingdom.
menagerieDialog: (It seems to be infested with all manner of parasites. It's so care-free that it doesn't even groom itself!)
(This creature has propped itself up by its arms and is repeatedly slamming its torso into the ground in an attempt to start an earthquake. Real mature.)
(Despite its ultra-punchable face, this creature seems to be especially intelligent for a Tremor.)
(It's gazing upward at a nest of birds that have apparently decided to call its forehead home.)
(It's stomping down with its fists, one at a time. Annoying.)
name: Hanyac Tremor

lore: This creature's sight is stunted, but it can orient itself perfectly using its other senses. For this reason, the Villous Wolpertinger is the only one of its kind who can pose a threat overnight, occasionally surprising the Smiths in the Scarlet Mountains, who have taken to setting up traps to finish them off. Fortunately, they are very noisy and never stalk their prey, so they rarely manage to cause too much trouble for the Smiths.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up into a little ball with its eyes half-closed. A nap is imminent.)
(You're constantly amazed at how violent this creature is. Even after it has slain its foes, it continues goring them with its horn.)
(It's eating a pile of trash. Hm. To each his own.)
(It bucks at the air anxiously. Perhaps a drugged carrot will settle it down.)
(The creature is growling at you. Unfortunately for it, you can't take it seriously at all since it has a piece of food caught between its teeth.)
name: Villous Wolpertinger

lore: In times of crisis, Dragons can perform a ritual that literally materializes their faith in their own people. This extraordinary manifestation has no awareness and only obeys very simple orders, but in battle it is a formidable ally as strong as any other Dragon. When its services are no longer required, it disappears like a beam of light spreading in all directions.
menagerieDialog: I'll guard your treasure for you while you're away.
Your insignificantly short-lived existence must depress you. We Dragons live for thousands of years while humans live and die in the blink of an eye.
The air here is stagnant. You could at least add a window or two to allow a fresh breeze in here to freshen things up, you know.
Tell Nortah to polish my scales. It has been far too long since they've received the attention they deserve.
I hope to set off on an adventure of my own one day.\n\n(Yep, not going to happen.)
name: Dragon Spirit

lore: Raven Seers are seasoned psychics, capable of conjuring up images in other creatures' minds and reading their thoughts. Many of them take advantage of their powers to offer what they call clairvoyance services in exchange for a lot of money. Rodia's authorities pursue these activities, as they are considered fraud, but not anyone can stop these creatures. Generally, one or two veteran Magi with extensive knowledge of mentalism accompany the guard in charge of arresting a Raven Seer who is committing this crime.
menagerieDialog: I'd be more useful in a laboratory. Perhaps you should allow me to stay back home with Castor?
Careful research and preparation are the precursors to victory.
Make sure all your Spell Gems are fully charged before we leave. To be attacked with dull gems is to be caught with one's pants down around one's ankles.
Legends speak of a hidden relic that does not belong to any of the gods. I wonder if there's any substance to this rumor.
I can't help but feel a deep sense of foreboding. Perhaps I need to take some time away from this adventure.
name: Raven Seer

lore: Some Shapeshifters have a genetic mutation that prevents them from maintaining a specific shape for long. They are also unable to fully control what they transform into and fail many times, becoming a palm tree, for example, rather than a fir. In addition, when they change shape, the result is always disastrous and unpleasant to look at. In Shapeshifter societies, these peculiarities are not considered strange or a defect. However, they know very well that their transformations scare other species, so they are often in charge of driving bad-intentioned visitors away.
menagerieDialog: I'm a big fan of the cuisine around here. My compliments to your chef.
(It transforms into a cat right before your very eyes.)
I'd prefer that you keep your kingdom small. I'm not good with large crowds.
(It transforms into a perfect copy of you. You never realized just how imperfect you look.)
We Shapeshifters invented the concept of Fusion. You're welcome.
name: Unstable Shapeshifter

lore: Even though Evil Vortices also participated in the Watcher War, many began to call them that due to their appearance and peculiarities. All light around an Evil Vortex is inevitably absorbed by it. Even on a bright morning with totally clear skies, the space around an Evil Vortex somehow seems darker.
menagerieDialog: (It whirls around in circles, emitting a powerful light.)
(It whirs around the menagerie, annoying your other creatures who are trying to rest.)
(This creature's presence is particularly welcome in the stuffy confines of these castle walls.)
(It's starting to lose its luster - it might be time to feed it another Spell Gem.)
(This creature is surprisingly small when it's not wreaking havoc with its winds.)
name: Evil Vortex

lore: The blue flames of the Lich Netherwalker are cold and make no sound. Anyone who comes into contact with them will see their willpower tested. If they are not strong enough, they will become this creature's puppet for twenty-four hours. Unfortunately, once its influence over its victim wanes, it can simply produce more flames to control them again, repeating the process indefinitely and turning the victim into a puppet for the rest of their days if it so wishes.
menagerieDialog: I'll sleep when I'm dead.\n\nWhich happens to be right now. Good night!
You are far too merciful on your subjects. Punishment breeds obedience, and you'd do well to learn that fact.
Knowledge is power, and I have a lot.
The ancient evil survives.
We must seek out the Necronomicon. With it, my true power will be realized.
name: Lich Netherwalker

lore: This creature is not really a Crusader, but an automaton created by the Auditors to protect Ubi Concordia. When it detects an enemy, the green lights on its neck blink in a random order. When it is active for a long time, the metal plates on its back get so hot that you could fry an egg on them. Indeed, if the creature does not stop to cool down in a timely manner, it will shut down to prevent damage to its structure.
menagerieDialog: (It appears to be sleeping, but everyone knows that Crusaders never sleep.)
(It appears to be uncharacteristically restless. It has probably spent too long cooped up in your castle.)
(Though this creature may appear to be simple-minded, you know it has great ambitions. Hopefully they align with your own.)
(Only this creature's unbreakable loyalty toward you prohibits it from wreaking havoc on your entire kingdom.)
(It's busy fidgeting with its maul in a rare display of unease.)
name: Heretic Crusader

lore: The Arcus Vulpes can change its fur color at will effortlessly. In this way, it can camouflage itself in all kinds of environments. However, it is also a skilled, energetic, and tenacious hunter, so it generally does not use its camouflage unless it is feeling too lazy to chase prey at that moment.
menagerieDialog: (You would have loved to keep one of these creatures as a pet when you were a child.)
(It's trying to provoke your other creatures into fighting it. It's all for play, though. You think.)
(It seems to have a lot on its mind. Perhaps a few battles would allow it to relax a bit.)
(With its head tilted, it gazes at you lovingly, causing your heart to melt like a pocket full of chocolates on a hot summer day.)
(It's chewing at the fur between its paws. Doesn't that hurt?)
name: Arcus Vulpes

lore: This creature is not really a Gargoyle, but an automaton that responds to the Auditors' orders. The barrier that protects the city of Ubi Concordia also hides it from view and magical scrying, although an extremely powerful Mage could bypass all these protections. If an intruder were to enter the city, the Steelheart Gargoyle would take flight and plummet on its target, spinning like a whirlwind to rip them apart with the edge of its pointed wings.
menagerieDialog: Is everything alright, my liege?
You drool in your sleep.
It is imperative that we always have a backup plan in case our original strategy doesn't work out.
(It's not moving at all. Not one bit, in fact. It's still as stone.)
(This creature could easily be mistaken for a statue.)
name: Steelheart Gargoyle
