lore: It is believed that the Nephilim were released from their prison after recent events in Rodia, but their numbers were not a cause for concern for the governments of the different kingdoms, until now.\n\nUnlike other Nephilim, the Skirmisher acts ruthlessly. This creature is a bloodthirsty assassin who searches for purehearted people for the sole purpose of bathing its weapon in blood. It prioritizes those with the purest convictions, but it also attacks even the worst scum, as even they have done good at some point in their lives.
menagerieDialog: I will protect my brethren at all costs. You don't need to worry for their safety as long as I'm around.
None will stand in my way. I have a mission to fulfill, and nothing will stop me from finishing my duties.

I would feel much more comfortable with a different set of creatures fighting by my side. Have you considered employing a more meaningful strategy?
We're in good company with you as our leader, {PLAYERNAME}.

lore: When Arcadia became the Path of the Damned, the Angels who had survived the epic battle transformed into the Nephilim.\n\nOf all the Nephilim, the Cleric is probably the most dangerous. A low murmur heralds its presence, similar to that of the wind caressing the ruins of a desolate city. Anyone who listens to it long enough will become an agent of evil until this creature is destroyed. The more light there is in that person's heart, the longer it will take to be converted, and the crueler their acts will be.
menagerieDialog: I will protect my brethren at all costs. You don't need to worry for their safety as long as I'm around.
None will stand in my way. I have a mission to fulfill, and nothing will stop me from finishing my duties.

We're in good company with you as our leader, {PLAYERNAME}.

lore: Nephilim are drawn to good intentions and pure hearts. They seek to subdue them and turn them to ashes. The Nephilim Scion's powers allow it to confuse the thoughts of anyone within reach, sowing doubt about the intentions of others towards them. Recently, one of these creatures appeared in the village of Hutika and quietly passed through as its inhabitants went about their work. That night, the village had turned into smoking rubble, and every Uralos in it had become a soot-covered corpse.
menagerieDialog: I will protect my brethren at all costs. You don't need to worry for their safety as long as I'm around.
None will stand in my way. I have a mission to fulfill, and nothing will stop me from finishing my duties.

lore: The Revenants have always been busy fighting each other, but in the past many of their peoples temporarily united to confront the Krakens.\n\nSome Krakens feel curious about the surface, especially Inkjet Krakens, who find the warmth of the sun on their head and tentacles pleasant and very relaxing. When humans and other intelligent creatures took to the sea, armed with weapons and magic, these creatures became endangered. Those who could shoot the most ink were the ones with the highest chances of survival, so nowadays, thanks to evolution, no one can find them after they release it.
menagerieDialog: (It's making unintelligible groaning noises accompanied by wet coughs. Gross.)
(It's squirming around on its stool, clearly uncomfortable with the seating arrangements provided by your Menagerie.)
(Its eyes seem to be staring straight into nothingness. It's quite unsettling.)
(Every so often, Nortah throws a bucket of water on this creature to keep it from dying.)
(The high intelligence of this creature is quite surprising given its passive demeanor.)
name: Inkjet Kraken

lore: The ocean is teeming with sea creatures that Krakens can feed on, which is why a Rodian scientist theorized centuries ago that Krakens only attacked Rodian ships for fun. However, in reality, only Kraken Shipbreakers do this, and not for fun, but because large ships scare away the prey on which they feed. Today, ships are equipped with a state-of-the-art magical device that mitigates the vibrations produced when sailing, so these Krakens are no longer a problem on high sea routes.
menagerieDialog: (It's making unintelligible groaning noises accompanied by wet coughs. Gross.)
(It's squirming around on its stool, clearly uncomfortable with the seating arrangements provided by your Menagerie.)
(Its eyes seem to be staring straight into nothingness. It's quite unsettling.)
(Every so often, Nortah throws a bucket of water on this creature to keep it from dying.)
(The high intelligence of this creature is quite surprising given its passive demeanor.)
name: Kraken Shipbreaker

lore: Revenants know Krakens will attack small groups of them if they get too hungry, so they set all kinds of ingenious traps for these creatures, as they are a great food source for their species.\n\nFor centuries, the Unblinking Kraken was thought to cause thunderstorms on the high seas, since many ships spotted these creatures when they occurred. However, rather than controlling the weather, Unblinking Krakens simply enjoy the sensation of the raindrops falling on their skin.
menagerieDialog: (It's making unintelligible groaning noises accompanied by wet coughs. Gross.)
(It's squirming around on its stool, clearly uncomfortable with the seating arrangements provided by your Menagerie.)
(Its eyes seem to be staring straight into nothingness. It's quite unsettling.)
(Every so often, Nortah throws a bucket of water on this creature to keep it from dying.)
(The high intelligence of this creature is quite surprising given its passive demeanor.)
name: Unblinking Kraken

lore: Thousands of years ago, Krakens were the greatest danger in the deep, relegating the Revenants to living in ocean caves and crevices to survive their constant attacks. Over time, the Revenants' weapons and techniques allowed them turn things around, so now Krakens only see them as emergency food, not to be taken lightly.\n\nThe Ironside Kraken's shell is so hard that the Revenants stopped using metals and minerals for their weapons and armor after they learned how to deal with these creatures. Some of their buildings are also made out of these shells.
menagerieDialog: (It's making unintelligible groaning noises accompanied by wet coughs. Gross.)
(It's squirming around on its stool, clearly uncomfortable with the seating arrangements provided by your Menagerie.)
(Its eyes seem to be staring straight into nothingness. It's quite unsettling.)
(Every so often, Nortah throws a bucket of water on this creature to keep it from dying.)
(The high intelligence of this creature is quite surprising given its passive demeanor.)
name: Ironside Kraken

lore: Krakens were a danger to humans who sailed the high seas. But above all, they have been a serious threat to the Revenants for centuries, as both species inhabit the ocean depths.\n\nNo other Kraken sowed as much fear and destruction as the Hundredhand, who can catch dozens of Revenants at once with its tentacles. Today, Revenants catch these creatures and keep them in cages, feeding them and cutting their tentacles daily as they continually regenerate, making them a virtually limitless food source.
menagerieDialog: (It's making unintelligible groaning noises accompanied by wet coughs. Gross.)
(It's squirming around on its stool, clearly uncomfortable with the seating arrangements provided by your Menagerie.)
(Its eyes seem to be staring straight into nothingness. It's quite unsettling.)
(Every so often, Nortah throws a bucket of water on this creature to keep it from dying.)
(The high intelligence of this creature is quite surprising given its passive demeanor.)
name: Kraken Hundredhand

lore: Krakens are grotesque, ruthless creatures who avoid approaching dry land at all costs. Most of them live in the depths and do not poke their heads out of the water very often, while the Abyssal Kraken never does. Other Krakens consider it an absolute sovereign, and only under its command are they able to carry out joint attacks. Although in ancient times their strategies overwhelmed the Revenants, nowadays the Abyssal Kraken's main task is help as many Krakens as possible to survive when one of their nests is discovered.
menagerieDialog: (It's making unintelligible groaning noises accompanied by wet coughs. Gross.)
(It's squirming around on its stool, clearly uncomfortable with the seating arrangements provided by your Menagerie.)
(Its eyes seem to be staring straight into nothingness. It's quite unsettling.)

(The high intelligence of this creature is quite surprising given its passive demeanor.)

lore: Yerah, a powerful Death Mage from Rodia, traveled to other kingdoms with the purpose of gaining wealth by scaring villagers with her own creations, later getting rid of them with a simple Dispel Magic spell, and thus collecting a reward in gratitude for her supposed heroism. The Cranium Cluster, however, was too powerful for her to control, and she ended up fleeing from it when she could not kill it. The town was massacred, but Yerah did not give up. She perfected her technique and managed to create an army of Cranium Clusters from the corpses of the less powerful, but obedient villagers. She managed to destroy her past creation, and then ceased her activities, but not before sending the surviving Cranium Clusters to the Path of the Damned. She had rendered them harmless, but by coming into contact with the skulls that were there, they gave life to others like them, but more aggressive, dangerous and terrifying.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Cranium Cluster

lore: This terrifying creature dwells in the seafloor of the east Rodian seas. Advances in the field of magic have long allowed it to walk on the surface without drowning or exploding into a thousand pieces due to the pressure differences between the two environments. It is very patient and can spend hours, even days, lurking in the darkness while waiting for a fish to run into one of its terrible pincers. However, this technique is useless on the surface, so it will wait and wait without any prey approaching it until it starves.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Proto-Brachyura

lore: This Golem was recently built to help in the forge, but its lack of technique and its excessive strength quickly made it clear it is not well-suited for this purpose. However, in battle it is a threat to be reckoned with. Just one of its blows can crack a sturdy shield, and its metal armor allows it not to take any damage from most blows. When it is in trouble, it uses its hammer-shaped hands to deflect or block its enemies' attacks.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Petrafortis

lore: Tired of his students using an abacus behind his back to solve exercises in class, a math teacher decided to take desperate measures by contacting someone versed in the art of magic. His salary, unfortunately, did not allow him to hire the services of an expert, so he decided to search the underworld until he found someone. After a long haggling session, a price was agreed upon, and two weeks later that Mage handed the professor a box. He was satisfied, and opened it in the middle of class with the intention of scaring his students, saying 'This is what happens when you use an abacus too much, so be caAAAAAARGH!' The Abacus turned out to be more aggressive and vastly more dangerous than anticipated, and amid the laughter of his students, the teacher ran out the door with the Abacus chasing behind him.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Abacus

lore: In addition to the worship of the Gods, there are minor alternative religions without any real divine representation. However, a sufficient number of believers can succeed in materializing less powerful creatures through unwavering faith. This is the case of the Forgotten Disciple, a creature that the villagers of a small town lost in the mountains treated like a deity. However, over many generations, the locals began to migrate to larger cities and towns, until the Forgotten Disciple saw the last adherents of the faith that had brought him to life die of old age. But that could not be the end. The Forgotten Disciple concluded that it he ate the corpses of its followers, the faith would re-emerge. Naturally, it had no effect, so it decided to go out in search of more corpses, in hopes of achieving its goal.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Forgotten Disciple

lore: Some Mages in the kingdom of Ercath can establish a special bond with a single animal that is called a minion. In this way, they are not only able to channel spells through this link, allowing the minion to cast them, but the minions themselves gain human-like intelligence, as well as the ability to learn magic on their own. Their longevity tends to increase notably, although in the case of turtles, for example, the opposite occurs. On many occasions, the Mage dies before the minion, creating an Orphaned Minion. Some decide to leave Ercath and travel to other places on their own, such as Rodia.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Orphaned Minion

lore: The Beacons are fairies that protect a forest located in between four mountains to the north of Siralim, making it difficult to access.\n\nThe wings of the Atlas Beacon are always engulfed in flames. However, the fire this creature produces does not affect the fauna and flora of its habitat at all. When it attacks, it spins on itself, turning into a deadly whirlwind of fire.
menagerieDialog: (It's fluttering around in seemingly random directions. Doesn't it ever get dizzy?)
(Despite the countless trials and tribulations your other creatures have overcome during your travels, it's comical to witness their discomfort in the proximity of harmless bugs and insects.)
(This creature's elegance and beauty are eclipsed only by its vicious battle prowess.)
(The patterns on its wings signify the location it was born. You can't help but wonder where you ripped it away from when you summoned it.)
(Its wings emit a brilliant light that can illuminate even the gloomiest of places.)
name: Atlas Beacon

lore: Beacons reside in a forest where an intelligent species, now extinct, used to live thousands of years ago. The trees are covered in paintings of vivid colors, and even today they have not been deciphered.\n\nOn the battlefield, the Luna Beacon's flight becomes an unpredictable whirlwind full of feints and sharp turns. It always uses the lower part of its body to strike, which is hard as iron.
menagerieDialog: (It's fluttering around in seemingly random directions. Doesn't it ever get dizzy?)
(Despite the countless trials and tribulations your other creatures have overcome during your travels, it's comical to witness their discomfort in the proximity of harmless bugs and insects.)

lore: The two Magi who created the Beacons were inexperienced, and though they were successful, they lost their lives to exhaustion in the process of creating them.\n\nThe Lappet Beacon is the only one of its kind able to pollinate flowers, though it does so in fair measure so as not to alter the ecosystem in which it resides. Its arms reach up to five feet, allowing it to immobilize or trip its enemies.

lore: Two Nature Magi gave life to the Beacons centuries ago through a complex ritual designed by Zonte himself, before he became a God.\n\nThe Death's Head Beacon's terrifying appearance earned it its name, though it is not any more dangerous than other creatures of its kind. The flames its body produces work exactly like the Atlas's flames, so only outsiders who wander into the forests they inhabit have to worry about them.

lore: Beacons do not interfere with the fauna and flora of the forest they inhabit. However, visitors must be extremely careful, as Beacons have been known to mercilessly attack together when they witnessed the slightest interference.\n\nThe Pellucid Beacon's colors flash with great intensity when it enters combat. It uses this ability to make the direction of its movement more difficult to predict, as well as to intimidate its enemies.
menagerieDialog: (It's fluttering around in seemingly random directions. Doesn't it ever get dizzy?)

lore: Beacons feed only on flowers, but are able to survive by eating just a few every day. To maintain the forest's balance, they often plant trees and shrubs so that other species are not affected by their presence. All beacons participate in this activity, but the Rosy Beacon has the most important role in it, as it is the only one who can create flowers with its power. In this way, it can help the bees with pollination, or its own kind to feed themselves on a particularly rough year.
menagerieDialog: (It's fluttering around in seemingly random directions. Doesn't it ever get dizzy?)
(Despite the countless trials and tribulations your other creatures have overcome during your travels, it's comical to witness their discomfort in the proximity of harmless bugs and insects.)

lore: These sea dragons are well aware of the greed of humans and other intelligent species. Over the years, they spread a legend that says each of these dragons has an orb capable of granting infinite wishes. Obviously, anyone with common sense would not believe such nonsense, but a surprising number of individuals were stupid enough to lead hundreds of expeditions from all over the continent in search of these orbs. The Seiryu leave insultingly obvious clues that make their prey overconfident, leading them to believe they are endowed with sublime intelligence. When a ship reaches the place where the orb is supposed to be, a Seiryu causes a whirlwind by twisting and turning under the ship until it sinks. Its goal is not treasure or revengeâ€”the creature is simply having fun.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Seiryu

lore: There is a region of Ercath that worships a species of white tiger that lives in the western jungle. These creatures are extremely aggressive and very dangerous, but if trained from a young age they can be obedient, making them exceptional allies. Ercath's western guard has trained many specimens, and they can be told apart from the wild ones by the blue capes, gold-plated crowns, and rings that adorn their heads and tails.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!

lore: In the northernmost mountains of Rodia, which border the Bronze Sea, lives a unique creature called Genbu. At first glance, it may look like a snake going through a turtle, but the truth is they are a single body, and in fact, the snake has no consciousness and is controlled entirely by the turtle's brain. To hunt prey, it hides both of its heads within its shell, making it look like a rock. Depending on the prey, one head or another will emerge, the fastest and weakest creatures being eaten by the snake, and the slowest and strongest ones by the tortoise.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Genbu

lore: Suzakus are majestic birds that have flown over the Great Pandemonium since the dawn of civilization. They can withstand extremely high temperatures, even those of lava, and they detest the cold to the point of spitting fire left and right in order to heat up the environment. When one of these creatures thinks it has a parasite, it dives into the magma to immediately end the parasite's life. Vulcanar often points at these creatures while they are taking a bath to try to convince someone to jump into the molten rock with them.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Suzaku

lore: These creatures often take human forms to observe the daily life that takes place in Rodia and other nations. However, they never interact with anyone or bother to learn any languages. They just enjoy watching people, especially when they are happy. In their dragon form they only interact with other dragons, and often promote peaceful attitudes. Indeed, on many occasions they receive visits from one or more dragons who seek their help to settle their differences. However, a few of them end up following dark paths after witnessing the greed and selfishness of other species.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Huanglong

lore: These dragons can emit a flashing light once a day through their horns that blinds their enemies for several seconds. They often use this ability when they are surrounded, which allows them to flee... most of the time. Some creatures, such as Imps, have learned to close their eyes at the precise moment a Kirin flashes, and have also perfected various strategies to capture them. Everyone, even Imps, knows a Kirin's horn cannot flash when separated from its body. However, owning one of these horns gives prestige to the Imp clan that has it. Obviously, Kirins do not find this amusing, since even if they are never killed and their horns grow back, they suffer during capture and extraction. For this reason, they have started to destroy Imp houses at night, and shredding the stolen horns with their hoofs as revenge and warning.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Kirin

lore: The Mythicants took shapes related to the three novels based on the diaries an Andolian soldier wrote during the Unification War. Anyone in possession of one of its pages can control a Mythicant.\n\nThe Mythicant Populi uses its book and blade to protect itself from enemy attacks. Unlike other Mythicants, it materializes words outside of battle that float above its head and describe what it is doing at all times.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)
(The runes on its flesh glisten vibrantly as it moves. Such an interesting creature.)
(Your nightmares will henceforth be plagued by visions of an army of these creatures chasing you around the castle.)
(Despite its form, this creature is capable of moving and flexing its limbs in all manner of unnatural positions.)
name: Mythicant Populi

lore: Mythicants do not do much besides training, sleeping, or chasing mice, though they always defend the victim when they witness an assault.\n\nThe mace of the Mythicant Solis does not always have the same shape. When it attacks an enemy and hits them with its weapon, the round part of it transforms into words that cause damage. As soon as this creature pulls back the hilt, the mace instantly returns to its former appearance.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)
(The runes on its flesh glisten vibrantly as it moves. Such an interesting creature.)
(Your nightmares will henceforth be plagued by visions of an army of these creatures chasing you around the castle.)
(Despite its form, this creature is capable of moving and flexing its limbs in all manner of unnatural positions.)
name: Mythicant Solis

lore: Accidents in magic towers during the numerous experiments that have taken place throughout history were not exactly rare. And although nowadays they do not occur so often in magic universities, the origin of the Mythicants is one of these exceptions.\n\nThe Mythicant Calti spends most of the day sleeping, though it also likes to chase mice or play with other cats. It often uses the three orbs that orbit around it to play with its friends.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)

name: Mythicant Calti

lore: Mythicants were born in Andolin due to an unfortunate ritual, as well as the magic contained in several novels based on the struggles of an Andolian soldier during the Unification War.\n\nThe sword of the Mythicant Palmira turns to ash as soon as it stops holding the handle. When this happens, it can create a new one by simply touching another pile of ash.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)
(The runes on its flesh glisten vibrantly as it moves. Such an interesting creature.)

lore: Mythicants are not aggressive unless they are in danger or unless they have been given orders. They are able to materialize words with negative connotations and use them to harm their enemies.\n\nIn the case of Mythicant Pryderis, it is their arrows that become words once they are fired from the bow. There are only six arrows in their quivers, but as soon as one of them hits, it disappears and re-materializes behind it in its original form.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)

name: Mythicant Pryderis

lore: In order to create books that could convey their content through an artifical voice, an experiment was recently carried out that imbued a series of novels with a huge magical charge.\n\nThe Mythicant Erdhe's luminescent symbols are clearly visible at night. When it enters combat, they glow so brightly that staring at them is unpleasant.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)
(The runes on its flesh glisten vibrantly as it moves. Such an interesting creature.)

lore: Mount Hyvana was the site of one of the first battles of the Unification War. Vanelin's army wiped out the enemy in a matter of minutes, literally reducing them to ashes and severed limbs. After the victory of the Vanelites, they ordered the bodies to be buried. When the war ended, the daughter of one of these soldiers used the residual magic from the battle to cast a powerful spell meant to bring the dead back to life.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Gravewood Ghost

lore: James's pirates once went underwater to visit small Revenant settlements. In one of their temples, they found engravings of creatures none of them had ever seen before. According to Revenant culture, it was an intelligent species who inhabited the Boreal Ocean and went extinct thousands of years ago. Their knowledge of magic rivaled that of the Ravens, and they tried to rule over the depths until, one day, they suddenly stopped attacking the Revenants.\n\nThe Shambler Benefactor is all that is left of that species, and it has lost all vestige of its former intelligence. James's pirates jokingly decided to name it Benefactor, as they never would have become undead had it not been for its curse.
menagerieDialog: (You've always wondered how it's able to breathe outside of water.)
(Though it smells like dead fish, it is a formidable part of your team.)
(Not everything in life is beautiful. This creature is proof of that.)
(You can't help but wonder if this creature is in perpetual pain.)
(Yep, this creature will definitely haunt your nightmares until the end of time.)
name: Shambler Benefactor

lore: Deep in the lush Allimber valley, a tribe of orcs has thrived on the surface for millennia. Though many live quietly as hunters, a few are drawn by the stories of wealth and fame told by travelers and traders. With bows crafted from the forest's wood, these orcs leave their home to seek their own destiny beyond the valley.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Orc Bowman

lore: Effigies have the advantage of never needing to eat or rest, making them stand out from other creatures. On top of that, they're immune to every virus and bacteria known to exist. But their weakness lies in fungal parasites. If not caught quickly, an Effigy can lose its identity overnight, becoming a hollow shell with no emotions, memories, or will of its own.
menagerieDialog: (It sits perfectly still, threads and fabric intact, emitting a faint aura of protective magic.)
Feel the pinprick of my needles! Your pain is my pleasure!
The secrets of sympathetic magic are ancient and powerful. Care to learn what I know?
Strike me all you want - your pain will be reflected back tenfold!
(It's twitching and jerking in an unsettling rhythm, pins wobbling as it moves.)
name: Cursed Effigy

lore: Effigies were once a ruthless species that almost conquered an entire nation. Today, they coexist peacefully with humans and other intelligent beings in the great cities.\n\nThe Falconer Effigy is a master falconer, an impeccable hunter, and an expert explorer. Their services are among the most expensive â€” and the most reliable.
menagerieDialog: (It sits perfectly still, threads and fabric intact, emitting a faint aura of protective magic.)
Feel the pinprick of my needles! Your pain is my pleasure!
The secrets of sympathetic magic are ancient and powerful. Care to learn what I know?
Strike me all you want - your pain will be reflected back tenfold!
(It's twitching and jerking in an unsettling rhythm, pins wobbling as it moves.)
name: Falconer Effigy

lore: Effigies are firm believers in dismantling class systems. While nobility no longer holds much meaning, remnants of feudalism still linger, and the Knight Effigies are determined to put an end to it. These brave warriors are highly sought after, known for their physical toughness and unmatched swordsmanship, able to keep fighting even in the face of serious wounds.
menagerieDialog: (It sits perfectly still, threads and fabric intact, emitting a faint aura of protective magic.)
Feel the pinprick of my needles! Your pain is my pleasure!
The secrets of sympathetic magic are ancient and powerful. Care to learn what I know?
Strike me all you want - your pain will be reflected back tenfold!
(It's twitching and jerking in an unsettling rhythm, pins wobbling as it moves.)
name: Knight Effigy

lore: Centuries ago, in the forests of Andolin, a human society was known for its voodoo dolls. Things took a turn when the magic running through these cloth beings gave them intelligence, and they took matters into their own handsâ€”often in violent ways.\n\nThe Dancing Effigies are the life of the party, always leading the celebrations and filling the nights before battles with energy. Agile and swift, their spinning movements and speed make them a real threat in combat.
menagerieDialog: (It sits perfectly still, threads and fabric intact, emitting a faint aura of protective magic.)
Feel the pinprick of my needles! Your pain is my pleasure!
The secrets of sympathetic magic are ancient and powerful. Care to learn what I know?
Strike me all you want - your pain will be reflected back tenfold!
(It's twitching and jerking in an unsettling rhythm, pins wobbling as it moves.)
name: Dancing Effigy

lore: While no Effigy holds an official title, some are considered leaders among their kind. They're the sharpest and most cunning of their species, though calling them "noble" would be an exaggeration. After all, these creatures would never allow such privileges to exist within their own ranks. Still, they tend to dress in elaborate, eye-catching clothing, which is how the people of Siralim and other cities ended up dubbing them "noble."
menagerieDialog: (It sits perfectly still, threads and fabric intact, emitting a faint aura of protective magic.)
Feel the pinprick of my needles! Your pain is my pleasure!
The secrets of sympathetic magic are ancient and powerful. Care to learn what I know?
Strike me all you want - your pain will be reflected back tenfold!
(It's twitching and jerking in an unsettling rhythm, pins wobbling as it moves.)
name: Noble Effigy

lore: While Effigies can't lose blood, they do face other challenges during battle. The Healing Effigy typically trains in medicine, first aid, or nursing, giving them the ability to save countless creatures in a variety of situations. But above all, they're the masters of patching up wounds, treating burns, and handling the unfortunate mishaps that come with being a creature of buttons and cloth.
menagerieDialog: (It sits perfectly still, threads and fabric intact, emitting a faint aura of protective magic.)
Feel the pinprick of my needles! Your pain is my pleasure!
The secrets of sympathetic magic are ancient and powerful. Care to learn what I know?
Strike me all you want - your pain will be reflected back tenfold!
(It's twitching and jerking in an unsettling rhythm, pins wobbling as it moves.)
name: Healing Effigy

lore: Among the many creatures who coexist and trade across Siralim, Andolin, and other kingdoms, the Besieged Beasts stand out as especially intriguing. They emerge during battlesâ€”particularly city siegesâ€”to barter, taking advantage of the people's desperate needs. They accept all kinds of gold and jewels in return for ammunition, food, and healing supplies. Some regard them as lifesavers, but those who've tried to attack quickly saw them vanish, losing a trade that could have saved their lives. Historians tell that once, these beasts endured a terrible siege by a wicked witch, only to be rescued at the last moment by an army of humans and other beings.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Besieged Beast

lore: Lucanians have been integrated into society since the dawn of civilization, though many prefer simpler lives in wild environments, either living alone or in small communities.\n\nThe Lucanian Archunter has power over magical items. For instance, they can make any item emit a powerful light. As a result, many of them serve in the security forces of Siralim and other nations, dedicated to detecting illegal magical artifacts.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up, smoke gently rising from its nostrils as it rests.)
My draconic blood burns for battle! Let us hunt!
The ancient wisdom of dragons flows through my veins. What would you like to learn?
My scales are forged from the heart of mountains. None shall pass!
(It's flexing its wings restlessly, eager to take flight.)
name: Lucanian Archunter

lore: Lucanians have a silly sense of humor, usually revolving around bad puns.\n\nThe Lucanian Soulbinder is known for their ability to communicate with inanimate objects. They are highly imaginative and, as they can invent elaborate stories and sense the events that have occurred around inanimate objects, they are very convincing when telling tales.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up, smoke gently rising from its nostrils as it rests.)
My draconic blood burns for battle! Let us hunt!
The ancient wisdom of dragons flows through my veins. What would you like to learn?
My scales are forged from the heart of mountains. None shall pass!
(It's flexing its wings restlessly, eager to take flight.)
name: Lucanian Soulbinder

lore: Lucanians are known for drinking large quantities of alcohol and can get quite upset if they arrive at a tavern only to find it runs out of stock.\n\nThe Lucanian Illuminator can create highly realistic light illusions, and some even work in the entertainment industry in major cities or as nomadic performers traveling from town to town. However, the light they create can become tangible, allowing them to inflict real damage on their enemies.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up, smoke gently rising from its nostrils as it rests.)
My draconic blood burns for battle! Let us hunt!
The ancient wisdom of dragons flows through my veins. What would you like to learn?
My scales are forged from the heart of mountains. None shall pass!
(It's flexing its wings restlessly, eager to take flight.)
name: Lucanian Illuminator

lore: Lucanians are creatures skilled in both physical and magical attacks.\n\nSeveral floating swords constantly orbit the Lucanian Armiger, and anyone who tries to strike it risks being slashed by one of them. Even when they sleep, these swords levitate around them, speeding up if anything approaches.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up, smoke gently rising from its nostrils as it rests.)
My draconic blood burns for battle! Let us hunt!
The ancient wisdom of dragons flows through my veins. What would you like to learn?
My scales are forged from the heart of mountains. None shall pass!
(It's flexing its wings restlessly, eager to take flight.)
name: Lucanian Armiger

lore: Lucanians have learned to use magic to modify their vocal cords, allowing them to produce more complex sounds and communicate with other intelligent beings.\n\nThe Lucanian Windrider always nests in the peaks of high mountains, deep underground where no other creature would consider looking for food. They also have a fondness for collecting stones from different places, and their lair is always filled with an interesting assortment.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up, smoke gently rising from its nostrils as it rests.)
My draconic blood burns for battle! Let us hunt!
The ancient wisdom of dragons flows through my veins. What would you like to learn?
My scales are forged from the heart of mountains. None shall pass!
(It's flexing its wings restlessly, eager to take flight.)
name: Lucanian Windrider

lore: Often, Lucanians pretend not to know how to speak to avoid conversations they don't want to have, which has led to the widespread belief that not all of them can communicate.\n\nThe Lucanian Aspectal can see spirits and communicate with them mentally. When performing what seems like an exorcism, they're simply convincing the spirit to leave while mumbling invented syllables to make the ritual seem elaborate, so the client believes they're getting their money's worth.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up, smoke gently rising from its nostrils as it rests.)
My draconic blood burns for battle! Let us hunt!
The ancient wisdom of dragons flows through my veins. What would you like to learn?
My scales are forged from the heart of mountains. None shall pass!
(It's flexing its wings restlessly, eager to take flight.)
name: Lucanian Aspectal

lore: Who says eggs can't float on air? Why not? This powerful egg has transcended space, time, quantum physics, and anything else you can think of. It can be in multiple places at once, take on different shapes. Its shell might be lounging on a beach, soaking up the sun, or whatever shells do at the beach. Its egg white can turn into a cloud, and it even holds the yolk inside its soft, cotton-like fluff. The only limit is its imagination!
menagerieDialog: (They're nestled together, occasionally emitting soft peeping sounds.)
We may look fragile, but we'll crack some skulls!
Don't let our appearance fool you. We've got a few tricks up our... well, you know.
Our shells are tougher than they look. Bring it on!
(They're rolling around erratically, narrowly avoiding collisions.)
name: Egg Over Breezy

lore: Also known as the "Fierce Warm Egg," "Egg Slammed Into Molten Rock," or "Satan, Lord of the Underworld." This egg is more than just cookedâ€”it can withstand blazing heat and roll through lava like a fire-breathing dragon. It constantly leaks glowing yolk, though if it gets too hot, it'll lose its yolk altogether and stop oozing.
menagerieDialog: (They're nestled together, occasionally emitting soft peeping sounds.)
We may look fragile, but we'll crack some skulls!
Don't let our appearance fool you. We've got a few tricks up our... well, you know.
Our shells are tougher than they look. Bring it on!
(They're rolling around erratically, narrowly avoiding collisions.)

lore: Every good egg knows that hibernation ends long before Easter, a very special time for them. Still, some don't want to wake up. The real world can be a drag, after all. Big mistake! Wake up, eggâ€”you missed spring, and now plants are growing all over you. It's not the end of the world though, as long as your shell doesn't get crushed. A little extra coverage never hurt anyone.
menagerieDialog: (They're nestled together, occasionally emitting soft peeping sounds.)
We may look fragile, but we'll crack some skulls!
Don't let our appearance fool you. We've got a few tricks up our... well, you know.
Our shells are tougher than they look. Bring it on!

lore: "Being an egg never stopped me from becoming a detective," the Egg-Drop Sleuth said during the interview. "People think eggs are fragile and simple-minded, that you can just crack us open like we're good for nothing else," he said, shaking his magnifying glass. "But if we judged by looks alone, we'd never know that some eggs actually have two or three yolks inside!"

lore: The Egg-Front was never better protected than by the Romulette Order. From a young age, they're trained in the ancient art of the stone omeletteâ€”a cooking style that lets them create a tough shield out ofâ€¦ well, other eggs that didn't have the best of fates. Plus, they look pretty awesome in their helmets.

lore: No egg can escape the will of an Eggs Benedictator. Dressed in the finest colors and with an air of dignified simplicity, they lead their troops with a firm handâ€¦ or hard shell, into battle. Minimizing casualties is their goalâ€”if it's possible. Though it's a little tricky when your entire army is covered in shells that could break just by bumping into the kitchen counter.

Don't let our appearance fool you. We've got a few tricks up our... well, you know.

lore: This creature possesses extraordinary strength and a fierce aggression that's hard to control. It feeds on the life force of its victims, and every time it kills one, it temporarily grows more powerful by stealing their innate abilities for several minutes. It was created in a secret laboratory by the Ugeda River, where a group of renegade sorcerers sought to bring forth a creature that would help them amass great fortune.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Spectral Monarch

lore: From the very beginning, Spacecats adapted quickly and carved out an important place in society in record time.\n\nThe "Peculiar Spacecat" is what the people of Siralim have named this creature due to the striking green hue of its fur. Centuries ago, they were slaves on their home planet, altered with a gene that made them glow in the dark, turning them into easy prey for predators to prevent their escape. Today, they no longer possess this trait.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up in a floating ball, purring contentedly.)
Time to show these earthlings what a real predator looks like!
I've seen things you people wouldn't believe. Want to hear about them?
My space suit is impenetrable! Your puny weapons are no match for me!
(It's zooming around in erratic patterns, defying gravity.)
name: Peculiar Spacecat

lore: Don't let their polite and friendly nature fool you â€” Spacecats are some of the sharpest minds in the world. And when it comes to money, no one does it better than the Gold Spacecat. These financial wizards manage the entire Spacecat economy, offering top-tier advice on spending and investments. In no time at all, they've made their mark on the economies of Siralim and beyond.
menagerieDialog: (It's curled up in a floating ball, purring contentedly.)
Time to show these earthlings what a real predator looks like!
I've seen things you people wouldn't believe. Want to hear about them?

lore: Humans, in particular, feel a strong affinity for Spacecats, who never miss a chance to charm them with their wide array of feline antics.\n\nHundreds of years ago, Black Spacecats were the ones who ruled over all species on their home planet, including their own kind. Thanks to genetic engineering, they could blend into the night and see clearly through it. Today, all of that is but a dark chapter in their history, though it's worth noting that all Spacecats now share this high-definition night vision.

lore: Spacecats have only recently appeared in Siralim and other nations, and the Astral Spacecat is one of the most playful of them all. It's always seen with its beloved little ball, which it uses to show off amazing tricks! But what most don't realize is that the ball isn't just a toy â€” it's a sophisticated device that can read the emotions of any creature and transmit that information to its feline user.

lore: Most intelligent beings think highly of the Spacecats, though some suspect they're secretly plotting to take over other nations.\n\nDuring their journey through hyperspace, some Spacecats suffered severe shocks from unexpected quantum distortions. Now they've lost all sense of reason and become dangerously aggressive. Luckily, a special device can channel their fury toward a target â€” and even put them to sleep when needed.

lore: Spacecats have spent over a thousand years studying the behavior of humans and other creatures that inhabit this world.\n\nWhen a Spacecat reaches 80 years of age, its fur turns a mix of gray and black, resembling that of a Siamese cat. They are the voices of experience, leaders of their kind, and command great respect within their community. However, they don't make the final calls alone â€” the most important decisions, especially the ones of great consequence, are made collectively by their society.

lore: The Spelljuggler order is led by a famous sorcerer from Siralim who's been outwitting the authorities for over ten years.\n\nAs their name suggests, the Spelljuggler Connoisseurs are the ones who gather valuable information within Rodia's society. They're skilled in dealing information, often staying under the radar, but if you know who to ask, they're not hard to find.
menagerieDialog: (It's lazily floating a single spell orb above its palm.)
Watch as I juggle their lives away!
I know spells that would make your head spin... literally!
Can't hit what you can't catch! My defenses are impenetrable!
(It's tossing spells from hand to hand at dizzying speeds.)
name: Spelljuggler Connoisseur

lore: Spelljugglers are humans who've undergone a voluntary transfusion of altered blood, changing them forever.\n\nThe Spelljuggler Instructors guide the newcomers through this risky process, making sure they understand everything and succeed in their transformation. These instructors are the closest to their leader and are probably the only ones who truly know their leader's identity.
menagerieDialog: (It's lazily floating a single spell orb above its palm.)
Watch as I juggle their lives away!
I know spells that would make your head spin... literally!
Can't hit what you can't catch! My defenses are impenetrable!

lore: The Spelljugglers were once hunted by the authorities, but their leaderâ€”who knows the law inside outâ€”managed to prove that they weren't a criminal organization.\n\nSpelljuggler Bedazzlers have a special ability; they can instantly sense the power of magical objects without needing to touch them. They can also influence these objects, changing their nature, but only if another Spelljuggler is the one wielding them.

lore: Spelljugglers work alone or in small groups and only answer to their leader when necessaryâ€”usually to pay the 1% of their earnings, as per the contract they signed.\n\nKnown as "Preservers of Memories," Spelljuggler Conservators can record memories on magic-infused rocks. However, they can only record their own memories, and they must get permission from their creator to unlock those memories.

lore: Many humans join the Spelljuggler order to make a fortune, but others are after the power the altered blood gives them.\n\nSpelljuggler Opportunists are experts at reading Rodia's sociopolitical climate, and they can easily tell which jobs are worth taking and which ones aren't. This makes them skilled at striking deals, both with other Spelljuggler and mercenaries from outside their order.

lore: The Spelljugglers are a mercenary group that will join any cause as long as the reward is right.\n\nThe Spelljuggler Trapezists specialize in trickery, but they reserve these skills for shady organizations. Thanks to their powers, they can unlock hidden potential in their allies' minds, abilities that would normally stay dormant.

lore: Goblins from Litepo Island remained cut off from the world for millennia. Legend says they came after a slave ship sank, but it's uncertain whether they were the only ones who survived. Since there were no big animals around, they learned to hunt by hurling stones and sticks at small creatures like rodents, fish, and birds to get meat. Eventually, they created a weapon that was not only highly accurate and lethal but also returned to the thrower's hand by itself.

lore: Many fighters go to war torn between duty and regretâ€”wanting to defend their home but sorrowful over the lives they took. Though death claimed them through magic and steel, their spirits linger as lost souls chasing the justice they were denied. Splitsouls are often seen wandering roads traveled by bandits and killers, ever watchful and willing to protect those in peril.

lore: This amphibian's friendly appearance has fooled countless wrongdoers. In truth, it's incredibly strong and vengeful. Always carrying a pouch of gemstones, it's willing to barter for food, gear, or magic. Anyone who tries to scam or push a clearly dishonest trade will face its wrath, ending up beaten and robbed of their belongings.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.

lore: One jackal poses little danger to any fighter, but when they come in a swarm, the threat multiplies. Attacks across wide-open areas like prairies or barren plains can be deadly enough. Yet, the true nightmare is in rugged mountains or canyons, where these animals stalk silently and launch coordinated strikes from above, able to destroy a small group in moments.

lore: It's said The End was created by a careless wizard who was too lazy to take out the trash and got swallowed by the creature's crushing gravitational pull one night as he slept. In truth, this myth was spread by a student at the Magic University of Vanelin to ridicule the professor who created the creature. The kingdom's rulers quickly fired the professor and banned The End's use and spread, but smugglers still sell them on the black market.

lore: Along the shores of the continent and nearby islands dwell gentle flying creatures that survive mostly on carrion and fish near the water's surface. But during fierce storms, powerful winds can sweep them far from their homes, sometimes miles away. If they're threatened by land dwellers, their panic can trigger a brutal assault capable of wiping out whole settlements.

lore: A coven of witches, desperate to end a demon possession outbreak in their village, summoned the Soulwarper. This creature's bite can tear away parasitic spirits and return them to where they came from by swallowing them whole. However, Soulwarpers also consume dead wood, and once their soul feast was over, the witches were forced to banish them to save their houses from destruction.

lore: The Red Hat order isn't the only group that can channel magic into their melee or ranged weapons. Though officials advise against such practices without guidance, numerous mercenaries, soldiers, and bandits who pick up some magic specialize in this risky skill. Many grow into fearsome fighters, but occasionally, it ends with a sudden and violent burst of molten steel right in the would-be Spellsword's face.

lore: During the snowstorms of the winter solstice, an evil spirit stirs from its slumber to feast. This dangerous creature was once believed to devour the souls of its victims, but that myth has been completely debunked. However, some still believe that eating the carrot on its nose grants incredible powersâ€”everything from acquiring the abilities and memories of those the Snow Stalker has claimed to even achieving immortality. Though the legend no longer holds the weight it once did, hunting the Snow Stalker remains a cherished tradition.

lore: In the lush jungles, many creatures have evolved to blend seamlessly with their surroundings. The Celestial Scarapin, when hungry, hides its body in the foliage, leaving only its tail and wings visible, which resemble flowers. It waits for its prey to approach, then strikes with deadly precision. When attacking, it absorbs some of the damage and transforms it into energy that strengthens its skin.

lore: These watchdogs were originally used to guard bank vaults until 367 years ago, when they were replaced by stronger, often inanimate magical creatures. Most Doedoodles ended up as household pets, and over time, very few were trained for combat. But organized crime groups kept breeding and training them to be tougher, often enhancing them with magical treatments. Nowadays, their fur has become tougher, and parts of their body are covered in sharp, armored plates that are just as dangerous as their bite.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.

lore: In the Yselhof swamp, the Calumniers built their biggest cityâ€”so vast it can be seen from miles away when viewed from a high vantage point.\n\nCalumnier Fops are expert swordswomen. Recently, many have joined the famous Red Hat faction in Andolin's army after learning magic. One of them, Shavella, rose through the ranks to become a general thanks to her sharp mind and fighting skill.
menagerieDialog: (It's basking lazily in a patch of sunlight, eyes half-closed.)
Your enemies will rue the day they crossed paths with us!
Let's discuss battle strategies. I have a few ideas that might surprise you.
My scales are like armor, forged in the fires of battle!
(It's pacing back and forth, its tail swishing impatiently.)
name: Calumnier Fop

lore: Calumniers make their home in the swamps, building villages both on the ground and high up in the trees. They often link homes and shops with intricate hanging walkways.\n\nFierce and familiar with every inch of their territory, Calumnier Dandies guard the borders without rest, gliding silently through the underbrush or slipping beneath the surface to warn their kin of danger. These days, many work as mercenary spies or serve the various kingdoms that make up the land of Rodia.
menagerieDialog: (It's basking lazily in a patch of sunlight, eyes half-closed.)

lore: Trade deals between humans, other intelligent races, and Calumniers are common these days. Both sides benefit, and entire neighborhoods in cities like Siralim are made up almost entirely of Calumniers. Calumnier Socialites live in these urban areas. They move in high society and excel at trading information. But if threatened, they're skilled enough with a dagger to take down a group of enemies.
menagerieDialog: (It's basking lazily in a patch of sunlight, eyes half-closed.)

name: Calumnier Socialite

lore: In the great city of Eshal, a group of Calumniers decided to end the long feud with humans once and for all. They learned the human language and, using their diplomatic skills, forged a peace that has never been broken since.\n\nTrickery is the Calumnier Bete's greatest weapon. They often convince their enemies they can cast powerful spells, using crafted illusions of light and smoke that send foes running in fear.
menagerieDialog: (It's basking lazily in a patch of sunlight, eyes half-closed.)

lore: Calumniers have long fought humans and often found themselves outnumbered, losing many villages in the process.\n\nWhen it comes to close combat, no one beats the Calumnier Belles. They don't need weaponsâ€”their sharp claws can pierce even the toughest armor with enough training. In the city of Eshal, a famous dojo has stood for 40 years, drawing fighters from all races who want to master their deadly art.
menagerieDialog: (It's basking lazily in a patch of sunlight, eyes half-closed.)
Your enemies will rue the day they crossed paths with us!

lore: Calumniers and humans have made several agreements that allow them to live in peace. Most of these deals involve resource gathering in the swamps and permission to build roads through their lands without harming their villages or way of life.\n\nCalumnier Partycrashers are a newer group and don't live in the swamps. They're known for hanging out in shady taverns and starting fights over the smallest things. Still, their fighting skills have made them valuable assets in Rodia's criminal underworld.
menagerieDialog: (It's basking lazily in a patch of sunlight, eyes half-closed.)

lore: Marionettes are finely carved wooden figures brought to life by a strong spellâ€”they have no will of their own.\n\nMarionette Ballerinas constantly perform traditional folk dances from all over Rodia unless told to do something else. Even when carrying out simple tasks, if not told otherwise, they'll do it while dancing.
menagerieDialog: (It hangs limply, awaiting its next command.)
Pull my strings and watch me dance... a dance of death!
I may be controlled, but my mind is my own. Let me share my observations with you.
You can't hurt what isn't truly alive. I am invincible!
(It's jerking about wildly, its limbs flailing in all directions.)
name: Marionette Ballerina

lore: Marionettes aren't alive and don't have any awareness.\n\nThe Marionette Charlatan usually stays silent, but when faced with a pile of goods, it shouts out wild claims about their magical powers, trying to catch the attention of everyone nearby. Whether it's a simple rock or dog excrement, it'll try to pass it off as a miracle cure or a sacred talisman.

Pull my strings and watch me dance... a dance of death!

lore: Marionettes usually follow set programming, but their owners can take control anytime and command them to do anything.\n\nThe Marionette Demoiselle is fearless and rebelliousâ€”a fixture at every just protest, loudly standing up for what's right. They've helped stop evictions, reverse unfair firings, and fight injustice more than once.
menagerieDialog: (It hangs limply, awaiting its next command.)
Pull my strings and watch me dance... a dance of death!
I may be controlled, but my mind is my own. Let me share my observations with you.

lore: Marionettes require careful, regular upkeep to prevent damage from moisture and wood pests.\n\nThe Marionette Hypnotist was the very first of its kind, made to assist in hypnotherapy. But when left loose without clear commands, they cause troubleâ€”people end up doing strange things like trying to unlock tree bark with keys or drinking from shoes.

lore: In Rodia, buying a Marionette without a license from the local kingdom is considered illegal trafficking.\n\nPeople mistakenly think the Marionette Medium talks to spirits, but its real skill is piecing together information to sound like it's giving messages from beyond. Thanks to its intimidating presence, it's often hired as a bouncer in bars and clubs known for everything from minor scuffles to serious trouble.
menagerieDialog: (It hangs limply, awaiting its next command.)

lore: Some believe Marionettes are consciousâ€”there are even folk stories about itâ€”but studies say otherwise.\n\nThe Marionette Primadonna is a gifted singer who knows how to command attention at any party. In high society, a celebration isn't truly proper unless one of these Marionettes is the host.

lore: Traveling fairs often use several Marionettes in their acts, and Marionette Harlequins are the crowd favorite. They spin stories and effortlessly pull off dangerous acrobatics and juggling tricks that would take humans years to learn. In battle, they're tricky and loud, always ready to feint and counterattack.

(It's jerking about wildly, its limbs flailing in all directions.)
name: Marionette Harlequin

lore: Besides following preset routines, a Marionette's owner can give broad orders that require no micromanagement.\n\nPeople say no one plays the harp like a Marionette Virtuosoâ€”but really, anyone can get better than that with enough practice. Even so, since the only real cost is the Marionette itself, it's a good investment if one knows how to make the most of it.
menagerieDialog: (It hangs limply, awaiting its next command.)
Pull my strings and watch me dance... a dance of death!
I may be controlled, but my mind is my own. Let me share my observations with you.
You can't hurt what isn't truly alive. I am invincible!
(It's jerking about wildly, its limbs flailing in all directions.)
name: Marionette Virtuoso

lore: Mimplings are aggressive, relentless creatures with an insatiable hunger, capable of sensing happiness from miles away. While they'll kill if they have to, they prefer to feast whenever they can. They can feed on the brains of almost any living creature, but their particular fondness for those with positive emotions often means they'll go weeks, even months, without eating if they can't find the right prey.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Mimpling

lore: The Genetic Anomaly can store a vast array of objects and creatures within itself, slowly consuming them and absorbing the nutrients it can process. Preferring dark, damp environments like sewers, it is incredibly stealthy, allowing it to hunt without its prey ever knowing until it's too late. When its DNA merges with another creature's, it produces a substance capable of replicating some of their traits if consumed.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Genetic Anomaly

lore: Some editions of the Andolin novel which inspired these creatures were published with color illustrations. Through one of these versions, the Mythicant Chromis were born. They can resonate with others of their kind to create ephemeral copies of themselves that attack multiple enemies. Additionally, their strikes and spells materialize more vividly than expected, easily piercing through armor and magical defenses.
menagerieDialog: (Though this creature dons a humanoid appearance, its mannerisms are all but natural.)
(It speaks to you, but not in a tongue you're familiar with. You can only hope it wishes to communicate nothing of importance.)
(The runes on its flesh glisten vibrantly as it moves. Such an interesting creature.)
(Your nightmares will henceforth be plagued by visions of an army of these creatures chasing you around the castle.)
(Despite its form, this creature is capable of moving and flexing its limbs in all manner of unnatural positions.)
name: Mythicant Chromis

lore: While Uraloses are generally self-sufficient and prefer independence, some have integrated into Rodia's society over the past few decades. The Uralos Warchiefs are the strategists of their kind, leading their people with a cool, calculating mind to defend their lands. Without them, it is clear that the island they have inhabited since the dawn of time would have been invaded long ago.
menagerieDialog: You're lucky to have someone like me in your party. I'm much smarter than the average bear.
It's not that we get smarter as we grow older; it's that we run out of stupid things to do after a while.
What do you say we stop fighting for the day and have ourselves a pic-a-nic instead?
I hope to find myself a beautiful wife someday to bear my bears.
(It's snoring loudly, surrounded by the remnants of what was once a large, bountiful picnic basket.)
name: Uralos Warchief

lore: It was once believed that Plains Felkats were not intelligent creatures, but a scholar from Andolin set out to study them and proved this belief wrong. They simply didn't want anything to do with species prone to war. However, as times changed and trade grew, some humans began interacting with Plains Felkats, and once their incredible skills became clear, they started joining police forces across Rodia's towns and cities. They are fast, stealthy, and relentless. Their extremely keen sense of smell lets them track anyone from just a trace of blood, making it easy to catch many criminals.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Plains Felkat

lore: Fairies may seem cute, but no one dares approach a Dust Fairy. Known for spreading countless diseases, they've even caught the attention of scientists who hope to study them and develop vaccines. Some with less noble intentions release them in enemy camps, hoping the diseases they spread will weaken their foes before battle.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: Dust Fairy

lore: When the storms rage on the winter solstice, these malevolent spirits rise from the earth to consume anything alive. While they rest in the ground, waiting for the snow to form their bodies, some focus all their power into one arm, making it capable of delivering a single, devastating punch that can destroy anything in its path.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!
Give me freedom, or give me death!
name: One-Punch Snowman

lore: Once worshiped as river goddesses for their magic, Miracle Spiders dwell in caves near the river's source, using simple spells to catch fish. As cities grew, they started mixing more with humans and other races. Nowadays, many live in towns and often work as talented magic teachers.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.
You would dare to rip me from my portal and summon me to this dying world? You have no shame.
I am bound to serve you, but know that it is not by choice.
I do not belong here in your filthy Menagerie. I deserve my own quarters in your castle!

lore: In its day, the Brockiosaurus moved like it had been pushing mountains for centuries. Its cliff-like back was home to glowing lichens and wandering birds, and many mistook it for a rock formationâ€”until the ground began to creak. It's said the oldest druids consulted it like an oracle, carving questions futilely into its basalt shell. They went extinct quickly due to respiratory problems, but scientists revived them, drastically shrinking their size and making them faster.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)
RAWR! Time to show these puny creatures what real power looks like!
The wisdom of the ancients and the power of the elements are mine to command. What would you like to know?
My hide is infused with primal magic. Nothing can harm me!
(It's stomping around, leaving trails of elemental energy in its wake.)
name: Brockiosaurus

lore: Though many Elementasaurs went extinct ages ago, some survive to this day, whether naturally or by other means.\n\nRather than roar, the Thunder-Rex thunders like a summer storm. Its body stores atmospheric electricity like an organic battery and can unleash it all at once when attacking. Ancient tablets from a human clan depict it as the messenger of angry godsâ€”and rightly so: once it locks onto its prey, no rock or wall can stop it.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)
RAWR! Time to show these puny creatures what real power looks like!
The wisdom of the ancients and the power of the elements are mine to command. What would you like to know?

(It's stomping around, leaving trails of elemental energy in its wake.)
name: Thunder-Rex

lore: Elementasaurs existed long before humans.\n\nThe Triflaratops's glowing shell not only deters predators but also burns the vegetation it passes throughâ€”luckily, it only lives in deserts, volcanic zones, or even the Great Pandemonium. Legend says ancient human tribes used Triflaratops bones in rituals to call upon the sun.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)
RAWR! Time to show these puny creatures what real power looks like!

lore: Named for the chilling roars it lets out as it lunges, the Veliceoraptor is pure deadly speed. It hunts in packs and leaves no tracksâ€”except for the ice that forms under its feet, hard to spot in its natural habitat. Once thought a northern legend, blue bones found in glaciers tell a different story. Some time ago, scientists brought them back to life, but a security failure sent many to the Frostbitten Caverns, where they've thrived since.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)

lore: Elementasaurs live in lands far from the kingdom of Rodia and are highly prized by the dark elites of Siralim and other cities.\n\nThe Vinosaur exudes a greenish-black resin to mark its territory and dissolve prey. This resin, once purified, loses its corrosiveness but stays highly poisonous and won't harm the weapons it permeates. Among poison merchants, its bile is a prized commodity, though many who attempt to collect it fail to come back with enough hands to recount their story.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)

lore: The flight of the Windactyl is nearly invisible to the eye, but the deafening roar that comes before it clearly warns of its presenceâ€”usually when it's already too late. That's why this flying Elementasaur rules the most treacherous canyons. According to the monks of the Rada order, who built the Temple of the Sigh near the source of the Ponce River, hunting a Windactyl without being seen is a test of spiritual enlightenment.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)

lore: Ancloudysaurs are the only Elementasaurs that don't require food. Their bodies consist mainly of gas, and they absorb elements from the atmosphere to survive. Still, they need to drink waterâ€”or at least the elements it's made ofâ€”which they can combine internally if needed. Because they dwell miles above the ground, they remained unknown until about a hundred years ago.
menagerieDialog: (It's lounging peacefully, occasionally snorting small puffs of elemental energy.)

lore: The Melishell, native to the deep ocean, has adapted to life on land. Its shell hosts a variety of insects, who provide it with food in exchange for protection. While not the fastest creature, its claws can easily pierce the flesh of predators, leading most to simply ignore it rather than risk confrontation.
menagerieDialog: I do not wish to speak to you right now. I would prefer to return to where I came from.

lore: Robodomi don't feel emotions, but they can understand them and pick up on them through things like facial expressions or tone of voice.\n\nMechto was designed as an unstoppable weapon, but the tech still has a long way to go. Its quantum core can withstand a dragon's breath or an axe strike from a seasoned barbarian, but even the faintest breath of poisoned air that messes with its core will knock it out in an instant.
menagerieDialog: (It's powered down, occasional beeps and whirs emanating from its chassis.)
Extermination protocols activated. Targets acquired.
My processors can calculate a million strategies per second. How may I assist you?
Shields at maximum. No damage can penetrate my defenses.
System overclocked. Operating at 250% efficiency.
name: Zarnox

lore: Robodomi can learn from their experiences as they operate. It's helped them write books, compose music, and even come up with battle strategies.\n\nBlipzor was one of the first Robodomi prototypes ever made. At first, they exploded if they got even a little damaged because their energy core was so unstable. Over time, they became obsolete, but some engineering students made adjustments that helped stabilize the core to a degree.
menagerieDialog: (It's powered down, occasional beeps and whirs emanating from its chassis.)
Extermination protocols activated. Targets acquired.
My processors can calculate a million strategies per second. How may I assist you?

lore: Living beings and Robodomi share only the ability to see and hear the world. But Robodomi can process massive amounts of data in seconds with the help of certain devices.\n\nSome call Grivix the ultimate killing machine. It fires a deadly beam with perfect accuracy that tracks its target relentlessly, so not even the fastest creature can avoid it.
menagerieDialog: (It's powered down, occasional beeps and whirs emanating from its chassis.)
Extermination protocols activated. Targets acquired.

lore: Some Robodomi go into energy-saving mode, standing still and silent for hours. But even in this state, they can still share information. This is thanks to the Klyptar, which act as flawless receivers and transmitters between these synthetic beings, no matter how far apart they are.
menagerieDialog: (It's powered down, occasional beeps and whirs emanating from its chassis.)
